story:
When fellow bike messenger DARCY ALLAN SHEPPARD was slain as a result of a street-level altercation with a high-profile motorist, members of our professional transport workers' guild - HOOF&CYCLE - watched closely as the Ontario justice system, as well as our political hierarchy, and the nation's mainstream media, all struggled to maintain even the perception of impartiality in the ever-controversial case.

Less than a year after Sheppard died, all charges laid against the motorist - a former provincial attorney general, and at the time, a high-ranking, arm's length agent for the City of Toronto - were withdrawn. 

The provincially appointed independent prosecutor then read a fifty-page, untried theory of the case into the public record, while at the same time the voluminous Toronto Police Service investigative file was effectively buried, without ever being examined by the press, and so, the public. 



For the past five years, we at HOOF&CYCLE have been working to assist, Allan Sheppard Sr., the dead man's father, in his tireless quest to unearth the facts as to how and why his son died: What actually transpired, that night on Bloor Street between the bike-riding victim, Sheppard, and the officially "exonerated" motorist who ran him down and killed him without so much as a public reprimand?


HOOF&CYCLE is now finally ready to share all that we have uncovered, and at least one feature-length documentary is obviously the best way to present edited hours of audio/visual source material exhibits gleaned from the actual police files - witness statement videos, collision scene photos, official TPS diagrams, etc, - alongside the grainy security video which has been available on-line almost since day one. 

An 8 and 1/2 minute preview video of what and how we propose to document the facts - and then compare them to variously supported theories of the case - is again included here:

We offer a rare opportunity for engaged Ontarians -as well as all other supporters of equality under the law - to participate in challenging an at-the-very-least, commonly perceived travesty of justice. 

The opaque handling of the case disrespects the concept of equal justice for all in our home province.

Why, for instance, has a parade of Attorneys General refused Allan Sheppard access to even one page of the 14,000 related to his son's death, which remain unavailable, hidden away within that office's files? Our work to date has already helped to again raise such obvious questions in minds of many - legal experts, media critics and concerned private citizens, alike - across Canada, and around the globe.

                     

Your much-appreciated financial help will allow us to  finish our feature documentary - DARCY ALLAN SHEPPARD "He was clearly not seriously injured at that time." - with the professional clarity and quality that this tragic, possible travesty demands. 

Let there be no doubt that this project will see fruition one way or another. The help we are requesting will allow us to complete our task sooner, and help to ensure a more polished final product.


Again, a heartfelt THANK YOU goes out to all who choose to assist us in making so important a documentary. In so doing, together we raise our voices to demand official transparency as to the known facts relating to this uniquely Canadian tragedy and its continuing, evermore controversial, aftermath. 


Of course if you would rather - or can - not make a financial contribution to our project you can help by letting others know about this opportunity by  making some noise about this campaign. And one can use the Indiegogo share tools to do so.

About the documentarians involved: 

VISUAL COORDINATOR (Director)

My name is Alan Wayne Scott and I am a retired, 25-year veteran foot/bike/transit messenger and active, urban transport advocate, based in my beloved lifelong hometown of Toronto, Ontario, Canada.  I first became a utilitarian cyclist on the streets of this city more than fifty years ago. I have also been fortunate enough to be involved on the periphery of the local creative arts (poetry, music, graphics and video) scene, throughout said half century.

Many thanks for taking time to consider assisting us with our unique project.

           Demand TRUTH!

      The pictures above are a stark reminder of the atrocities of 911. There was not a dry eye in our group when we posted these pictures. The mainstream media was dictated not to show the events of 911 so the world would forget.

 We think it is important to show the world right now, 15 years later, that those who know better and know the truth have not forgotten the day a piece of America was stolen from us all. 

  The trust in the U.S. government was gone forever. Along with Building 7, the trust in our financial system was taken. Investigations were underway to look into decades of securities fraud and thousands of micro-cap companies and brokers.  Just like all other Americans that morning, these people just went to work, not knowing they were part of a few people’s plan to murder and cover for profit. The evidence plainly shows this. “Textbook” diagonal cutter charges were implemented to cut the steel columns. The only part of the building that remained intact, with no evidence of tampering, was the five story atrium, which was wide open where explosives could not be concealed or hidden away from view. Those pictures show, along with other evidence, that columns were intentionally cut in the sub floors to  jamb doorways just before the impact of the planes. These cut columns also detached stairwells and jammed elevators, trapping witnesses in a collapsing incinerator. In the forth link below in the video you can plainly hear hundreds of detonated cutter charges going off before the building reaches the ground. Another video that got away before they could confiscate or change it.

It is our theory that the fire proof upgrades where anything but fireproofing right before 911. We feel from particle evidence that a high-tech nano-therm ate suspended in a binding matrix was sprayed or applied to key structure points to weaken and insure complete incineration. We also feel that van loads of thermal   incendiary explosives parked in the underground parking be it therm ate or other were used to insure complete incineration of most evidence.  The picture above from ground zero clearly shows melted granite witch would have to maintain 1200 degrees in a them-ate no oxygen environment for some time to create that much molten granite. Minimal trace of thousands of desks computers, file cabinets all incinerated.(temps recorded at 2,200 degrees a month later)  The time is now. Too much time has passed already. There will be no sense of normalcy or closure for the victim’s families or the average American until this crime is brought front and center to the world, with the result of prosecution from our highest courts even if it means cleaning house in the Supreme Court.  

        Is four trillion dollars enough

          reason to kill and cover up?

Can five bucks change our history?

                                          (Watch Pentagon Drone strike. below)

         It’s my group’s intention to find out the answer to that question. The purpose of this campaign is to unite all the people that have worked so hard on researching 911.  We have to raise funds to broadcast a one hour infomercial to educate a world that has bought into the fallacy of the 911 commission report and the mainstream media’s brainwashing that took place during 911 and days after.  It’s time to shed light on many of the seeded government misinformation campaigns that took place. It is also dedicated to the families that lost loved ones that horrific day and to our military families who lost mothers, fathers and children from the conflicts that followed and to our future generations.

Give us 30 minutes and we will have you wanting to read more.

Give us 45 minutes and you will want to know Who ,how and why.

Give us one hour and you should be so mad that your view on America has now changed and you will join us seeking justice.

      The only reason not to give yourself the time to look with an open mind at the top down propaganda from 911 is that most are too insecure and can’t handle their core beliefs in there government being rocked. The view of American exceptional-ism that has been pumped into the peoples heads that it could never happen here, It's just not possible. We have news for you it’s very possible and it happened and you owe yourself, your children and future generations truth and justice. If you consider yourself a smart person take the few minutes to look to make a sound judgment at what millions of people have been talking about that the media has blocked out.
     We are seeking funding to make a one hour infomercial featuring the best of the best. We have a panel comprised of demolition experts, architectural engineers, recently retired J.S.O.C military command,FAA and radar specialists, retired N.O.R.A.D military personal, Middle East and Israel foreign policy specialists and radio flight control experts. We will have misinformation experts to explain the mockingbird program and war game directors. We will reproduce the events of 911 and show just how many people would have to have had prior knowledge for the events to take place. Not as many as you would think. Most just did their jobs and were not paid to think, just follow orders.  We will also have special guests that will not be disclosed until the first airing to protect their safety and identity. Working in conjunction with the top researchers of 911 and researchers bringing to light Americas past thirty years of history, we will reveal facts pertinent to understanding what happened and why. A one hour infomercial shall be run prime time on independent station’s and christen satellite networks. We have been in planing for over five years and just lack funding. If you plan on financially supporting a 2016 candidate, please reconsider and support this cause instead. Until we fix the corruption in government it does not matter who we vote in.

  A free DVD offered will have a petition form section already filled out, representing your country or state. Clicking the send link will send it back through our servers. All petitions will be delivered by hard copy to our government officials at the doors of the White-House. They will have no choice but to pay attention when we turn this into a large media event. Until we unite, worldwide 911 will be another Gulf of Tonkin, Pearl Harbor, or other false flag in the side skirt of history. The only way to get justice is to unite and skip mainstream media that’s controlled by the status quo. If you are here and reading this page and funding has not started yet, be bold. Be the one to start it. Crowd-funding is like the dance floor at a wedding. No one wants to jump in until someone else does.  Don’t wait for someone else. Please think of those poor people who did nothing wrong that morning, went to work and ended up jumping to their deaths. This page is not a medium for what was or was not. The links offered are to help educate and inform.

  Look at it this way! If only 80 percent in what you’re about to read is right, this country has serious problems. Please give a minimum of five dollars or more, get your bumper sticker or T-shirt for thetruth911.com web site and spread the word.

  My group’s plan is to have billboard advertising in place airing the schedule in Chicago, New York, L.A. and seven other major cities worldwide after the production is made. Funds will be held in escrow and only paid after guaranteed airing.

Production will take place in a blacked out location, in secrecy, on foreign soil to avoid government harassment and intervention.  Our panel members do not wish to be exposed until after the airing.

More than ever, there are many more people willing to come forward, now that some time has passed and they realize the secrets they hold are eating away at their health.

Blowing 911 wide open can be the open door to getting our forefathers principles back in America. It can be the catalyst to campaign reform and ending the FED, if you’re among the 25% of Americans that know the truth.

  Do something about it! That’s  millions of us, not counting our friends overseas, times five dollars. That’s a movement, and that volume of noise can’t be turned down or stopped.  Keep in mind, studio production, hotel and compensation for our panel of twenty-five, plus air fare can get expensive. We owe it to our future generations to cut this cancer out of America and let justice prevail.

Anyone who believes the 911 Commission Report and does not think serious crimes were committed, was simply too busy, lazy or arrogant to spend just thirty minutes of their time to research this subject. story:
VIDEO GAME CATZ is a, half live action, half animated, viral media short we are making in order to bring people together and celebrate some great things we all like, such as cats, the internet, sketch comedy, and old school Nintendo games. 

We have a cast and crew of badass actors, comedians and youtubers  assembled who believe in the script- including actors Matthew Moy and James Grabawski of 2 Broke Girls, DP Tomm Jabobsen of 5 Second Films, and  many other surprise guests! 

Here is the basic plot: Two friends get together one Saturday to build a video game for a 24 hour video game development competition  (game devs we see you, and tip our proverbial hats,) and hang out with their cat, Hubert (if you don't like cats, at least internet cats, there is something wrong with you.) 

Matt and James are almost finished with their game when there is a knock at the door (if you know who Meisner is, this is for you.) Mass chaos ensues! Hubert disappears!! Tron type stuff happens! 

All we need now is some $$ support to make it happen. While most of the crew is working for free, we still need to pay for things such as sound, animation, special effects, costume pieces, and of course food for these hungry people working for free.  The money raised from this campaign will allow us to make a short that is not only fun, but looks and sounds good. In the spirit of play, promote and support this short!  The internet thanks you;)
story_txt:
VIDEO GAME CATZ is a, half live action, half animated, viral media short we are making in order to bring people together and celebrate some great things we all like, such as cats, the internet, sketch comedy, and old school Nintendo games. 
We have a cast and crew of badass actors, comedians and youtubers  assembled who believe in the script- including actors Matthew Moy and James Grabawski of 2 Broke Girls, DP Tomm Jabobsen of 5 Second Films, and  many other surprise guests! 

Here is the basic plot: Two friends get together one Saturday to build a video game for a 24 hour video game development competition  (game devs we see you, and tip our proverbial hats,) and hang out with their cat, Hubert (if you don't like cats, at least internet cats, there is something wrong with you.) 
Matt and James are almost finished with their game when there is a knock at the door (if you know who Meisner is, this is for you.) Mass chaos ensues! Hubert disappears!! Tron type stuff happens! 

All we need now is some $$ support to make it happen. While most of the crew is working for free, we still need to pay for things such as sound, animation, special effects, costume pieces, and of course food for these hungry people working for free.  The money raised from this campaign will allow us to make a short that is not only fun, but looks and sounds good. In the spirit of play, promote and support this short!  The internet thanks you;)

story:
ALL THINGS is reminiscent of The X-Files in its moody creepiness and the original Alien film by Ridley Scott in its palpable terror and suspense, and Super 8 in its unexpected turn of hope.

                                                                  ‘First Encounter’ 

The Story

Soon after losing her mother to cancer, college dropout Claire joins an advocacy group to find peace and make a difference in a nearby forest that is shrouded in thick layers of a muggy fog. Separated from her team she is terrorized by unseen alien creatures that make sickening organic-metallic sounds as they crawl around the dense forest and squeal with anger through their disgusting mandibles. Hunted and alone she uncovers the alien invaders’ disturbing agenda and discovers her self-sacrificing destiny.


The Story Behind the Story

Like all great stories, ALL THINGS begins with a question: What if an ordinary person can be given the opportunity to do something extraordinary with their life? And what if this opportunity came, not because they were looking for it, but because they were looking in the wrong direction? Could we make a film that brings to light those mysterious moments in our lives when things come out of left field? And could we tell this story in the vein of a horror-thriller about an alien encounter in what should be the most serene of places – nature?

Veteran VFX producer Richard J. Cook set out to do just that with ALL THINGS.


For Richard J. Cook (IMDb) — a visual effects veteran whose worked on films like Independence Day (Academy Award® for Best Visual Effects), Godzilla and multiple Star Trek films and series during the golden age of CGI when digital effects were used to enhance practical effects — ALL THINGS is a passion project.  Here's a sample of his past work:

If you’re excited about a film that will blend those elements into its own unique story that will harken back to the days when the actors were actually face-to-face with the dripping venom of the alien creature inches away from their face and you could actually feel your palms get sweaty because everything you were seeing on screen was a magical blend of real, practical creature effects enhanced by the subtle use of the latest in digital advances — we’re asking you to be a part of bringing this vision to life! Because now is the time. We can do this together. Now is the chance for those of us who are passionate about unique and compelling stories, to be directly involved in bringing ALL THINGS to life by funding the vision righthere on Indiegogo!


“We went to Patrick Tatopoulos’ office, his creature shop, and watched hours of footage of lizards to see how they would naturally move and react, and we’d try to mimic that. So Patrick, being a practical guy, was showing us how to make CG move. It all starts with the practical.”

The Passion

Rich’s passion for a different,  subversive kind of filmmaking — science-fiction pieces that not only entertain the hell out of audiences, but also explore the complexities of our humanity through unexpected perspectives — comes to the fore in the feature film project, ALL THINGS. A story that has lived with him for a long time that is now seeing the light.

And he’s looking for sci-fi fans like you who truly “get it” when comes to this kind of filmmaking to help him bring this vision into reality.

‘Claire discovers secret alien tech’

                                                                 ‘Alien General’ 


As an Indiegogo supporter you have the right to know where your money will go.

Our movie must have an experienced, intelligent, witty actress of emotional range in the lead role. Therefore, the largest part of these development funds will go towards attracting the best talent possible.

We also believe one way to make a great movie is to establish a very distinct mood at the very beginning stages. All other pieces will ooze from the look and feel of the designs.  Creature designs, interior space craft designs, devices and weapon designs, etc. We will need the best designs possible to bring this movie to life. That is why we will spend a lot of the funds on the work of an amazing artist.

The larger your donation, the louder the aliens will squeal!


Why leave all the abducting to extraterrestrial invaders? Do some abducting of your own - see what perks await you when you give to this project. 

Every donation over $25 includes the "On Demand" perk as well!


Frequently Asked Questions:

  • Travel accommodations are not included in any perk.
  • On Demand Perk is included in any donation over $25.
  • Producer Connection perk *After the one hour consultation, Rich will put you in touch with an industry professional that might be able to help you on your own film making journey.  They are no guarantees of any results as each project must stand on its own merit.  

EXTENDED CUT:
story_txt:
ALL THINGS is reminiscent of The X-Files in its moody creepiness and the original Alien film by Ridley Scott in its palpable terror and suspense, and Super 8 in its unexpected turn of hope.


                                                                  ‘First Encounter’ 
The Story
Soon after losing her mother to cancer, college dropout Claire joins an advocacy group to find peace and make a difference in a nearby forest that is shrouded in thick layers of a muggy fog. Separated from her team she is terrorized by unseen alien creatures that make sickening organic-metallic sounds as they crawl around the dense forest and squeal with anger through their disgusting mandibles. Hunted and alone she uncovers the alien invaders’ disturbing agenda and discovers her self-sacrificing destiny.

The Story Behind the Story

Like all great stories, ALL THINGS begins with a question: What if an ordinary person can be given the opportunity to do something extraordinary with their life? And what if this opportunity came, not because they were looking for it, but because they were looking in the wrong direction? Could we make a film that brings to light those mysterious moments in our lives when things come out of left field? And could we tell this story in the vein of a horror-thriller about an alien encounter in what should be the most serene of places – nature?
Veteran VFX producer Richard J. Cook set out to do just that with ALL THINGS.




For Richard J. Cook (IMDb) — a visual effects veteran whose worked on films like Independence Day (Academy Award® for Best Visual Effects), Godzilla and multiple Star Trek films and series during the golden age of CGI when digital effects were used to enhance practical effects — ALL THINGS is a passion project.  Here's a sample of his past work:
If you’re excited about a film that will blend those elements into its own unique story that will harken back to the days when the actors were actually face-to-face with the dripping venom of the alien creature inches away from their face and you could actually feel your palms get sweaty because everything you were seeing on screen was a magical blend of real, practical creature effects enhanced by the subtle use of the latest in digital advances — we’re asking you to be a part of bringing this vision to life! Because now is the time. We can do this together. Now is the chance for those of us who are passionate about unique and compelling stories, to be directly involved in bringing ALL THINGS to life by funding the vision righthere on Indiegogo!

“We went to Patrick Tatopoulos’ office, his creature shop, and watched hours of footage of lizards to see how they would naturally move and react, and we’d try to mimic that. So Patrick, being a practical guy, was showing us how to make CG move. It all starts with the practical.”
The Passion
Rich’s passion for a different,  subversive kind of filmmaking — science-fiction pieces that not only entertain the hell out of audiences, but also explore the complexities of our humanity through unexpected perspectives — comes to the fore in the feature film project, ALL THINGS. A story that has lived with him for a long time that is now seeing the light.

And he’s looking for sci-fi fans like you who truly “get it” when comes to this kind of filmmaking to help him bring this vision into reality.




‘Claire discovers secret alien tech’










                                                                 ‘Alien General’ 




As an Indiegogo supporter you have the right to know where your money will go.
Our movie must have an experienced, intelligent, witty actress of emotional range in the lead role. Therefore, the largest part of these development funds will go towards attracting the best talent possible.
We also believe one way to make a great movie is to establish a very distinct mood at the very beginning stages. All other pieces will ooze from the look and feel of the designs.  Creature designs, interior space craft designs, devices and weapon designs, etc. We will need the best designs possible to bring this movie to life. That is why we will spend a lot of the funds on the work of an amazing artist.
The larger your donation, the louder the aliens will squeal!









Why leave all the abducting to extraterrestrial invaders? Do some abducting of your own - see what perks await you when you give to this project. 
Every donation over $25 includes the "On Demand" perk as well!




Frequently Asked Questions:



Travel accommodations are not included in any perk.

On Demand Perk is included in any donation over $25.
Producer Connection perk *After the one hour consultation, Rich will put you in touch with an industry professional that might be able to help you on your own film making journey.  They are no guarantees of any results as each project must stand on its own merit.  


EXTENDED CUT:

story:
About Me …

I’m a Teacher, Coach, Entrepreneur, Reformer, Patriot, Idealist, Realist and Activist, and I like to keep things Natural and Simple.


The Status Quo - My ‘Why’

Over the last few years, I have spent more time with senior citizens and recognized a painful truth – our Ghanaian (and perhaps African) societies have always been acknowledged as collective in nature, where people take care of each other, and consequently, the state has sat back without making proper provisions for the welfare of senior citizens. Times have changed, and we have more neglected elderly people in our communities. An increase in access to education for example, means that there are no ‘idle’ children at home to keep the elderly company or assist them as needed. Economic and financial pressures have also meant that young and old adults find employment outside the home, and commute for long hours in traffic, leaving senior citizens alone at home.

 My father died at age 55, and although he accomplished so much in his relatively short life, he never penned his life's stories, lessons etc. in a single volume.  Thankfully, because he wrote articles in The Ghanaian Chronicle Newspaper, a few of his colleagues were able to showcase some of his writings, and we can learn about him and from him, through this collection. Many others have passed on, and have gone with their stories. We have missed the opportunity to see their legacies through their own eyes, and we want to ensure that turn this situation around and capture legacies for upcoming generations to learn from.

Developing a strong interest in issues concerning the elderly, I co-founded an organization (Association of Ghana's Elders) to address issues relevant to senior citizens in Ghana. We are finding ways of keeping our senior citizens empowered and engaged in their personal, community and national development. We’ve got to start somewhere. You may visit www.ageafrica.com to learn more.

As a member of the Aspen Global Leadership Network (AGLN), and thus, a Fellow of the Africa Leadership Initiative, I decided to take this on as my leadership project. To start with this big dream, we’re starting with something specific - capturing the life stories, leadership lessons and legacies of senior citizens.


How Will "We" Do This? – Me & You! All Hands On Deck!

Our oral tradition has meant that we have not been intentional about documenting our life stories and legacies, and I want to change that.  This BIOGRAPHY PROJECT will work with senior citizens to capture their life stories, our nation’s evolution through their eyes, and provide us with raw material that is useful in nation building and in the cultivation of minds.

This process of creating autobiographies and biographies has many moving parts which need to be lubricated by the funds we raise:

1.  Working with a professional biographer to capture stories in the long term (as autobiographies or current and posthumous biographies).

2.  Providing support to authors through a book club, providing relevant tools such as a computer, and using the opportunity to teach tech-literacy, so they can keep up with the world and stay engaged.

3.  Creating content – books, audiovisuals (documentaries) that will serve generations, and also serve as a source of income for senior citizens who sometimes struggle financially.

I need your direct support, your referrals, recommendations, ideas and suggestions, and whatever resource you deem useful. Please contact me directly (ogya[at]ogyakrom.org), if you would like to support in any other way. My target is to raise at least $15,000 for this project. The more we raise, the more we can do (our website shows our comprehensive action agenda).


My “What” – End Results

Ultimately, we want to see a Ghana where senior citizens document their life lessons so we can learn valuable lessons from them. With the funds we raise, we can generate at least 2 books each year, and work on interesting biography documentaries as well. The plan also includes a collection of short biographical chapters based on themes in our second year of production.

To do all this, I am climbing the highest peak on the African continent - beautiful Mt. Kilimanjaro! It is almost 19,000 ft. high, and I'm scaling the great heights from July 8th - 15th, 2015. I will share my experiences so you also scale it vicariously through my experiences.

story:
Last year we tried to raise enough money to shoot our feature film. We were overwhelmed with your incredible generosity, but we fell short of that goal and decided to shoot a shorter version. We had an amazing shoot, and we are thrilled with what we captured.

So thrilled, in fact, that we are now once again asking for your help, to return to Colorado and finish the film--to do it justice.

It may seem like a lot of money, and it is, but in filmmaking standards, it's very little. We are asking for the absolute bare minimum to complete this film.

The insanely talented cast and crew are working for nothing on this project because they are passionate about it, and want to see it completed.

Here is our fundraising video from last year. Ah, nostalgia.


THE STORY

Stray Dogs follows Marcus, a transient, and Rick, a rancher. Marcus finds an empty ranch house and begins uncovering the mystery of what happened to the previous occupants. Marcus is discovered by Rick, who is searching for his missing friend. Marcus and Rick are thrown into a violent whirlwind of events leading to a desperate chase through the vast country.

It's about men who are trying to find somewhere to belong. It’s about loneliness, empathy and voyeurism – looking through a window onto another life and trying to unravel the past – even as the future spirals out of control. Lastly, this film is about the decisions men make to keep hold of their dreams, and the consequences that their decisions bring about.


ZAPATA RANCH

The film was inspired by living on the Medano-Zapata Ranch in the San Luis Valley of Colorado, home to the largest sand dunes in North America. The ranch has been operating since the mid 1800s: its original structures have survived more than a hundred years of harsh wind and cold. Driving around the valley, down the dirt roads littered with old farming equipment and houses that were once the dreams of someone’s future, I knew that a film had to be made here. It’s a place that hasn’t been used before, and the special access I have is a big reason I am so passionate about the project.

Driving around the valley, down the dirt roads littered with old farming equipment and houses that were once the dreams of someone’s future, I knew that a film had to be made here. It’s a place that hasn’t been used before, and the special access I have is a big reason I am so passionate about the project.


The Sand Dunes Photo by Scott MurrishMEET THE TEAM:
ISAAC COLE - WRITER/DIRECTOR

Isaac began his filmmaking career at New York University’s Tisch School of the Arts, where he focused on script writing and directing. He has completed several feature film scripts and is currently working on a documentary in South Carolina.
LOU HAKE - PRODUCER

Lou has had a 10-year career producing commercials in London for brands including Sony, Cadbury and the BBC. Her work has been awarded at D&AD, Cannes Lions International Festival of Creativity and the BTAA. Lou is passionate about making films and loves working in remote locations.
MARC KATZ – DIRECTOR OF PHOTOGRAPHY

Marc graduated from NYU’s Tisch School of the Arts, where he majored in Film Production with a concentration in Cinematography. It was at NYU that Marc and Isaac began working together. His cinematography has been awarded at Camerimage, Raindance, Cannes Lion YDA and he won the award for Best Cinematography at First Run and the Richmond International Film Festival for the short film Fort Apache. Marc has been so captivated by the location during his time here, that he will do whatever it takes to make sure the film is shot beautifully and evokes a sense of significant purpose.
SIENA BROWN - Assistant Director

Siena Brown is a New York City-based 1st Assistant Director. Her experience on feature films spans both east and west coasts and everywhere in between. You can see Siena in the Starz network original series THE CHAIR, which followed the crew behind the scenes on HOLLIDAYSBURG. In addition to her work on features, Siena has worked as 1st AD on dozens of commercials, music videos, short films and webseries. Her resume includes content for Comedy Central, MTV, L'Oreal, Peroni Nastro Azzurro, Paragard, Good Company, The Economist, and Republic Records. Siena is a graduate of NYU's Tisch School of the Arts and the recipient of the Martin Scorsese Young Filmmaker's Scholarship and the Brett Ratner Scholarship.

story:
THE INCREDIBLE POWER OF THE MIND

It is said that we have far greater potential then we ever imagined possible, when we harness that potential through using the power of our minds. So far, in a my short career as a hypnotherapist of only 6 years, I have seen some absolutely amazing things and come to learn that hypnosis by far one of the most powerful modalities for unlocking that power. This however, is nothing compared to some of my very seasoned colleagues who have been in the business so much longer than I have. Sometimes when they would share some of their success stories with me, it would leave me in awe. So I decided that I had to get this information out there. People need to know just how powerful our minds are, and what we are able to do with that power. So now I’ve made it my mission to interview the world's top hypnotists and produce a series of and videos and podcasts on Miracles in hypnosis, in order to bring to light what is possible through utilizing the power of our minds. Unfortunately, as I was hearing these stories I simply couldn’t wait to get funding, so I started doing interviews locally with world renowned hypnotists in my home town of Toronto, Canada, or if I traveled I brought my video cam and recording equipment with me in my luggage because I’m totally on fire about this project. And the more I heard the miraculous stories, the more excited I became to make this series a reality on a big level. To date I have succeeded in interviewing some of the world’s top hypnotists, and have lined up interviews with many more across North America, such author and world renowned hypnotist Larry Garret, who was summoned to Iraq to hypnotize a prominent and wealthy business man, only to discover when he got there that it was the infamous son of Saddam Hussein. He then later wrote a book about his experience called Hypnotizing The Devil.

I’ve also posted a short video clip of some of the amazing stories I have already captured from my interviews on www.intheknowradio.com. You will hear from Dr. Mike Mandel, 6 time award winning hypnotist who talks about using forensic hypnosis to help a victim of an armed robbery recall the license plate of the vehicle involved in a crime from across a dark parking lot, and also how in just one session he worked with a woman who was tormented by asthma for 30 years and was on two different inhalers daily cease to need them any more. Other hypnotists you will see in this video are hypnotherapist and Hypnosis Trainer Steve Roehm. You will learn how Steve helped a woman heal from cancer over a weekend leaving her doctor so amazed he personally drove her tests up to the lab himself. That and other amazing stories from best selling author of The Incidental Guru Cindy Stone, who first used hypnosis to help a woman who had been plagued with horrific nightmares after ritual abuse every night of her entire life. Not only did she stop having nightmares after hypnosis, but her dreams then became a source of healing for her. These are just some of the Miracles In Hypnosis which I would like to continue sharing with the world.

You can help me take it to the next level with one of the largest upcoming hypnosis conventions that are happening in Las Vegas in August. Your funding will help me get access in person and live to the word’s top hypnotists.

WORLDS TOP HYPNOTISTS COMING UP IN AUGUST

Already confirmed are:

  1. Martin Seligman:  Past Lives and In Between Lives Hypnosis
  2. Miguel Cocco: Unconventional Hypnosis
  3. Larry Garret:  Was flown to Bagdad to hypnotize the Uday Hussein, the infamous son of Saddam Hussein
  4. Seth Deborah Roth: Miracles in Medical Hypnosis
  5. William Arendell: The Science Of Hypnosis & The Brain
  6. Ines Simpson: The Simpson Protocol - Working in a somnambulistic state
  7. AL  Ward: A brilliant 92 year old hypnotist who has seen many miracles in his career such as instant healings manifest in front of his eyes.
  8. Mellisa Roth: Miracles in Medical Hypnosis
  9. Kathy Gruver: Award-winning author and the host of the national TV show based on her first book, The Alternative Medicine Cabinet
  10. Heather & Scott McFallen: Fibromyalgia & Dramatic Hypnosis Results

WHY WE NEED YOUR HELP

Right now if you go to my site intheknowradio.com and listen to the interviews you will may find that the quality is well….. not perhaps of the highest of a standards that I would like, and that’s because - I did it all myself! Urrrrr! And, I am by no means any technical expert. The hypnotists that I will be interviewing deserve to be filmed in high quality because they are of a high caliber so that is why I need your help. No more homemade basement quality videos and podcasts done me - a technologically inept hypnotist. With your help we can ensure that the sound is consistent and the video taping is done professionally.

OUR TEAM


The team for now, aside from the technical experts that will be hired to help edit and produce high quality productions, will be Justin Weiss and myself. Justin will be my assistant and handle the filming and audio recording. I have chosen Justin to help with this project because he has been earmarked by his hypnosis trainer as one of the most successful young and upcoming hypnotists, and who better to give this experience to other than someone who could profit greatly from the experience of being with the worlds top hypnotists and getting the inside scoop on it all live while filming, that and the fact that Justin is really good at filming.

story:
WHO WE ARE: 

DConstruction Arts is a Los Angeles based media arts and aerial performance company founded by Jane Rose and Tavi Stutz. The founding mission of DConstruction Arts is to use its pieces to make a social impact through examining the most basic aspects that affect the human condition. 


WHAT WE INTEND TO CREATE:

The piece "Afflicted Nature" is a multimedia dance and aerial piece conceived to raise awareness about the current state of HIV/AIDS. 

The sad reality is that the numbers of new infections of HIV have remained fairly stable since the mid-1990's. "Afflicted Nature" confronts the idea perpetuated in the United States that HIV/AIDS is no longer a serious health concern. This piece looks to take this important social issue and draw more attention to it.


WHY GET INVOLVED:

  • "Over the past decade, the number of people living with HIV has increased, while the annual number of new HIV infections has remained fairly stable" (aids.gov)
  • "An estimated 1.2 million persons aged 13 and older [are] living with HIV infection in the United States, including 156,300 (12.8%) persons whose infections [have] not been diagnosed" (cdc.gov)
  • There is still a large stigma that surrounds HIV and HIV testing. The fear of the disease keeps us silent when we need to be promoting proactive protection and awareness.
  • There are many places in the world that do not offer easy access to testing facilities or medical assistance.
  • "About 35 million people are living with HIV around the world" (cdc.gov)

HOW TO GET INVOLVED:

Our goal is to raise $5000 with this campaign. 

  • 50% of all funds raised will be used for outreach to spread awareness about testing and other ways to be proactive about prevention.
  • The remaining funds will be used to complete the project and take it cities around the world.

We need your help to share this message of awareness! You can do this in many ways, including:

  • Make a donation to this campaign.
  • Share this page and it's message with your friends and family.
  • Get tested for HIV regularly and encourage those you are close to do the same.

have remained fairly stable since the mid-1990's. "Afflicted Nature" confronts the idea
perpetuated in the United States that HIV/AIDS is no longer a serious health
concern. This piece looks to take this important social issue and draw more
attention to it.
 
WHY GET INVOLVED:  "Over the past decade, the number of people living with HIV has increased, while the annual number of new HIV infections has remained fairly stable" (aids.gov)
"An estimated 1.2 million persons aged 13 and older [are] living with HIV infection in the United States, including 156,300 (12.8%) persons whose infections [have] not been diagnosed" (cdc.gov) There is still a large stigma that surrounds HIV and HIV testing. The fear of the disease keeps us silent when we need to be promoting proactive protection and awareness.
There are many places in the world that do not offer easy access to testing facilities or medical assistance.
"About 35 million people are living with HIV around the world" (cdc.gov)



HOW TO GET INVOLVED:
Our goal is to raise $5000 with this campaign. 

50% of all funds raised will be used for outreach to spread awareness about testing and other ways to be proactive about prevention.
The remaining funds will be used to complete the project and take it cities around the world.

We need your help to share this message of awareness! You can do this in many ways, including:  Make a donation to this campaign. Share this page and it's message with your friends and family. Get tested for HIV regularly and encourage those you are close to do the same.

story:
The Hilarious New Dating Comedy

Single & Dating In Vancouver (SADinVAN) is a new comedy that follows five single friends in, you’ve guessed it, Vancouver, where the notoriously harsh dating scene is enough to make a grown man cry and send a sane woman straight to the insane asylum without passing go or collecting five hundred dollars.

SADinVAN season one has netted a cool 9 nominations (See below for the full list), has been screened at several international Web Fests AND is now available on a US distribution platform. Imagine what we have in store for season two? Enter YOU. Ya, I’m talking you, the contributor. Season one wouldn’t have been the success that it was without people just like you. We’re hoping that you enjoyed Season 1 so much, that you wanna see our crazy season two full of more of the insanity that is the single dating life.

Your pledge is essential for the success of our second season. We are now an experienced, veteran team and know how to stretch every dollar to the ripping point. Season one was completed on a angel’s hair pasta-string budget of 7,500$ with all actors and crew volunteering their time to the production.

In order to bring you the bigger laughs that come along with season two, we need proper funding so that we can secure locations, purchase insurance, city & union permits, rent proper camera, lighting and grip equipment, hire professional crew, feed everyone during our 12-14hr days and ensure the production is shot in cinema format so that we can continue distribution on Indieflix as well as open the door to other methods of distribution such as Netflix, Hulu and Amazon (Aim for the stars!). And that’s just during our production shoot days! Once the cameras stop rolling we jump into post production where we need to cover editing, sound design, sound mixing, music rights, color grading, festival submission fees and the list goes on!

The absolutely immeasurable experience we’ve gained during season one will enable us to squeeze every last drop of value out of each dollar pledged. Our producers are working on deferred pay and our crew will be given a very small daily per-diem and kit fee (WELL below their usual day rates) and our actors come to the show on a volunteer basis. Why? Because they believe in the show and where it's going. By reaching our financial goal we can:
  • Rent proper equipment (cam/lx/grip) and raise our production value
  • Rent rehearsal space
  • Continue to get fantastic locations
  • Professional editing, sound mixing and sound design
  • Professional color correction
This is the perfect recipe that will enable us to give you the best and most entertaining performances paired with a production value that will knock your socks off. For those of you who prefer visuals, we've crafty this lovely pie chart to demonstrate how your money will be used.



Single & Dating In Vancouver is made possible by many talented individuals... Introducing the core unit that works behind the scenes between seasons.
Scott Mundle - IMDB
Executive Producer
Troy Mundle - IMDB / Website
Writer/Creator/Sandwich Maker/On Again-Off Again On Set Fluffer
Chad Riley - IMDB
Associate Producer/Actor/Stunt Coordinator/Sexual Chocolate
Marco Bossow - IMDB / Website
 Director of Photography/Post Supervisor/Therapist

By contributing to Single & Dating In Vancouver you support a hard working group of performers and crew members with a proven track record to produce another entertaining season of a comedic Web series. Our show has featured over 43 local actors in it's first six episodes, providing them with larger, meatier roles they can sink their teeth into, as well as providing some crew with great on-set experience they can take forward to working on larger series and features.
The completion of our second season will enable us to enter the 2016 awards season with ambitions to double our amount of nominations and (fingers crossed) get some wins as well as enter into further distribution deals.

Even if you can't contribute financially there are many other ways you can help!! Sharing our campaign with others OR check out this list of stuff that you can do that we'd love you for!

  • Like on on Facebook
  • Follow us on Instagram
  • Follow us on Twitter

Single & Dating In Vancouver Season 1 is currently available on our Web site (www.sadinvan.com) and our YouTube channel (SADinVAN YouTube). Season 2 will be exclusively available on our Web site.
Our Current Nominations:
  • 2015 Indie Series Awards (Los Angeles)
    Best Comedy Ensemble, Best Directing, Best Supporting Actress, Best Guest Actress
  • 2015 Vancouver Web Fest (Best Comedy, Best Actress)
  • 2015 San Fransisco Web Fest (Best Comedy)
  • 2015 Miami Web Fest (Best Comedy)
  • 2014 Leo Nomination (Best Female Performance In A Web Series)

Perk Information
We would like to thank each and every person who contributes to our campaign no matter the size of your pledge. Every pledge name will be included on our Season 2 Pledge wall as well as listed in the tail credits of season two episodes. 

The Name Drop
The producer reserves the right to decide which episode in which the 'Name Drop' occurs. You will receive a digital release form that must be signed and returned in order to complete this perk. :)

story:
Where are the Lilacs? 

"A group of disillusioned college students, smoldering in the failure of a recent political/social protest movement, decide to isolate themselves in the large house of one of their affluent parents. Once there, the group indulges in a life of hedonism, hard-partying, and maybe even a seance or two. One of the group's members, Seraphine, grappling with the aforementioned social failure and her own past's areas of sadness and loss, finds consultation in a likeminded individual, also coasting alongside the group's plan without a second thought. Despite the excess of pleasure the group showers upon themselves, Seraphine must decide to stay, or move on, not just from her state of mind, but from the vacuum-like house as well."

What will you use the contributions for? 

Where are the Lilacs? is a passion project with a cast & crew of about 20 people. All of our crew are working in the kindness, so their meals and transportation need to be provided. After we've put in all the hard work to create this film we'll want to make sure it gets seen by submitting it to film festivals, which charge entry fees. Below is a breakdown of some of our expenses: 

  • Hard drives to serve as a master negative
  • Shooting location rental and permits
  • Props and wardrobe
  • Cast & Crew meals and transportation
  • Truck rentals to transport equipment
  • Film Festival fees

Risks and challenges

We plan to depict the lives of young 20-somethings, as we see, hear, know, and love them. We hope the emotions, joys, and sorrows result in their being honest, since the idea of a fiction movie, even a non-fiction one, have very little chance of being close to the idea of reality. Cinema is a lie, one we hope to compensate with truthfulness of character. The only risk we run is pulling our punches.

story:
A while ago an ordinary guy called John Richardson realized he had lived half his life and hadn’t achieved anything his younger self thought he would have by then. The young John dreamed of being an Astronaut, a Film Star, a Pro Footballer, a successful doctor even, but now he’d reached a point when the universe had slapped his dreams down. It was too late for all of them.

Or maybe there was one glimmer left, one shot left to achieve a childhood goal. Surely it wasn’t too late to get good at golf! If he tried hard for a year, then just maybe he could make himself into a somebody. So what if he was the world’s worst golfer. So what if he probably had a better shot at becoming an astronaut. So what if he was the least professional person since the invention of the word professional. So what his life was falling apart. So what if he didn’t have a cape, or tights, or even the shirt on his back.

Some dreams just won't die. Some dreams, dream on!

Dream On! stars the fabulous Richard Coyle and the divine Sienna Guillory as John and Lesley Richardson and joins the pantheon of classic golf movies like Tin Cup, Caddyshack, and Happy Gilmour. Dream On! is the story of John’s journey, a true-life underdog tale that gives us all hope.

At least it will do…  with your help…  because, obviously, we do need your help. We wouldn’t be here, asking, if we didn’t.

We all know what it’s like to be let down and we all feel better when we can help someone out. So, although we know that you need no other reward than virtue, we want you to know how much we appreciate your help and how important you are to us, which is why we’ve lined up some FANTASTIC PERKS as a THANK YOU.

We need to raise £400,000 (around $615,000 USD) to get the movie finished and we need your help to do it.

For those of you that are regular Indiegogoers you know how this works but for those of you that are new here, you need to do 3 things;

  1. Decide how much you’d like to help us get this movie finished;
  2. Decide what perks (or combination of perks) you would like from those listed below and then;
  3. Click on the appropriate link (or links) on the right of the page and order your perks!
Easy

Thank you for your help. It really makes a difference. All the money that we get from this campaign will be used to help finish production of the movie. 

After you have made your donation (even if you haven't made one), please send this page to ALL your friends. Let's get the word out there and get this movie finished.




John and Mark discuss the movie and the indiegogo campaign with Andy Jacobs and Paul Hawksbee on their TalkSPORT radio show on 6th August 2015

story:
Short Summary

My name is Sammaia Sharif and I am the founder and CEO of FotoRender and UK Fantasy Events. I have recently both of my companies have been involved in creating new and exciting products for our clients. Over the past four years we have been providing, photographic, film production and live event services to clients in the UK and overseas. During my fifteen years in this industry I have learned much about not only delivering client needs and requirements, more over how to surpass their expectations.

Day Dream Experience is so important to me as a project because this project will enable me and my team to go that one step further in fulfilling not only the needs and requirements of clients but to give them something that they have created with us - Unique and completely tailored to them.

By contributing to this project people will become part of the first ever studio experience of its kind. This is just step one. The support we receive here will enable us to open the first ever public experience of its kind in the world. This is ground breaking stuff and we are right on the cutting edge of something until now was unimaginable and out of the reach of consumers.

All we need is this first operation to open its door later this year and with your help we can do this.

We are passionate about Day Dream Experience and every penny raise will help to make not only our dream a reality. hopefully yours too!     

What We Need & What You Get

Right now we need to raise the £350,000 of budget to ensure that the studio we are planning to build can be equipped and fully operational, ready to open to the public this autumn. We need to cover location costs, build sets, install technology and create studio settings. We also need to create and market our new brand and services. 
All those that contribute to this very special project will receive something really great to remind them  of us and what they have done to help. Every gift will be personal to us and is our way of reaching out and connecting with each contributor. Our team here have been busy working on items that we feel will be useful and above all show our true appreciation and gratitude.
We fully intend to raise as much as we can in order to really drive Day Dream Experience forward, however whatever is raise will truly help with moving the project closer to completion. If in this first stage we do not reach our total goal of £350,000, we will continue to raise funds to ensure that whatever happens we are able to reach our objectives.   

The Impact

As experienced film producers and live media event service providers we are ideally placed to see what a difference this project will make to peoples lives. We are well used to working under great pressure, in conditions that can be far from ideal on occasions. However we love a challenge and are looking forward to meeting this challenge. During the next thirty days you will be able to follow our progress and get  feedback on many other aspects of this project. We have been part of many major projects over the years and are looking forward to showing you what we can do with your help and support with this project.  
With Day Dream Experience we are bringing to you a kind of Fantasy Island moment in time that will be unforgettable! 

Risks & Challenges


Since the projects inception we have faced a number of challenges and expect that there will be more to come. What we are doing is Huge, however we have a wealth of experience and a great deal of practical and technical support. Our experiences working on live events and on location have been invaluable for all of our development. Working constantly in teams, travelling, eating and sleeping together has made us all great team player. Supporting each other, with the common aim of getting the job done and getting it done well! We are proficient problem solving and crisis management. In recent years the British independent film industry has faced  many challenges. We are part of this industry and are very proud of the talent and creativity that flourishes, in spite of all the challenges. We are living proof of this and have the experience and back bone to overcome any challenges this project may present.
One of the areas that may be difficult is the collection of all the stock footage we need to turn each of our experiences into reality. It my not all exist and if it does it may not be in  usable. In this case we will need to work with local researcher on location and shoot the footage ourselves. This being the case we have allowed for at least one of our crews to be made available to go on location and shoot the footage we need. We have looked at the cost implications of this and are confident that this could be achieved without affecting the overall budget.
Another hurdle we may come across is if it is discovered that the studio building is unable to accommodate the complete needs of our project. Location and access are most important, however other consideration such as power and connectivity. In preparation for possible  we will base our plans and designs on a number of construction and layout scenarios. Thus giving us the flexibility to adapt our plans according to the need, without compromising the design, functionality or end product.
Casting is never easy and we are aware that this can take a great deal of time and effort, only to find that you in need of key characters. We intend to work with a number of agencies, who will be commissioned to assist us with initial cast needed and on going needs that we have. We will be conducting all the main casting, however will have back up to ensure that the show will go on! 
We have chosen to look at challenges like a giant pizza, if we all dig in it WILL at some point all be gone.....     
 

Other Ways You Can Help

Being in Film and media we are used to creating a BUZZ, so please tell everyone about what we are doing. Get everyone involved and lets achieve this thing together!
With your help and support we will do this, so lets start today and celebrate our joint at the end. We can almost see the finishing line already, we need you to cheer us on and help us along the way. Join our campaign right now, we really do need you! 
We are very proud of this project and the services it is going to offer, so we need everyone to know about Day Dream Experience. As well a needing help funding we also would really, really appreciate everyone's help in promoting what we are doing and sharing our information with others. This is really important to us and will ensure that as many people as possible, will via our Indiegogo platform and share tools be able to get to know about us and what we intend to achieve.

Being in Film and media we are used to creating a BUZZ, so please tell everyone about what we are doing. Get everyone involved and lets achieve this thing together!
With your help and support we will do this, so lets start today and celebrate our joint at the end. We can almost see the finishing line already, we need you to cheer us on and help us along the way. Join our campaign right now, we really do need you! 
We are very proud of this project and the services it is going to offer, so we need everyone to know about Day Dream Experience. As well a needing help funding we also would really, really appreciate everyone's help in promoting what we are doing and sharing our information with others. This is really important to us and will ensure that as many people as possible, will via our Indiegogo platform and share tools be able to get to know about us and what we intend to achieve.

story:
Summary

Lucky is a feature film that is going into production this summer, and we need your help. By donating $25 or more to our project, you will receive exclusive perks! Lucky is a wonderful drama about a boy named Peter, a bullied boy going through the divorce of his parents.  When he finds a stuffed toy Lucky, it comes to life before his eyes. Lucky's a colorful character who becomes the best friend Peter never had, teaching him how to fight, how to be true to himself, and most importantly, how to love. This is the magical tale of a young boy who learns to stand up for himself with luck by his side.

Blinking Dog Productions is a family run business producing original content. Bea and Brad Schreiber met in film school and moved to Los Angeles in 2001. Bea worked in News for several years, winning seven Emmy Awards and a Golden Mic for Editing. Her post production acumen helps on at every stage of production. Brad also cuts for shows such as Rectify, Sleepy Hollow, Graceland, Kyle XY, and Burn Notice. He was the visual effects editor for Cosmos: A Spacetime Odyssey and created over 50 of the Emmy Award nominated visual effects himself. Currently, he is the Visual Effects Editor on Sleepy Hollow for Fox Television Studios. His past work includes cutting film for Walt Disney, TNT, Universal, Fox, Warner Brothers, and USA. Brad is also an award winning screenwriter and cinematographer.

What You Get - The Perks

The more you donate, the more perks you receive. We are sending out exclusive digital content, autographed material, DVDs, Producer credits and invitations to the wrap party. Funding our production ensures everybody gets a paycheck. We have an incredible cast and crew who deserve a fair day's wage. Please donate today!

    Your Lucky Impact

    Lucky is a colorful film that relates to families and kids everywhere who feel rejected because of their differences. It's a warm-hearted tale that has a wonderful message. You can check out our other projects on our website (NetworkBB.com) to get an idea of how beautiful this film will be once it's completed. All the visual effects will be designed and created by Brad Schreiber. If you become an Associate Producer, you will forever have your name on a product that looks great and carries a fabulous message. 

    Here are a few examples of our other visual effects projects.




      Risks & Challenges

      Natural disasters and acts of God are beyond our control and may put this film at risk. We are determined to finish the feature and release it to the public.

      We will do everything within our power to ensure Lucky is finished and available on Amazon Instant Download and Vimeo on Demand.  The completion of this film will be determined by people like you, who have a generous spirit and donate to provide funds for independent film. Donations are needed as production starts immediately!

      Other Ways You Can Help

      Share this listing with as many people as possible. We need to get the word out. Thank you.

story:
Short Summary

Chiquita, a short film (drama), gives you a fresh look into what is happening to "illegals" after they enter the country. In Chiquita, we follow Empo, one of two human traffickers in this gripping story as he recounts his chilling experience to a young prostitute that will change all of their lives, forever.

Many films about human trafficking take us on a journey through the perspective of the "illegals" entering the country in search of the "American Dream" or how women are kidnapped for "Sex Trafficking." Not this film. This film provides another perspective never seen before.

Chiquita was just a monologue 5 years ago when Tschka Moran presented it to me, Link Ruiz. I would constantly bug Tschka, "we should make this into a short film", and finally a year ago, he cracked. Since then, we've turned that powerful monologue into an incredible script. With your help, it will be an amazing short film that will help us garner the attention needed to take it even further. 

About Link Ruiz
After having my life turned upside down at the age of 28 with a diagnoses of Multiple Sclerosis, I became fearless. I left my family and headed to Los Angeles to pursue acting. Not an easy thing to do when you have 3 kids but my wife supported me and with that, there is no stopping. I grew up in a rough neighborhood where many if not most, never left and have fallen victim to that environment. Growing up I encountered an assortment of colorful characters, circumstances and dangers that gave me a wealth of material to pull from. The character, Empo in Chiquita, is the perfect amalgamation of all those life experiences.

About Tschka Moran
Tschka is a Mexican-born, Writer/Director. Although this will be his first official directorial debut in the short film category, Tschka Moran is not new to directing. He has been previously recognized for directing forty episodes of 2007’s TV-Series, “Camino a la Justicia”. Tschka not only brings his professional experience to this project but knows first hand, what it is to travel amongst the millions of immigrants into the U.S. Hence, Chiquita...

Why Now?
Writing a screenplay about the challenges that arise in the human trafficking world, I've realized is not just a U.S. issue, but a global issue. I believe people far and wide may have experienced similar struggles discussed in this film and it will hopefully inspire you to share your own stories.

By contributing to this film, you can engage in a discourse about human trafficking, and perhaps share it with your own community. What makes these illegal immigrants leave their families, homes, jobs or nothing, to embark on a journey of true uncertainty not knowing if they will even make it? This film will share what could happen after they arrive...

Where does your contribution go?

Many of our resources like locations, props, some film equipment and some labor has been donated because people believe in our project!

As a producer, I've learned I alone am simply not capable of doing everything  and it requires collaboration. Preferably with experienced professionals and doing so will tremendously improve the quality of this project.

Therefore, the $15,000 budget for completing this film will provide compensation to cast & crew, and compensating qualified post-production professionals. From music and sound to graphics and visuals. A modest publicity budget will assist with material costs of delivering the final film to film festivals and our supporters.

If we do not reach our goal, the money we do raise, will go towards Food & Post because we need our cast & crew well nourished and we need to complete the film.

...it's all about that perk...

Yeah, it's pretty clear...Let's face it, we love rewards. We use them every time we shop. So without further a do, here are just a few...

-Video SHOUT OUTS!
-Digital Downloads of the Chiquita-Monologue (Video)
-20 Minute Q&A with the Director

Check out our PERKS!
More to Come!!!

Delivery

CHIQUITA will be finished by December 2015, although we are working hard for an earlier date. The exact date is dependent on whether we are working with a very tight budget or not. This is why it's so important to spread the word. 

This is my second time producing a short film and it takes a lot of work but I believe in this! The countless months writing watching the sun rise, questions, discoveries, arguments, explanations, meetings I had with my writer/director, wife, teenage-daughter, and even coffee with my ten year old son has helped me get to THIS moment. I'm happy I am here because everyone who has helped me has made it worth every effort. Let's do this!
 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

-HELP SPREAD THE WORD about our campaign! MAKE SOME NOISE!

-USE the INDIEGOGO SHARE TOOLS

-FOLLOW US on our social media sites and "SHARE the LINK"

-BE a part of the "STREET TEAM"
