story:
Breathe Cinema Studios was formed out of the determination, drive and focus of three individuals that wanted to tell a unique story. The story of Breathe started conceptually in the summer of 2014. A year later, the team has grown in numbers with the addition of other very talented individuals, and the script has gone through many incarnations and changes to the unique story it is today.

TEVA BATANI JR. || Executive Producer

I started out my career as a stuntman, with training by Grady Bishop, in 2002. I worked my way up to Stunt Coordinator, getting to work in projects such as Sony AXN latin market (Blue Murder), promo for Brazil and promo for the latin market 1st Annual Stuntman Awards. I have produced and co-produced various shows, including artists Sin City Kiss performing at the Canyon Lounge at Four Queens in Las Vegas. In addition, here are a few projects I have worked on: the NFL Network, PGA Tour Entertainment, and I was also featured in National Geographic's "World's Toughest Fixes",  the Miss Universe pageant, MTV's "Road Rules", along with various live events.


RAVI J. SINGH || Writer/Producer

Everyone is fond of asking me, "Are you a writer?" My usual answer, "God no, I'm just a normal guy with lots of questions and great stories to tell." I didn't go to college to be a writer, I haven't written or published anything and, most notably, I haven't sold anything. So how could I possibly call myself a writer? With so much to share and no one to listen, I decided to put it to paper, and thus Breathe was born. Ask me a year from now if I am a writer... The answer just may surprise you. I have partnered with three of the most dedicated, hardworking and professional gentlemen in the entertainment industry. They have taught me the ins and outs of the business. I look forward to the the next 12 months, which will be filled with great accomplishments, excitement, surprises, and I'm sure some disappointments. Regardless of what is thrown our way, with our passion, vision and determination, coupled with the desire to succeed, we'll certainly overcome it all and we'll continue to Breathe.

JOSHUA RANDAZZO || Music Producer

I am a Songwriter that specializes in R&B/Hip Hop with classical undertones, as well as a Composer and Producer of tracks. Being surrounded by a family of entertainers, I was lucky to have been exposed to a wide variety of music from different eras, genres, and cultures. Growing up, I was always attracted or drawn to music. I would often sit at the piano and try to play a song I might've liked at the time by ear. Although I've never been given any formal lessons in piano, I've been guided by true talent my entire life (of course, when I would be engaged in learning). With my father's passing being the catalyst, it wasn't until my later teenage years that I discovered a love and passion for creating music. With a classical foundation in piano, I'm mostly self taught as a musician and producer. While I enjoy creating/producing R&B and Hip-Hop the most, I've produced songs for many different styles and genres in my  years of doing freelance work. All the while attempting to maintain an individual style in incorporating classical undertones or orchestral instrumentation as I also have a strong love for classical music. My father and his work continue to be my biggest aspirations, as well as inspiration, in music, and I'm hopeful to be able to portray that in this project.  With this film being part tribute to my fathers music, I'm grateful to have the opportunity to work with these other equally driven and passionate individuals of Breathe.

ERWIN MARLIN MELLA || Director

With over 5 years of experience in the audiovisual, storytelling industry in the Dominican Republic, I have been involved in the production of many different music videos, a couple of reality shows, and six different feature films, among other projects. Most of my experience with feature films has been editing such films; working together with other creative visionaries in order to tell the best story possible through audiovisual means. As soon as I got hold of the first pages of Breathe, I knew this was a project I had to get into (specially seeing the drive and passion behind each and every person involved in this project). The story is very spirited and involving. My promise to you is that the film will take you through many emotions as it develops, and will have you on the edge of your seat at all times.

NATALIE ANDRADE-NEVES || Associate Producer

Growing up, music has always fascinated me and singing has been a passion of mine. Breathe Cinema Studios has given me the opportunity to surround myself with people who share the same interests as I do in the entertainment industry. As an Associate Producer for Breathe Cinema Studios, I'm exposed to many of the different aspects in this industry that has helped me grow as a professional. Being involved in the creation and development of this unique story has shown me how hard-working and dedicated this team is. I still remember the day when this project was just a conversation, and by seeing how much we have accomplished so far, I have no doubt this project will have a successful outcome.

CRYSTAL HERNANDEZ || Associate Producer

As an aspiring writer, I express my thoughts and feelings through my written work. My passion is to someday being able to publish my own books. I'm a person of deep faith and I write stories and inspirational words that portray those same sentiments. Being a part of Breathe Cinema Studios has given me an opportunity to pursue my passion as a future writer. The story of Breathe has inspired and awoken in me a sense of focus, drive, and determination. Breathe will no doubt be successful and I look forward to bringing this script to life.

The story started as a conversation during the summer of 2014 as a potential musical stage show. Since then, it turned into a finished script for a full-length feature film. The big question was: how can we turn this idea, this story, into a full-fledged motion picture? This is the challenge we have taken on, making a dream become a reality by bringing our script to the big screen.
Breathe can simply be described as a romantic drama that pulls at your every emotions, at the same time. The story chronicles the interactions of many larger than life characters. Jason is an idealistic young man who is trying to find his way through a world where everything he knows about it may be a lie. Eyva is a young, aspiring singer that's trying to achieve a dream that might be out of reach. Upon meeting each other, they both embark on a journey that awakens them from the only life they knew.
Many of the characters have traits of people you may know in your life. This makes the story very relatable. This story is very heartwarming, with intrigue, suspense, and humor, and that culminates with an incredible message.

TEDDY RANDAZZO || Actor/Singer/Songwriter
2007 Rock & Roll Hall of Fame Inductee

What best way to pull the emotions from the audience with a story of this magnitude than with the music of a legendary singer and songwriter like Teddy Randazzo. His iconic music has transcended the test of time and will appeal to all generations to come.

Teddy Randazzo was born into a musical family. His career began at age 15 as a member of the group, The Three Chuckles, with Teddy as lead vocalist on their very first hit song, "Runaround." Soon Teddy emerged as a solo artist, recording such hits as "Little Serenade" and "The Way of a Clown," and later going on to perform as a headliner in shows with legendary disc jockey, Alan Freed, at the Brooklyn Fox and Brooklyn Paramount Theaters in the heyday of the Freed-inspired rock and roll revolution.

Randazzo starred in such motion pictures as Hey, Let's Twist, The Girl Can't Help It, Rock, Rock, Rock and Mr. Rock and Roll. He also made seven appearances on the Ed Sullivan Show, which in future years was to become a prime showcase for major league musical talent, including The Beatles and The Rolling Stones.

Randazzo became totally immersed in the music business, producing and writing songs, as well as forming a music publishing firm with famed producer, Don Costa. He arranged and produced records for a diverse group of talents, including Little Anthony and the Imperials, The Royalettes, The Temptations, The Stylistics, The Manhattans and Frank Sinatra.

In 1957 Teddy Randazzo's creative juices began flowing with major hits like "Pretty Blue Eyes,"  which was recorded by Steve Lawrence and produced by Don Costa, a pairing which quickly brought the disc to number one on the bestselling charts.

Many hits were to follow, recorded by a parade of hit acts of the time, including The Box Tops, Dionne Warwick, Frankie Valli and The Four Seasons, Ella Fitzgerald, Duke Ellington, Jerry Vale, The Lettermen, Linda Ronstadt, Deniece Williams and Luther Vandross, in addition to the aforementioned Temptations, Little Anthony and the Imperials, The Royalettes and Frank Sinatra.

Teddy Randazzo performed in Las Vegas for four years. Over time, he wrote many classic songs, like "Goin' Out Of My Head", which has sold more than 100 million records by over 400 artists, and ranks in the top 50 of the most recorded songs in the history of records.

In an attempt to be totally transparent, the pie chart below is a preliminary budget breakdown for you to see. Not to completely bore you with the budget details, but it's broken down by category. It represents LIGHTS, CAMERA & ACTION; for what we need the money and how will we allocate it. The 450K is what we need to make this full length motion picture. It covers the minimum cost for cast, crew, and production. Once we reach half of our goal, we will get things in motion, and share with you, the contributors, our progress. Our fundraising campaign will continue until we reach our goal.

Of course, our overall intention is to exceed our goal. By going past the 450K, we would be able to acquire better equipment, a more well-known cast, and better production quality overall. The graph below points out the unlockables as we go past the 450K mark.

This project is near and dear to our hearts. In the summer of 2014, the rough idea was conceived. Some areas were doable, while some others were not. But, we didn't give up. Instead, we decided to team up and figure out ways to overcome all obstacles in our way. Thus, BREATHE was born.
We all come from unique backgrounds, which makes this project "us". We will not give up on something that has brought us closer as colleagues and friends. Better yet, this project has turned us into a family. We are three guys with a passion and a will to succeed. 
  • Joshua Randazzo has a passion for music.
  • Ravi J. Singh has a passion for writing.
  • Teva Batani Jr. has a passion for movie production.
We thought, why not do a film that encompasses the embodiment of all three of these passions.   

We have a ground breaking opportunity to create a full-length feature film that will be funded by you, the audience. The excitement of being a part of this project cannot be expressed in words, it will be expressed when we present to you the best possible story translated onto the big screen. You will see a film that is time-tested and relevant for years to come. 
Nothing worth doing comes without risk. We are placed in the best opportunity possible to complete this project with your help. To overcome any unforeseen  challenges, we need your help to get the word out about our project. Send the link to your friends and neighbors. We have planned for all contingencies and reaching our funding goal will ensure that we can overcome any unexpected challenges. 

Only with your support can we bring the script to life. It is movie fans like yourself that will help the independent films come to the big screen. Help us achieve this funding goal and, in return, we will improve the quality of our film just for your help.

Many of the characters have traits of people you may know in your life. This makes the story very relatable. This story is very heartwarming, with intrigue, suspense, and humor, and that culminates with an incredible message.




TEDDY RANDAZZO || Actor/Singer/Songwriter2007 Rock & Roll Hall of Fame Inductee
What best way to pull the emotions from the audience with a story of this magnitude than with the music of a legendary singer and songwriter like Teddy Randazzo. His iconic music has transcended the test of time and will appeal to all generations to come.
Teddy Randazzo was born into a musical family. His career began at age 15 as a member of the group, The Three Chuckles, with Teddy as lead vocalist on their very first hit song, "Runaround." Soon Teddy emerged as a solo artist, recording such hits as "Little Serenade" and "The Way of a Clown," and later going on to perform as a headliner in shows with legendary disc jockey, Alan Freed, at the Brooklyn Fox and Brooklyn Paramount Theaters in the heyday of the Freed-inspired rock and roll revolution.

Randazzo starred in such motion pictures as Hey, Let's Twist, The Girl Can't Help It, Rock, Rock, Rock and Mr. Rock and Roll. He also made seven appearances on the Ed Sullivan Show, which in future years was to become a prime showcase for major league musical talent, including The Beatles and The Rolling Stones.
Randazzo became totally immersed in the music business, producing and writing songs, as well as forming a music publishing firm with famed producer, Don Costa. He arranged and produced records for a diverse group of talents, including Little Anthony and the Imperials, The Royalettes, The Temptations, The Stylistics, The Manhattans and Frank Sinatra.
In 1957 Teddy Randazzo's creative juices began flowing with major hits like "Pretty Blue Eyes,"  which was recorded by Steve Lawrence and produced by Don Costa, a pairing which quickly brought the disc to number one on the bestselling charts.
Many hits were to follow, recorded by a parade of hit acts of the time, including The Box Tops, Dionne Warwick, Frankie Valli and The Four Seasons, Ella Fitzgerald, Duke Ellington, Jerry Vale, The Lettermen, Linda Ronstadt, Deniece Williams and Luther Vandross, in addition to the aforementioned Temptations, Little Anthony and the Imperials, The Royalettes and Frank Sinatra.
Teddy Randazzo performed in Las Vegas for four years. Over time, he wrote many classic songs, like "Goin' Out Of My Head", which has sold more than 100 million records by over 400 artists, and ranks in the top 50 of the most recorded songs in the history of records.



In an attempt to be totally transparent, the pie chart below is a preliminary budget breakdown for you to see. Not to completely bore you with the budget details, but it's broken down by category. It represents LIGHTS, CAMERA & ACTION; for what we need the money and how will we allocate it. The 450K is what we need to make this full length motion picture. It covers the minimum cost for cast, crew, and production. Once we reach half of our goal, we will get things in motion, and share with you, the contributors, our progress. Our fundraising campaign will continue until we reach our goal.



Of course, our overall intention is to exceed our goal. By going past the 450K, we would be able to acquire better equipment, a more well-known cast, and better production quality overall. The graph below points out the unlockables as we go past the 450K mark.







This project is near and dear to our hearts. In the summer of 2014, the rough idea was conceived. Some areas were doable, while some others were not. But, we didn't give up. Instead, we decided to team up and figure out ways to overcome all obstacles in our way. Thus, BREATHE was born.
We all come from unique backgrounds, which makes this project "us". We will not give up on something that has brought us closer as colleagues and friends. Better yet, this project has turned us into a family. We are three guys with a passion and a will to succeed. 


Joshua Randazzo has a passion for music.


Ravi J. Singh has a passion for writing.


Teva Batani Jr. has a passion for movie production.


We thought, why not do a film that encompasses the embodiment of all three of these passions.   



We have a ground breaking opportunity to create a full-length feature film that will be funded by you, the audience. The excitement of being a part of this project cannot be expressed in words, it will be expressed when we present to you the best possible story translated onto the big screen. You will see a film that is time-tested and relevant for years to come. 
Nothing worth doing comes without risk. We are placed in the best opportunity possible to complete this project with your help. To overcome any unforeseen  challenges, we need your help to get the word out about our project. Send the link to your friends and neighbors. We have planned for all contingencies and reaching our funding goal will ensure that we can overcome any unexpected challenges.  

Only with your support can we bring the script to life. It is movie fans like yourself that will help the independent films come to the big screen. Help us achieve this funding goal and, in return, we will improve the quality of our film just for your help.

story:
The Cast

         

   Julian Richings as Billy           Jessica Kennedy as Katie     Jason DeRosse as Mark

                                       

                             Jonathan Koensgen as Owen    Craig Thomas as Chet

 


   The Writer/Director  -  Jessica Lafrance

The first film I directed was Flowers in February which followed Fred, a jaded man in a senior's residence on a peculiar day in February.  I feel compelled to tell stories with a lot of heart and soul... but also a bit of grit. My first writing credit was The Complicated... a film-noire play which was performed in Montreal and New York City.  I was also one of the writers, producers and actresses for Jill and Jenny - a webseries about two quirky roommates in Toronto, and have been working in the theatre and film industry for over a decade.

    The Cinematographer  -  Zacharie Ready

Zack is a graduate of Humber College's Film and Television Production program, majoring in Advanced Cinematography.  Some of his dramatic credits include the feature film "Reign" (2015), as well as shorts "Among Flowers" (2014), "Fire!" (2014), and "Why Don't We Go Back To My Place?" (2013).
Check out his reel below and click on his name to visit his website.

Where is the money going?

Camera/ Lighting /Sound  $3000
Food for cast and crew $600

Props/Wardrobe/Car rental $700

Post-Production/ Editing/Sound/Colour Correction $2000

Film Festival Submissions $500

Insurance $700

Other: Transportation, Makeup, Marketing, $500

Why this project?

Because everyone can relate to a crazy love, and everyone loves a good con story.

Inspired by love, heartbreak, a parking lot with grafitti and old cars that I would pass by on my way to work every day, and influenced by movies like The Sting, Snatch, and Seven Psychopaths. 

Risks & Challenges

What are some hypothetical challenges we may have to face? 

Sound- that can be a nightmare.  We are filming outdoors- during the CNE (or the Ex) so there's trains, planes, ice cream trucks, kids, car alarms and noisy factories.  So we need an ace sound person with great equipment and a whole lotta patience.  His name is Dennis, and he's good.

Lighting- we are filming outdoors- as mentioned- and indoors.  But the sun moves, clouds happen, apartments can be dark and moody; so we need expert cinematography and crew to make the actors look their best.

Location permits- we are filming on the rough and tough streets of Toronto, so we need permits so the popo don't make us stop!

Insurance- to get the permits and keep people and equipment safe.

Food- people can get sick if we serve them bad food, plus we have an avocado allergy, lactose-intolerant person and someone who hates eggplant- so we need to buy things according to these specifications.  Plus we need an immense amount of liquids and ice because we are filming outdoors.

"I Remember You" 

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help!  Please share this campaign with everyone.  We need your support and love :)  In the words of Chet Baker- (he comes up in the film)
I Remember You
You're the one who made my dreams
Come true...
When my life is through
And the angels ask me
To recall
The thrill of them all

Then I shall tell them
I remember you!

Thank you - we truly appreciate any and all the ways you have supported us in the past, present and future.  Help us make Baby Blues our proudest project yet!

story:
WE ARE SO CLOSE TO MAKING THIS 

                                       IMPORTANT EVENT A REALITY!!! 

My name is Brian Barnard.  I’m a award-winning Canadian filmmaker who has been producing a documentary about Mitochondrial disease over the last year and half.

What is Mitochondrial Disease? Mito is an energy crisis at a cellular level, which causes basic body systems and organs to stop working properly. This is a life-threatening disease that has no cure or treatment at this time.

This project has been a labour of love from the beginning. Most of the production funds were raised through an Indiegogo campaign, with additional funds coming from two non-profit organizations: Mito Canada and Mito Action.

Mitochondrial disease kills more children than all pediatric cancers combined. It is estimated to affect 1 in 4300 people.

Christine Knox, 54, who lives in Victoria B.C., was diagnosed with MITO last year. She was shocked by the lack of information and awareness of Mitochondrial Disease.  As a result of her illness and the stressful ongoing diagnostic process for Mitochondrial Disease, Christine conceived a plan to raise awareness and help others stricken with Mito. Thus, the Mito Quilts of Hope Project was born.


“The film features two of the bravest ladies I have ever met who courageously share their stories with us” Brian Barnard.


We have a dream! Christine and Christy have never met in person but over time via the internet have formed a close friendship. They have a human connection only one can have with the understanding of what the other is going though. Our dream is to have these two courageous women meet in person for the very first time at a special screening of this documentary.

The funds will cover rental of the venue, producing posters and flyers for the event and some travel expenses.

Please share this page, and if you are able, would you also consider making a contribution?

Please go to the gallery and view clips from the documentary featuring Christy and Christine.

Please take a moment and listen to the CBC Radio Canada, All Points West, interview we did to find out more about Mito.
https://soundcloud.com/christine-knox/2014-09-2...

Also here's a link to a story Cheks 6, Vital People with Vee Cooper aired on our goal to raise awareness.
http://www.cheknews.ca/victoria-woman-with-mitochondrial-disease-educates-others-about-her-rare-illness-112362/

Vee Cooper, Chek 6 - Vital People                                                Brian Barnard, Filmmaker

story:
Jack London, child laborer, pirate, sailor, and prospector, rose from poverty to become the highest paid, most popular and most controversial author in the world.

2016 will be the centennial of Jack London's death. Help Ben Goldstein bring the life and work of this iconic American writer to people around the world.

THE FILM

Jack London: American Original  is the first feature-length documentary to tell the amazing story of Jack London's life and how he changed literature and society.

Filmmaker Ben Goldstein weaves  together a treasure trove of rare archival photographs, film footage, choice writings, and interviews with leading scholars to elucidate London’s character, love life, writings, adventures and personal philosophy.

From Director Ben Goldstein

More than 30 years ago I set out to tell Jack London's story on film. While there have been many biographies about Jack London, a true representation of his life, adventures and influence on politics has never before appeared on film.

There have been so many misrepresentations of his life in the Klondike and elsewhere that his amazing true story as well as the scope of his literary contribution has been lost to the vast majority of the modern public.

After many frustrating years of trying to get a commercial film made, I decided, in true Jack London spirit, to go out on my own and make this film with the hope that it would reach diverse audiences.

That is why I am launching this Indiegogo  campaign. My goal is to raise $10,000 to support theatrical and non-theatrical screenings and an online release of the film.

  • Although  getting a documentary into theaters is next to impossible, I believe in this case it is important. I believe the  exhibition of Jack's own powerful photographs of the Japanese-Russian War, the slums of East End of London, the San Francisco Earthquake, the South Seas, and The Mexican Revolution  will be even more powerful on the big screen. These photographs have never been exhibited on the East Coast and have had limited exhibitions on the West Coast.
  • These beautiful photographs combined with Jack's own writings highlight  the adventurous,  uplifting and idealistic nature of Jack's work as he takes on the forces of nature,  injustice and  oppression.
  • WHY JACK LONDON'S STORY NOW?
  • The period between 1890 and 1916 closely parallels our times. The issues of the day were financial panics, exploitation by the robber barons, unemployment, child labor, homelessness, racism, immigration, the labor union movement and Socialism versus Capitalism. In the early 1900’s, Jack London was not only the most popular writer in America, he was the spearhead for much of the political and social dialogue on these matters.

This Indiegogo campaign is about more than just presenting Jack London's life story or getting into theaters. It is about bringing  a new generation of readers to delve into great literature. It is about realizing that the issues of our times: homelessness, unemployment, exploitation of workers, child labor, immigration and freedom,  are issues that need to be constantly explored, discussed and acted upon. It is about bringing this vibrant American Icon and this period of American History to life so we can learn from it. It is about reaching out to a greater number  of people from diverse communities - young and old - to celebrate a passion for life, art and political action.

HOW WE WILL USE THE FUNDS

Our plan is to present showings in theatres in at least 2 major cities: New York and San Francisco as well as in schools and libraries in as many states as possible. After this release we will also make the film available online through digital distribution and DVD's.

What the money will pay for:

    • Theater Rental
    • Targeted online and print advertising in the two cities.
    • A publicist.
    • Travel costs to bring the director to screenings.
    • Legal fees and Insurance.
    • Fees to apply to online distributors.

If we exceed our fundraising goal, we can expand our list of target cities and deepen our promotional efforts.

The film is presently available only to schools and libraries through Kanopystreaming and Tugg, Inc. We want to bring the big screen experience to as many communities as possible through theatrical, non-theatrical and community screenings.

  • REWARDS

As thanks for your partially tax-deductible support, we are offering some great perks like a private streaming link to view the film, limited edition Jack London merchandise, tickets to theatrical openings and more.

Other Ways You Can Help

We know some people can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help.

  • Help us  get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!
  • Like us on Facebook ( www.facebook.com/jacklondonproject) and
  • Twitter ( https://twitter.com/JLondonProject )
  • Recommend us to a school or library.
  • Support our website www.JackLondonProject.com
  • Share this campaign and our trailer with your friends.

Benjamin Goldstein / Filmus is a sponsored artist with Performance Zone Inc (dba The Field), a not-for-profit, tax-exempt, 501(c)(3) organization serving the performing arts community. Contributions to The Field earmarked for Benjamin Goldstein / Filmus are tax-deductible to the extent allowed by law. For more information about The Field contact: The Field, 75 Maiden Lane, Suite 906 New York, NY 10038, phone: see details. A copy of our latest financial report may be obtained from The Field or from the Office of Attorney General, Charities Bureau, 120 Broadway, New York, NY 10271.

story:
Summary

In Bad Faith is a short form dark fantasy drama film written by Charlotte Medina for the San Francisco State University Cinema Department's thesis film class.
It will be shot in mid-November 2015 and edited during the Spring 2016 semester. Part of the film will be shot in the colorful and historical Mission district of San Francisco, with local cast and crew and in local independently-owned businesses and locations.

"Aimee has been practicing witchcraft in order to recover the love of Alex. As she sees nothing is working and he continues to live his life, one day she returns to the spiritual shop where Matilda, her spiritual adviser refuses to continue helping her out. Aimee then needs to come up with a plan to perform an old ritual she has seen in a book, but for this, she needs Alex in person..."

Will Aimee be able to perform the ritual and be able to get what she thinks she wants? 

Help us and you will find out!

The Team

Charlotte Medina – Writer/Director

Introduced by her parents into drawing and sculpture since a very young age, Charlotte began creating characters and telling stories to her family and friends, as well as making mini-comics. Then she discovered the best medium to expand her skills: movies! Her favorite genres are psychological dramas and thrillers, and her goal is to have more diversity in film both in front and behind the camera.


John Uribe - Cinematographer

John is a seasoned cinematographer with a background in narrative filmmaking. His films have screened and won awards at different film festivals throughout California. He's worked on numerous projects throughout the bay area for indie films and corporate productions.


Chuck Marshall - Production Designer

Chuck is a jack of all trades on set and enjoys the toils of script writing and production design. He has attended De Anza College for film and television production and is a Cinema degree graduate of San Francisco State University with an emphasis in scriptwriting and fiction filmmaking. He enjoys long walks on the beach, because inspiration is often found there.


Corelise Specht - Producer

Corelise is a writer, producer, and director passionate about making documentary films that give a voice to those who are typically not heard in mainstream media. She has written, directed, and edited two award winning shorts. Corelise has experience working with nonprofits to create films that advocate for their causes.


Sam Rosen – Producer

Sam is an artist, writer, and filmmaker living and working in San Francisco. He has directed music videos, short films, and documentaries, and hopes to be a screenwriter and director of feature films. In his free time, he likes to shoot film photography.


Erika Yanin Pérez as “Matilda”

Erika is an actress and voice-over artist in the San Francisco Bay area. She graduated from San José State University with a major in Theater Arts and a minor in Radio, TV and Film. She has received on-camera and improv comedy training by Groundling's instructor Guy Stevenson, Tom Logan, Sarah Kliban, Bobby Weinapple, among others. Rounding out her acting endeavors, she has done voice-overs for commercials.

Wendy Moreno as “Mirna”

Wendy fell in love with acting during her time of discovery as a student at UC Berkeley. Having recently graduated from a 2-year intensive program at The Meisner Technique Studio, she is a San Francisco based actress and writer. Since beginning her acting training, Wendy has appeared in numerous short films in the Bay Area, most recently a silent film titled "Please Stay." If she isn't on set doing what she loves, Wendy is writing and producing her own material.


Glenn Sammon as “Alex”

Irish native now living in San Francisco California, Glenn Sammon now pursues his true passion - a full time acting career in his new home city. Glenn's passion to acting started when he was a teenager in his former hometown of Waterford, Ireland. Glenn took a leap of faith when he moved to CA.


Other crew:

Jenn Santos – First Assistant Director

Uma Sakhalkar – Script Supervisor

Jovanni Ramirez – Sound Recordist/Mixer

Braeden Ayub - Boom Operator

Vanessa Woo - Gaffer

Andrei Valladolid - Grip

Jim Vines – Prop Builder

Erin Stokes – Art and Prop Builder

Production Assistants - Eva Malek, Adriana Franco, Thomas de la Rosa


What We Need & What You Get

We need $3,500 US dollars to complete funding which will all go the the making of this film. 

In case we surpass our goal, the rest of the funds will go into bettering the film in post-production, and if there's still enough, to pay for fees to enter to film festivals!

We are offering different perks in exchange for your donation. You can also change the amount. Anything helps!

Risks & Challenges, and other ways you can help

Whether we reach our goal or not, this film has to be made. It is an academic commitment we in the thesis class accept since the moment we decide to submit our portfolios to enroll in the class. Making movies is not free, and we each are already collaborating with our time, some students even working for free, but there are still many fees (such as location and insurances) that cannot be avoided.

If at the moment you can't contribute, please help us spread the word!

Or... If you are by any chance a local restaurant owner, let us know! As you can see a big part of our budget goes to craft services. We will be filming for three days and each day we have to feed about 12 people (breakfast, lunch, snacks).

Thank you so much for your time!

(Introduction video: "Scene 2 of In Bad Faith animated storyboard" - by Charlotte Medina. The final film will be live-action!)
story_txt:
Summary
In Bad Faith is a short form dark fantasy drama film written by Charlotte Medina for the San Francisco State University Cinema Department's thesis film class.
It will be shot in mid-November 2015 and edited during the Spring 2016 semester. Part of the film will be shot in the colorful and historical Mission district of San Francisco, with local cast and crew and in local independently-owned businesses and locations.


"Aimee has been practicing witchcraft in order to recover the love of Alex. As she sees nothing is working and he continues to live his life, one day she returns to the spiritual shop where Matilda, her spiritual adviser refuses to continue helping her out. Aimee then needs to come up with a plan to perform an old ritual she has seen in a book, but for this, she needs Alex in person..."
Will Aimee be able to perform the ritual and be able to get what she thinks she wants? 
Help us and you will find out!

The Team




Charlotte Medina –
Writer/Director
Introduced by her parents
into drawing and sculpture since a very young age, Charlotte began creating
characters and telling stories to her family and friends, as well as making mini-comics. Then
she discovered the best medium to expand her skills: movies! Her favorite
genres are psychological dramas and thrillers, and her goal is to have more
diversity in film both in front and behind the camera.



John Uribe - Cinematographer
John is a seasoned cinematographer with a
background in narrative filmmaking. His films have screened and won awards at
different film festivals throughout California. He's worked on numerous
projects throughout the bay area for indie films and corporate productions.



Chuck Marshall - Production Designer
Chuck is a jack of all trades on set and enjoys the toils of script writing and production design. He has attended De Anza College for film and television production and is a Cinema degree graduate of San Francisco State University with an emphasis in scriptwriting and fiction filmmaking. He enjoys long walks on the beach, because inspiration is often found there.



Corelise Specht - Producer
Corelise is a writer, producer, and director
passionate about making documentary films that give a voice to those who are
typically not heard in mainstream media. She has written, directed, and edited
two award winning shorts. Corelise has experience working with nonprofits to
create films that advocate for their causes. 



Sam Rosen – Producer
Sam is an artist, writer, and filmmaker living
and working in San Francisco. He has directed music videos, short films, and
documentaries, and hopes to be a screenwriter and director of feature films. In
his free time, he likes to shoot film photography.



Erika Yanin Pérez as “Matilda”


Erika is an actress and
voice-over artist in the San Francisco Bay area. She graduated from San José
State University with a major in Theater Arts and a minor in Radio, TV and
Film. She has received on-camera and improv comedy training by Groundling's
instructor Guy Stevenson, Tom Logan, Sarah Kliban, Bobby Weinapple, among
others. Rounding out her acting endeavors, she has done voice-overs
for commercials.


Wendy Moreno as “Mirna”
Wendy fell in love
with acting during her time of discovery as a student at UC Berkeley. Having
recently graduated from a 2-year intensive program at The Meisner Technique
Studio, she is a San Francisco based actress and writer. Since beginning her
acting training, Wendy has appeared in numerous short films in the Bay Area,
most recently a silent film titled "Please Stay." If she isn't on set
doing what she loves, Wendy is writing and producing her own material.



Glenn Sammon as “Alex”
Irish
native now living in San Francisco California, Glenn Sammon now pursues his
true passion - a full time acting career in his new home city. Glenn's passion
to acting started when he was a teenager in his former hometown of Waterford,
Ireland. Glenn took a leap of faith when he moved to CA.

Other crew:
Jenn Santos – First Assistant Director
Uma Sakhalkar – Script Supervisor
Jovanni Ramirez – Sound Recordist/Mixer
Braeden Ayub - Boom Operator
Vanessa Woo - Gaffer
Andrei Valladolid - Grip
Jim Vines – Prop Builder
Erin Stokes – Art and Prop Builder
Production Assistants - Eva Malek, Adriana Franco, Thomas de la Rosa
   What We Need & What You Get We need $3,500 US dollars to complete funding which will all go the the making of this film. 





In case we surpass our goal, the rest of the funds will go into bettering the film in post-production, and if there's still enough, to pay for fees to enter to film festivals!

We are offering different perks in exchange for your donation. You can also change the amount. Anything helps!

Risks & Challenges, and other ways you can help

Whether we reach our goal or not, this film has to be made. It is an academic commitment we in the thesis class accept since the moment we decide to submit our portfolios to enroll in the class. Making movies is not free, and we each are already collaborating with our time, some students even working for free, but there are still many fees (such as location and insurances) that cannot be avoided.

Or... If you are by any chance a local restaurant owner, let us know! As you can see a big part of our budget goes to craft services. We will be filming for three days and each day we have to feed about 12 people (breakfast, lunch, snacks).

Thank you so much for your time!

story:
www.Tammimac.com


What We Need & What You Get

We will utilize every dollar and then some towards the film.  We will use whatever we raise in combination with our own pinched pennies to plow on.  We are very resourceful and TEAM WORK MAKES THE DREAM WORK!  If there is a will, there has to be a way.  That's what my dad say, so it has to be right.

Our perks are designed to get you involved. 
  •  Be involved.  Be inspired.
This movie was born and written with stand-up comedians in mind.  Our goal is to have as many comedians in this movie as possible.  Those you have seen before, and those you have not.. We are shooting for the moon.  If we fall... we may land on a star!

HURDLES..

With many independent projects.. There are hurdles to overcome.  We have a great team in place while still building to become even stronger.  There are already talks in the works for distribution of this film!  That's good news this early on.  

The first hurdle in Hollywood as an independent is to get Funding!  Yes, film making is expensive!  We know, we know... Your asking, "Well how the heck are you going to make a film with 42k?!"  Good question!  This will help us secure great talent, finish production with an awesome crew and equipment.. OH.. and Food for the cast and crew.. Food is good.  Food gives energy.

But that's not all!  42k is only about half of our total budget and we hope to raise even more to increase the total budget.  We are soliciting for liquor sponsors since THE WORKOUT ROOM is a Comedy Club and Bar - We have also pinched pennies for the last year to make this happen.  Been eating beans n rice, rice n beans..


Sharing is Caring!

And after you donate (thanks for that!), please SHARE the project with your friends, family, Facebook and Twitter followers, blog and Instagram folks, stalkers, office buddies, college friends, frat brothers, sorority sisters, kids and grandparents!  Make fliers and pass them around in your office or at happy hour. Overkill? Okay -- Basically, please tell anyone and everyone to check out our page in which ever way suits you to get them to support the project too! 
You can also donate without selecting a perk if you choose.. Just click on contribute at the top right.  Right above first perk.

Broke as a Joke?!  Sharing this campaign personally with your friends and folks via social media goes a REALLY long way to helping us reach our goal, so that is much appreciated!

Feel free to use the Indiegogo share tools below..

Finally, if your company would like to inquire about sponsorship or product placement, email us at theworkoutroom2016@yahoo.com.

                      Y'all come back real soon ya hear?!

story:
On Fri 30th October the catering van of the Birmingham Canal Navigations Society (BCNS) was stolen overnight. This is one of the main fund-raising assets for the Society - it went just before the Smethwick community Bonfire Night event where it was due to earn much-needed funds to help the work of the Society support the use and preservation of local canal network. 

Can you chip in to help purchase a suitable replacement van? The cost is likely to be about £2500-3000 plus any refurbishment/adaptation costs and equipment. Any surplus raised will go towards BCNS funds for putting on community events like the annual fireworks display. 
While the van was insured, these processes take a long time, have excesses if the insurance does pay out, and there will be fettling work to do and equipment to buy for any replacement second hand van we get.  Plus, all the time we don't have a van, we can't earn money from it! We realise there's a faint chance the police might recover the van, but we're told it is unlikely and very unlikely to be undamaged. If a miracle does happen we will let people know so you can cancel your donation if you want (an easy process if done before the end of the campaign). 
If you want to know more about the work of the BCNS, know of a burger van for sale, (or have seen our one up for sale - grrr) or simply if you want to know where you can get superb grub at great canal events around Birmingham and the Black Country, then see the BCNS web page or facebook page
  • www.facebook.com/BirminghamCanalNavigationsSociety
  • http://bcnsociety.com/about/
 "The Birmingham Canal Navigations Society (BCNS) aims to conserve, improve and encourage a wide range of interests in the 100 mile network of the Birmingham and Black Country Waterways known as the BCN. It was formed in 1968 and has been promoting the areas canal system for forty seven years.  In the early days it fought campaigns against the closure of many canals, but now the emphasis is on restoration and promoting awareness."
Registered Charity: 1091760

story:
Short Summary

Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:

  • Introduce yourself and your background.
  • Briefly describe your campaign and why it's important to you.
  • Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve.

Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • Explain how much funding you need and where it's going. Be transparent and specific-people need to trust you to want to fund you.
  • Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited!
  • Describe where the funds go if you don't reach your entire goal.

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know how the difference their contribution will make:

  • Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.
  • Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
  • Make it real for people and build trust.

Risks & Challenges

People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.

  • Share what qualifies you to overcome these hurdles.
  • Describe your plan for solving these challenges.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
Who?

Alysia Fae Klein is an experienced filmmaker, choreographer, dancer and instructor. She is a 2nd-year graduate student in Film & Media Arts at the University of Utah where she currently instructs Film Production. Klein has received several awards for her films, including Best Cinematography, Best Film, was nominated for Best Short Film of the Year by the Fear No Film Festival 2015, and had a film selected for the Salt Lake Comic Con Film Fest 2014. 

What?

Photography by Jung Hee Park

In the science-fiction drama, Splitting the Shell, everyone has a twin who are psychically linked to one another. When one twin dies, the link is broken, leaving the surviving twin in a shattered existence and open for a new connection. These unlinked twins are preyed upon by Ixion, a company who claims to heal and rehabilitate them. However, once these twins are taken, they never return. Underneath Ixion's facade lies a pair of control-hungry siamese twins who lead the company in absorbing as many lost links as possible in order to gain control of the masses. Beyond Ixion's reach, a revolt is rising, spearheaded by Aurora, a strong-willed Ixion escapee. The revolt intends to dismantle Ixion and extract those imprisoned by the one they call Sister. 

Story by Alysia Fae Klein

Screen Writers: Alysia Fae Klein & Erica Rowley. Co-writer: James Westervelt.

This teaser will be filmed in UTAH! 


Why?

  • Brilliant artists deserve to be paid! Our goal is to create jobs for local artists and students who are passionate about their craft. 
  • Filmmaking is expensive! Expenses will include: permits, locations, wardrobe, props, equipment, transportation, catering, etc., and of course the talented cast and crew. 
  • This is a graduate student production. As we all know, students are pretty darn broke. A significant amount of Klein's personal funds have been contributed to the project already; however, $2,000 cannot progress the project beyond pre-pre-production. 
  • It will help us bring our dreams to the screen!!! We hope Splitting the Shell will lead on to either a feature film or a series. 

What We Need & What You Get

We need $8,000 for pre-production, production, and post-production. Shooting begins in 2016. Where does all this money go?

  • The Cast (15-30)
  • Executive Producer: Monica Remes  
  • Lighting and Sound: Justin Chouinard and Brian Measles
  • Camera Operator: J.R. LaFleur 
  • Script Supervisor: Erica Rowley and Jennifer Humphreys
  • Production Assistants
  • Costumes and Props
  • Composer: B.T. Measles 
  • Special Effects 
  • Video Effects 
  • Catering
  • Space Rental and Permits
  • Gas for transportation
  • Makeup: Sahar Khadjenoury
What will you get? 
  • All funders of $5 or more will have their name in the credits!
  • $20 or more: A sneak peek online screening before the premiere.
  • $50 or more: You get a digital copy of the film as well as a special behind the scenes photo.
  • $100 or more: A hand-written thank you card from the director as well as a special gift with the Splitting the Shell logo (oooo, aaahhh!). 
  • $500 or more: You get a Blu-Ray copy of the film autographed by cast and crew.
  • $5,000 or more: We will fly you (within the U.S.) out to Utah to be in the movie! That's right!  

The Impact

This film is a unique form of entertainment. It takes us away from our reality and transports us to another world. It also features a strong female lead and a very diverse cast. Thus, we hope to inspire and add to the representation of women in film as well as people of color. Our aim is to not only deliver a thrilling experience, but to ask the viewer to reflect on their own world, community, and self. 

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Spread the word! Share this campaign with the world! Feel free to use any social media platform.
  • Find us on Facebook, like us, share us, stay up to date on the campaign and production process! 
  • If you know any identical twins in Utah, please have them contact the director! alysiafaeklein@gmail.com (no experience necessary).

story:
The unusual suspects, a retired police officer, Randy Moore, Sr.; retired paralegal, Gwen Wynn;  soccer mom, Erica Evans; and corporate account manager, Tyrone Evans; make up the Carolina Saloon Distillery family, home of “Old Time Shine.” Please check out our video to meet the unusual suspects.

Carolina Saloon Distillery has two goals...to create the smoothest moonshine and establish a family business that will sustain for generations to come. We hope to raise $50,000. Your contributions will enable us to purchase the following required equipment and materials: 

  •  stainless steel fermentation tanks
  •  ice machine
  •  stainless steel tank for disposing waste materials
  •  stainless steel holding tanks for recycling materials and water
  •  bottles, bottle labeler, and bottling machine 
  •  stainless steel tables
  •  raw materials (i.e, corn, honey, fruit, and natural juices)
As with any new business, we expect there will be challenges. To ensure consistent taste and smoothness, the biggest challenge may be the fermentation process. It’s imperative that we accurately mix the correct amounts of fermentation ingredients with the various types of raw materials. It’s equally essential we maintain a consistent temperature in the fermentation room. 
We are extremely excited about our new venture and eager to get to work!  Even though we’re required to provide a donations “Perks” list, we welcome all contributions. If you’re unable to contribute monetarily, please help us get the word out by using the “Share Tool.” 
The Carolina Saloon Distillery family thanks you for your time and support!

story:
Who are Pathogen Films

Pathogen Films is the brain child of Marc Gordge and Ben Atkinson. We met over a year ago to discuss a possible promo video for one of Marc's businesses at a networking meeting and from there the mini series Patient Zero was born. We soon decided to create a film production company joining our two businesses together and so was the start of Pathogen Films.

Ben our director and camera man and has many years experience filming promo films for businesses and providing high quality wedding videos. His expertise in post video editing is second to none which is essential to our project.  More of his work can be seen below in the gallery.

Marc has been working in special effects and prosthetics for over two years incorporating life casting and sculpting into the mix. He is our main script writer and is currently working on his first novel alongside writing a set of mini stories to accompany the Patient Zero series. 

Patient Zero is a planned two year project to create a thrilling, roller coaster ride of a Zombie mini-series. We currently have several short films written with the first currently under production.The shorts will outline the initial outbreak and introduce the main characters, then after these have been released we will begin to film full length episodes covering 2 series.

So far this project has been completely self funded by Marc and Ben but we need your help to make Patient Zero the best it can be. Your contributions will go towards better filming equipment, higher quality prosthetics and props, plus some fantastic locations that will bring Patient Zero to life.

We have a fantastic team of make-up artists, crew and cast working with us on this project, all of whom are volunteers. We have a fantastic cast lined up whom are sure to bring diversity, drama and action to the series. 

All that remains is to ask for your help, please do take a look at our promo video and see for yourselves the passion and commitment the whole Pathogen team have for this series and just maybe you can be a part of something amazing!


Brief Overview of the story

When Russian scientist attempts to steal a new bio weapon from secret lab in Chernobyl he accidentally triggers a world wide pandemic that brings the dead to life, unknown forces begin to move about as those who covert the weapon vie for power. Among the power struggle a group of survivors become involved in the battle between two organisations, zombies and deadly mutations.

Patient Zero holds the key but who are they and who is the mysterious girl in red.

Patient Zero is a fast paced zombie series full of action, twisting plot lines and surprises!
story_txt:
Who are Pathogen Films Pathogen Films is the brain child of Marc Gordge and Ben Atkinson. We met over a year ago to discuss a possible promo video for one of Marc's businesses at a networking meeting and from there the mini series Patient Zero was born. We soon decided to create a film production company joining our two businesses together and so was the start of Pathogen Films.
Ben our director and camera man and has many years experience filming promo films for businesses and providing high quality wedding videos. His expertise in post video editing is second to none which is essential to our project.  More of his work can be seen below in the gallery.
Marc has been working in special effects and prosthetics for over two years incorporating life casting and sculpting into the mix. He is our main script writer and is currently working on his first novel alongside writing a set of mini stories to accompany the Patient Zero series. 
Patient Zero is a planned two year project to create a thrilling, roller coaster ride of a Zombie mini-series. We currently have several short films written with the first currently under production.The shorts will outline the initial outbreak and introduce the main characters, then after these have been released we will begin to film full length episodes covering 2 series.
So far this project has been completely self funded by Marc and Ben but we need your help to make Patient Zero the best it can be. Your contributions will go towards better filming equipment, higher quality prosthetics and props, plus some fantastic locations that will bring Patient Zero to life.
We have a fantastic team of make-up artists, crew and cast working with us on this project, all of whom are volunteers. We have a fantastic cast lined up whom are sure to bring diversity, drama and action to the series. 
All that remains is to ask for your help, please do take a look at our promo video and see for yourselves the passion and commitment the whole Pathogen team have for this series and just maybe you can be a part of something amazing!

Brief Overview of the story
When Russian scientist attempts to steal a new bio weapon from secret lab in Chernobyl he accidentally triggers a world wide pandemic that brings the dead to life, unknown forces begin to move about as those who covert the weapon vie for power. Among the power struggle a group of survivors become involved in the battle between two organisations, zombies and deadly mutations.
Patient Zero holds the key but who are they and who is the mysterious girl in red.
Patient Zero is a fast paced zombie series full of action, twisting plot lines and surprises!

story:
The Enemies Within zooms in on the best kept secret of modern politics. Almost no one is aware of the fact that fewer than 20,000 U.S. communists, socialists and extreme progressives are able to influence the politicians, and even write the laws that control the lives of over 300 million Americans.

We need a minimum of $55,000 to get us started and we will get some folks to match funds. Our full budget is $400,000. This production will take about 1 year from start to completion. It will take thousands of man hours for research, filming, and distribution. 

Your contribution will allow us to dedicate another 6 months into finishing a high-quality film that will change minds and motivate people to get involved and take this country back from the left. 

Trevor is a grassroots investigator and activist. The establishment and news outlets do not want to report what Trevor is going to expose. The establishment does not like to fund films that do not fit their narrative. It will be difficult raising the funds to make this film, but it will not be hard to get the film out to the people. 

Please share this campaign with all your friends. Copy and paste this link on your FaceBook and twitter threads. Ask your local conservative media to interview Trevor about the film. Like the FaceBook page and share it https://www.facebook.com/TheEnemiesWithinMovie.

story:
Saudade The Series is a psychological character-driven drama, about a fatal accident which generates a ripple effect of incidents upon a family, friends, and even distant strangers, where each of their resulting choices of revenge or redemption drastically impacts the lives of one another.

The Portuguese word 'saudade' means the missing or longing for something or someone lost. However, there is the essence of maintained hope for the return of the missing piece and wholeness. Through this series each character portrays this notion with their desire to become whole, struggles with unforgiveness or past traumas, and ultimately their drive to reach their ultimate envisioned dreams. 

Saudade is a reminder that everyone has a story, and life is far much more than coping.

Watch the Official Saudade The Series: Pilot Episode "Collide"


 Saudade The Series was developed and created with the motive to impact, inspire and encourage audiences through each character's relatable story, honest personal struggle, and journey to find hope when all seems lost. Each character faces their own battle with themes such as; PTSD, grief, addiction, alcoholism, and abuse.  This campaign is incredibly important to us because we believe those in the audience can relate to at least one of these characters and help them understand they are not alone in their circumstance or struggle and there is always a way out. We aim to produce honest, gripping and engaging original episodes with cinematic quality and artistic vision, evoking themes of nostalgia, loss, clarity, love, hope and redemption. 

SAUDADE is an incredible journey which began many years ago with the inception of it's characters within Writer & Creator Jennifer Joy O'Grady's imagination. Her idea was sparked by her question; 'how would these individuals respond to and overcome life challenges after losing nearly everything?' After years of developing each character's unique backstory, personalities and triumphs over their struggles, the story evolved into how they all fit together. Jennifer was encouraged by fellow filmmaker Joey Lamar Ashley to pursuing bringing these stories onto the screen. 

Jennifer and Joey decided to executively produce this ambitious passion project. They recruited and gathered a passionate production team. Then they held  a casting call which hundreds of South Florida talent attended. Jennifer and Joey found the perfect cast to breathe life into these layered characters who were at the time simply words on a page. All these members worked relentlessly together as a unified unit with the goal in mind and grew to become the "Saudade Family." 

Creating Saudade took a tremendous leap of faith and is certainly a labor of love. The Saudade Family would love nothing more than to continue this journey together, creating more episodes and see these characters' stories come to fruition on the screen to share with the world and impact audiences. 

All of us who comprise the team that has made Saudade come to life want to see it continue beyond the pilot and we need your help to do it! No amount is too small. With your contributions, we will be able to continue to bring you episodes of this incredible and moving series while giving our cast and crew the opportunity to continue working on a project they love and truly believe in. 

The total budget for the making of this project is $10,000. The budget will be disbursed to the making of season one which consist of at least five additional episodes. Cost expenses includes equipment, location fees,  production design, liability insurance, craft services, hair and makeup, production crew stipends, post-production needs such as editing, music, marketing and then distribution.

Contributors to Saudade the Series will receive exclusive perks. We have many incentives that are personalized and shows gratitude to our supporters. In addition, our contributors officially become a part of the Saudade Family.

In the occurrence where our crowd funding goal is not reach, all donated funds will be used to make at least one episode until we raise the reaming goal amount desired for the additional episodes. 

You can become a part of the Saudade Family, by giving this group of immensely talented and passionate artist the opportunity to collaborate together with the heart motive of creating a story which can impact lives. Saudade The Series is valuable to each contributor as they can help this engaging story be produced in the best quality and shared with mass audiences. Any contribution will get us one step closer to sharing a thought provoking story with the world and impact many lives in return. 

Risks & Challenges

The risks and obstacles we may face on the way to achieving our goals are many. As independent filmmakers, it is vital that every penny spent helps with the making of this series. However, there are situations that can or may become out of our control such as weather, or injury of a cast member that can cause a delay in shooting, or cause us to pay extra for an additional shoot day. However, with organization and structure, we will be financially prepared in the case of such emergencies. 

Aside from contributing to the campaign, there are many additional ways to help! One of the greatest ways you can assist the production of this project is by getting the word out there and sharing it on your social media. Tell about our journey and goals so others can find out about our campaign! You can directly share this campaign to Facebook,Twitter, Instagram and other platforms with the icons at the bottom of this page. Don't forget to visit and share the Official Saudade Website for additional information and content! 

Thank you for your support,

The Saudade Family

story:
Mino Pecorelli, a journalist who in Italy during the years of lead, has had the courage and social mission of telling in his newspaper the greatest political, economic and military scandals. A man who has openly defied the Mafia and international criminal powers by publishing everything on "Mondo d’Oggi" and “OP - Osservatore Politico”, with a very particular style. That is why an assassin killed him at the age of 50. Mino Pecorelli managed to predict in the seventies the future course of Italian politics.

This documentary aims to tell the most emblematic case of Italian politics, the kidnapping and murder by the Red Brigades "on duty" of the President of the Christian Democracy, Aldo Moro , through the eyes of a special reporter. Mino Pecorelli at the dawn of his murder was artfully labelled as a blackmailer by his own murderers.

Rosita, Mino’s sister who always fought for the truth, is part of our Association and actively supports it.

"Roma Kult" is a non-profit Association of young citizens who share knowledge through images.

A film that in Italy may not be granted any public or private funding! That is why, after 37 years, we try to do it with this crowdfunding. The 25,000 Euro will be used exclusively for the purchase of equipment required for the filming of the movie, we all work without compensation.

The DVD of the film will be exclusively available only to those who participate throughout 2016! You could also become a co-producer of the film! (No- profit obviously).

The story of this documentary directly involves many countries of the world in which the secret services have operated and operate in a "deviated" way to pursue their interests: CIA, KGB, Mossad, Stasi ... Dark maneuvers to keep control over Italy, a nation at the heart of Europe and the Mediterranean.

Italy is among the most corrupted countries in the world, its democracy is historically based on mafia powers, and only a collective effort of honest and brave people can rescue it. Let’s fight! Let’s share on social and Indiegogo!

story:
What is Hummingbird?

Hummingbird is a 30 minute short film that will be in production in England over a two-week period at the start of February. Our team is made up of friends and industry professionals and we have been working since June to get this project where it is today.

We are now in the final stages of pre-production with locations and actors in negotiations as you read this. We need your help to make this a great film with talented people on both sides of the camera, capable of winning multiple awards.

Synopsis

The story of two girls in their early 20s who are caught up in a huge online suicide pact. Georgia is a quiet person who is abused at home and after a particularly bad episode decides to seek advice. She finds the website run by Rose which offers young girls a way out by means of mass suicide in order to make a stand, to shine a light on the problems they suffer with and to give others the chance to live a better life than they have.
We follow the two girls on their final night on the Earth through different stories and the sad reality that their lives are coming to an end but their friendship will live on through their memories.
There is a scene involving the main characters stealing a car and going joyriding and as things go from bad to worse, the world catches up with the girls’ extravagance and they make a life and death decision.
Rose will reluctantly jump from a bridge after being chased by police whereas Georgia will overdose but gets saved by a passer-by.

The film will be shot beautifully on the Sony A7s MK2 and the Sony A7r MK2 and will also have footage shot in the snow, on the beach, in the rain, the sun and will also have some shots which will be shown as flashbacks in a life-flashing-before-your-eyes style.

What do we need?

Most of our scenes are set at night, this means that we have had to look into the best lighting and camera equipment to maximize creativity and minimize expenditure to get the best production value.

We have spent all of our resources on essential equipment and securing location permissions. We need your help for us reach our final target so that we can take this film all the way.

Any money that we raise above our target will be spent on improving the quality of equipment and adding production value to the film.

Your Impact

The team have worked incredibly hard over the past few months to get where we are today and we are so excited to get going. We have seen the impact that the public can make through Indiegogo and now we are looking to you for your support. We consider everyone that helps us a member of our team and we look forward to you joining us.

This is your opportunity to be a part of a great team and we have some great perks to choose from so that you get a real taste of being part of the production.

We have a team full of experienced and talented people who have worked on a huge variety of productions from music videos to major film productions. This is a project that an experienced and talented group of friends want to turn into a brilliant short film which we intend to take us to our goal of winning an award at a major international festival.

Thank you

Thank you for showing your interest in our film, we get inspiration from you all and you drive us on to do the best we possibly can. 

Please contribute what you can afford, we have tried to spread the perks out to try and appeal to all audiences and we appreciate every bit of help you can offer.

Extra help

Whether you decide to donate to our cause or not, there is one extra way you can help us. We want to tell the world about our film and with your help, we feel we can achieve that. 

Please spread the word using the Indiegogo share tools, if it's a Facebook status, a tweet or a hand written letter to the Queen, make some noise about our campaign and together, we can make a film to remember.

Thank you

P.S. Here is our Youtube channel for some more behind the scenes videos.

story:
In the late 1800s in the midst of the Victorian Era, lawyer Gabriel John Utterson, a friend and confidant of Dr. Henry Jekyll, investigates a string of murders and mishaps, attributed to Hyde, and how they are connected to his friend's disappearance.

Our story is a direct adaptation from the Robert Louis Stevenson novella set in the dark and dank expanse of Victorian London. 


With our goal set at $50K, we will be able to cover costs from pre-production, through filming and all the way through post. 

Here's a breakdown of Production Costs: 

Remember: our goal is $50K which will allow us to plant the seed that will hopefully grow into a nourishing tree all thanks to your generous support.

By meeting our goal, we can officially Greenlight the film and we are able to: 
  • Provide jobs and a dream project for the cast and crew that have already been working incredibly hard to make this happen. 
  • Secure bigger locations, more authentic wardrobe and set dressing, and the over all production value will skyrocket with every contribution. 
  • Acquire the resources needed for such an ambitious Period Piece with classic standards that we will live up to. 
  • Give interested investors a foundation to build on. 


We get it. There are a number of potential crowd funding campaigns the don't deliver on their final product. We guarantee this is going to come to a finished product. 

Follow our film on IMDb: http://www.imdb.com/title/tt5049446/?ref_=rvi_tt

Each member on our team has enjoyed recent success in the same job they are reprising for this film. We know our stuff and we have a vision. We just need YOUR help to make that vision into something solid and tangible. 

  • NAME TALENT are attaching *pending funds. 
  •  INVESTORS are seriously interested in this film, but we need to secure a seed fund for them to add to. 
  • DISTIBUTORS (yes, plural) have quotes ready, once some funding comes together. Once they see a number in the bank, they may finish funding our budget in Pre-Sales, before we even start filming. 

  • We need your help and every generous dollar can realistically turn into the equivalent of ten. 

  • Period pieces cost more than most other genres, simply due to the authentic requirements and beautiful visuals they contain. 

Filmmaking is tough and making a feature length Period Piece is harder than most. But we will not give up on bringing this story to life! 

Our highest hurdles: 

  • Lodging and Food for the exceedingly talented Cast and Crew.
  • Art and Wardrobe Departments, and the incredibly resourceful people dedicated to them. 
  • Locations, with their required aesthetic and the production value they bring is priceless. 
Our solutions: 

  • The Boston area in rich with theatrical establishments and entertainment groups. We are working with local theaters and costume houses to dress this piece with an accurate class. These venues and their craftspeople deserve any financial compensation we can afford. 
  • One of the most talented and hardworking Location Managers (KAREN STARK) in the industry has been finding us the perfect locations for this film. We need to give back to the locations who will allow our crew into their doors and our priceless Manager for her services. 

  • In order to keep filmmaking alive, we need to offer a sum for the use of these locations. Whether they be public parks or private homes, the kind managers and owners who are granting our use, deserve to be compensated and doing so in a financial way keeps their locations operating and available for the enjoyment of future filmmakers. 

  • MA Film Office has been astounding in their eagerness to help us film in their beautiful State. Thrilled by the fact that we are going to execute this production with efficiency and a minimal crew, they have gone over and beyond to get us hooked up with the best location connections available. 

  • A few local Hotels have been able to provide very good deals on mass quantities of extended stay rooms, to house our non-local cast and crew members. 


Craig Parker as Dr Jekyll
http://www.imdb.com/name/nm0662164/

  • The Lord of the Rings - Haldir
    (The Fellowship of the Ring, The Two Towers, and The Return of the King)
  • Reign - Lord Narcisse
    (TV Series, CW) 
  • Spartacus: War of the Damned - Claudius Glaber
    (TV Series, STARZ)
  • Underworld: Rise of the Lycans - Saban
  • And more...


    • Jed Brophy as Mr Utterson

    http://www.imdb.com/name/nm0112400/?ref_=nv_sr_1

    • The Hobbit - Nori 
      (An Unexpected Journey, Desolation of Smaug, The Battle of the Five Armies) 
    • The Lord of the Rings - Sharku, Snaga, Feature Orc
      (The Two Towers, The Return of the King)
    • The Shannara Chronicles - The Dagda Mor
      (TV Series, MTV & Amazon) 
    • District 9 - James Hope 
    • And more...
    More talent, of similar name recognition, have expressed verbal interest and we are excited to invite them on board as they sign letters of intent! 
    The incredible talents that are expressing interest are signing on, PENDING FUNDS. Which is another reason your contribution will be a priceless gift to the production.  



    We are a team of visionary and talented individuals striving to break farther into the film industry and leave our mark. We are committed to bringing everything we have to table to create the dreams we never dreamed we could create.

    Where in the world is this film going after completion? Potentially everywhere. 
    • Two UK Distribution companies are interested, as are three in the US. Any one of these would secure a humble theatrical release, and more. 
    • With lead actors from New Zealand, and some from the UK interested in signing on, and industry connections in Australia, Canada, and the US, we have incredible potential for widespread international and domestic distribution.
    • Film Festivals we will be submitting to: London International, Cannes, Sundance, Venice, Melbourne, New Zealand International, Toronto, and Raindance, to list some big ones. Along with a large handful of smaller festivals around the US and Europe. 

    Now onward and spread the word!  

    • Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, Blog, and most importantly - word of mouth.

    And that's all there is to it. Join us in bringing this classic tale to life.
