Всичките 14
осемхилядника се намират в Азия в Хималаите и Каракорум. 
Начало на
проекта: 01.09.2015г.
Край на
проекта: 31.12.2020г.
Изпълнител
на проекта: д-​р Атанас Скатов, роден на 11.03.1978г. в гр. Сливен.
Магистър по Растителна защита на Аграрен университет — Пловдив и доктор на
Хумболдт университет Берлин, Германия. Д-​р Атанас Скатов не консумира месо от
януари 2007г, а риба от декември 2009г. В началото на 2012
преустановява консумацията на животинска храна. До лятото на 2010г. Атанас Скатов не извършва почти никаква физическа
активност, като последно се е занимавал със спорт в ученическите си години 1990-1996г.
История на изкачването на 14-те най-високи върха на
нашата планета:
Първия човек,
осъществил този проект е Райнхолд Меснер през 1988г. Били са му нужни 18 години,
за да изкачи всичките 14 върха без използване на изкуствен кислород. За тези 27
години успяват общо 34 човека към днешна дата да стъпят на всичките 14 върха,
между които има и 3 жени. От тези 34 човека 14 не са използвали изкуствен
кислород при изкачванията. Най-бързото изкачване на 14-те върха до момента е осъществено
за 8 години. За изкачване на всеки един от тези върхове е нужна много добра
физическа и психическа подготовка, както и заплащане на такса за върха и включване в експедиция. За изкачване на всичките върхове
са нужни около 230 000 долара, при положение че бъдат изкачвани от първи
опит, което досега не се е случило с нито един алпинист, успял да завърши
проекта си.
Цели на подпроект 2: 
1. 
Изкачване
на 14-те осемхилядници от веган; (за първи път в света)
2. 
Изкачване
на 4-ри осемхилядника в един сезонза 100 дни; (за
първи път в света)
3. 
Изкачване
на 5 осемхилядника в една календарна година; (за първи път в света)
4. 
Изкачване
на 6 осемхилядника за 12 месеца; (за първи път в света)
5. 
Изкачване
на 14 осемхилядника за по-малко от 6 години или колкото може по-бързо от веган,
за да се натовари тялото на възможно максимална степен. (за първи път в света)
Всички набелязани
цели не са постигани досега дори и от човек с общ „нормален“ режим на хранене и
професионална алпийска подготовка. 
7. 
Материал и метод:
-подържане на висока спортна форма,
здрав дух и психика;
-целогодишни тренировки в България и
чужбина;
-вегански режим на хранене; 100% само
растителна храна;
-извършване на подробни медицински и
лабораторни изследвания за здравословното ми състояния;
-събиране на нужните финансови средства
за осъществяване на експедициите;
-всекидневно водене на дневник с
описание на физическата натовареност, консумираната храна по вид и количество и
други важни подробности;
-описване на всяка експедиция в книга и
заснемане на филм;
-разпространение на дейността чрез
презентации в България и чужбина, книги, филми, брошури, участие във фестивали в
цял святи др.;

8. 
Временни
резултати на подпроект 2
На 01.10.2015г, в 5.50 часа непалско
време Атанас Скатов успява успешно да достигне връх Манаслу без да използва
изкуствен кислород. Връх Манаслу е осмият по височина връх на планетата-висок 8165м
в Хималаите, като това е първата експедиция от подпроект 2. Въпреки трудностите
и два неуспешни опити непосредствено преди достигане върха, Атанас Скатов не се
отказва и прави трети опит, като между отделните опити е почивал само 2 дни.
След като достига върха при минус 25 градуса с изгрева на слънцето и цяла нощ
катерене, преди него има 8 алпиниста и се налага да остане 50 минути на едно
място непосредствено под самия връх. След това прекарва още 20 минути в снимки
и видео на върха, Атанас Скатов решава след върха да ползва изкуствен кислород,
който носи за спешен случай и диша около 40 минути на слизане до височина около
7600м. Така Атанас Скатов става първия веган в света, който изкачва върха само
с консумация на растителна храна и по време на експедицията и успява до самият
връх да се изкачи без консумация на изкуствен кислород.
9. 
Изводи и
заключение.
Ако този режим
на хранене се докаже като здравословен за нас хората, би могло да се  намали консумацията на месо и животинска
продукция, което ще доведе до огромно намаляване на замърсяването на нашата
планета в резултат на отглеждането на животни и производството на храна от
животински произход в промишлени количества. Също така ще се освободят
селскостопански площи, които могат да бъдат използвани за производство на
растителна храна и така би могло да се помогне при решаването на проблема със
световния глад и спокойно увеличаване на населението на нашата планета. От
друга страна ще се спре изсичането на горите и джунглите, което сега се прави за
нуждите на животновъдството, както и ще се намали консумацията на питейни
запаси от вода. На освободените селскостопански площи може да започне засаждане
на нови гори и джунгли. Експериментът е
с огромно значение за цялото човечество и за запазването на природата на нашата
планета.
Експериментът
продължава за неограничен период от време. 
За да се проведе
този експеримент е нужна финансова подкрепа.

story:
Short Summary

Haunted Heritage will tell the story of York's gruesome and ghostly past using interviews with historians and witnesses of alleged paranormal activity. Some post production effects and docudrama elements will also be included to heighten the entertainment aspect and draw the viewer in.  

Made Television - a UK television network with four stations - has agreed to broadcast the series.

The pilot episode will be approximately 25 minutes long and will be devoted to the Romans occupation of York. We'll be visiting the Treasurer's House where Harry Martindale witnessed a troop of Roman soldiers in a cellar in the 1950's. We'll also visit the Roman Fortress Baths, the scene of further ghostly Roman activity. The episode will feature interviews with experts on York's Roman past, include little known facts about the Romans as well as re-enactments of the ghostly events allegedly witnessed in both locations. 

Meet the team

John West

John is the writer/producer and co-presenter of a new series devoted to the history of York - a sort of Horrible History for adults with a few fascinating ghost stories thrown in for good measure. 

John has worked in broadcasting for several years, including presenting radio shows for two Suffolk based stations. He's also a regular history contributor to Mustard TV in Norwich - Norfolk's newest TV station - and has appeared on BBC radio talking about the ghosts and legends of Britain. He also writes a monthly series on ghosts and hauntings for a magazine called Psychic News and has written books and articles devoted to the Romans, ghosts, Victorian crime and the English Civil War. One of his books was a history and guide to Roman city and fortress of York.

John's blog can be found at  http://eastanglianghosthunters.blogspot.co.uk/

Tracey Childs

Tracey will provide narration for the series. 

Tracey is an actress with an impressive list of TV and film credits to her name including Dr Who, Howard's Way, Bergerac, Broadchurch, Hollyoaks, Upstairs, Downstairs, Born and Bred, the Scarlet Pimpernel and Jane Eyre.

She has also starred in several Dr Who audiobooks with Sylvester McCoy. 

Tracey is currently a producer at the Mercury Theatre in Colchester, Essex. 

Eileen Aldous

Eileen is the director of the series and has worked as an Art Director, Production Designer, prop-maker and location dressing for BBC, Central, Channel Four and Granada productions. Her TV credits include Spitting Image and the World of Lee Evans. Eileen is the co-owner of East Productions, makers of the series. http://www.eileenaldous.co.uk/Home.html

East Media Productions have produced documentary and event coverage for Gibson Guitars UK and BBC East. They also undertook production designs for the Lotus F1 Team and provided short films for http://www.takemetosuffolk.com/

Stuart Brindle

Stuart is the editor, sound recordist and cameraman. He has over 25 years experience in live theatre and entertainments including music production and sound engineering.

After receiving his degree in drama at the University of Hull, Stuart has worked in live theatre for over twenty years in a wide variety of roles. He has also worked as a lecturer in technical theatre. Credits include lighting design for English Journeys at the Edinburgh Fringe Festival, sound design for Vincent in Brixton at the New Wolsey Theatre Ipswich, writer and director of the one man show: Three Gunshots - the Dark Poetry of Bill Hicksfor Pulse 2007 and sound design for Eastern Angles' 2008 tour of We didn't mean to go to Sea. Stuart also did the sound design for WOLF, the lighting design for Regretrospective at the Edinburgh Fringe Festival 2010 and sound for NACIKETA by Opera Circus at the Royal Opera House.

Sharon Elliott 

Sharon is the co-presenter of the series. She started performing on the stage at four years old with her father and siblings. Singing and dancing in local shows and also performing on radio. After leaving school, Sharon began a career as a dancer travelling through the UK and Europe. She also appeared as a dancer on television.

Sharon is currently a holistic tutor at the Isbourne college in Cheltenham, Gloucestershire. 

What We Need & What You Get

We need £5,500 to make the first episode. The money raised will cover the cost of filming, editing, voice-overs, transport, food, accommodation and props. Any money raised over that amount will go towards future episodes.

  • Pledge £10 and you'll get a thank you on our Facebook page
  • Pledge £20 and you'll get a DVD of the episode and a thank you on our Facebook page.
  • Pledge £50 and you'll get a signed DVD, signed photo of the presenters/ film crew and a thank you on our Facebook page.
  • Pledge £100 and you'll get a signed DVD, signed photo of the presenters/crew, TV credit on the episode and a thank you on our Facebook page.
  • Pledge £500 and you'll get a signed DVD, script, Haunted Heritage t shirt, photo and a thank you on our Facebook page. You'll also be listed as an Executive Producer in the TV credits and be offered the chance to meet the presenters and crew. 

The Impact

We are in the position of already having a UK television network supporting the concept. Made Television in Leeds have agreed to broadcast the pilot episode during a mid-week prime-time 8.00 pm slot on their network. This means that it will reach approximately 1 to 2 million viewers across the entire Made TV network - Leeds,Tyne Tees, Cardiff and Bristol. Made Television also want us to make a further 5 episodes devoted to York. The scripts for these are already completed and will feature on Dick Turpin, crime and punishment, the Vikings, the English Civil War and the plague. Two Halloween and Christmas specials are also planned.

Welcome to Yorkshire - the office tourism website for the county - has agreed to promote the series once made. This will be done on their website and through their other social networking contacts. 

When the first episode is made and broadcast we can then use this as a springboard to get the other episodes in the series made. We also plan to expand the series to feature other cities and counties in the UK.

We aim to make the series as exciting and informative as possible. The series will promote interest in York's history, boast tourism to the city and provide a unique look at York's ghostly past - the most haunted city in the UK.


Other Ways You Can Help

  • Sharing our campaign and/or promo video on Twitter, Facebook, Instagram, email, or any other platform you can think of
  • Tell your friends about Haunted Heritage and share our Facebook page! https://www.facebook.com/UKhauntedheritage/
  • Also share our Twitter page https://twitter.com/tvhauntheritage

story:
Please select a perk when you contribute. ----------->

All Too Human: What's it about? 


(pictured: Jeffrey Arrington; photo by Patrick Kwan) 

After struggling with years of severe depression, Mark has decided that today is the day to end his misery. There is no moral or spiritual philosophy that can bring about Mark’s salvation and convince him that suicide is not the most pragmatic choice to make. Driven by this hard, cold logic he decides to cut himself off from those around him and tries to take his life, but no matter how he tries to accomplish his task, life gets in the way. Throughout his journey, many would-be saviors attempt to convince him that life does in fact have meaning and is worth living. Can any of them get through to Mark and change his mind?

Background on All Too Human: 

Who am I?

I'm Travis D. Brown, a Portland-based filmmaker. After several years of writing, filming, editing and producing short films by myself and others, I have now completed the script for my first, and most personal, feature film. 

What makes life worth living? Do meaning and value actually exist and if they do, who determines their definitions? Does belief in an afterlife, a god, or a spiritual system really provide solutions to our most desperate questions? 

These are all concepts I set out to explore in All Too Human. These are important questions that nearly everyone asks at some point in their lives. The typical answers to these questions that religion offers don't suffice for those of us who don't value faith or are skeptical of the claims religion makes. So what's the alternative?

It is here that All Too Human finds its purpose: to direct the audience’s attention toward reality, to encourage a confrontation with life and to examine our perceptions of life's value without relying on faith or hope for something that may never come; to be at ease with living for ourselves, because we want to live, not because we have to.

The Budget: This is where you come in!

The above breakdown of the budget are estimates of what we'll need for the film shoots themselves and also include the cost of post-production. 

  • Cast/Crew: One of our main goals for this project is to pay as many people as much as we can -- to create our vision while also providing jobs at the highest day rates we can manage. 
  • Gear: Not only do we need further lighting gear, but we also need to rent a van to haul everything around in. Cameras are already covered, which saves us a huge portion of our budget.
  • Post-Production: We'll also be saving a lot of money in post-production because I, Travis, will be doing the editing myself, but we will need hard drives. Many hard drives!
  • Art Department: This includes props and physical effects. We want the film to look as great as possible with minimal computer-generated graphics. 
  • Food/Beverage: We want to provide the most enjoyable working environment possible, which means providing food and beverage on site for the actors/crew during shoots. I will personally provide much of the finances needed for this aspect, though I could use some supplementary money from this campaign.
  • Permits/Insurance: This is needed to pay the city the cost of shutting down a street or two; At least one scene involves a car crash and another includes a busy street - no crosswalk necessary...!
I have been saving my personal funds for this project -- my bank account is committed to making it happen, although it would only cover a small portion of the budget as it currently stands. 
And as we've been doing our research into crowdfunding for film, we noticed that most filmmakers create two campaigns for their projects - one for pre-production and filming and one for post-production. We wanted to attempt to consolidate campaigns and raise money for the whole project in one go. That way, you know that the film won't get caught up in post without ever being released. 
Your dime is going towards making this thing go all the way. 

Who else is on the team? 


Writer, Director, Producer and DoP                                           Travis D. Brown
Reel:  https://vimeo.com/127454338
Travis is a camera operator and director of photography in Portland. He has been working in the film industry for five plus years making commercials, short films and working on others’ features. The main two driving forces behind Travis’ love of film are the technical side of cinematography and his interest in sharing philosophical ideas. 

Co-Director, Producer                                                               Mandy Stockholm
Reel:  https://vimeo.com/109558982
Mandy started as a stage actor and director and has taken her love of acting and directing to the screen. Mandy loves to be behind the camera as well as in front of it. She enjoys utilizing her creative imagination for each new project as an actor, writer and or director.

Assistant Director, Producer                                                         Diego Giovanni                       Diego Giovanni is a jack of all trades in the Portland, Oregon TV and Film community. Diego has worked as a Producer, Assistant Director, Technical Director, Gaffer among other positions and roles in front of and behind the camera. His list of credits include popular TV shows like “GRIMM”, “Librarians”, “Leverage” and films like “Gone”, “C.O.G.”, “Something Like Summer”, “Wild” to name a few. Currently Diego is signed on to AD and Produce on several Features in 2016 and is working to grow his resume as a jib owner/operator. On his off time Diego enjoys cooking, spending time with his fiancé and family, traveling and photography.

Mark (main character)                                                                  Jeffrey Arrington                     Jeffrey’s IMDb
Jeffrey is a local stage and screen actor and a proud graduate of the Portland Actors Conservatory.  Since completing their two-year professional training program, he has appeared in nearly thirty local film projects, including feature-length and short films, television and web series and commercial projects.  In addition to his screen work, Jeffrey has performed on multiple stages around Portland, including the award-winning Northwest Classical Theatre Company, as well as Defunkt Theatre, where he starred in their critically-acclaimed production of Boys in the Band.

More to come! We'll let you know via Indiegogo updates as new cast and crew are announced. 

Other Ways You Can Help

  • The biggest help we can get alongside your contribution is word of mouth. Share this campaign using the Indiegogo share links to spread the word about the film itself and help our campaign reach our budget goals. 
  • "Like" the film on Facebook by clicking here and re-post anything that catches your eye. We'll be posting all kinds of information about our progress on the All Too Human page, including stills from our shoots, background images and info,and philosophical content related to the  film's subject material.
  • Share Share Share! 

And that's all there is to it. Thank you so much for your contribution. 

Let's get this thing made!
story_txt:
Please select a perk when you contribute. ----------->
All Too Human: What's it about? 


(pictured: Jeffrey Arrington; photo by Patrick Kwan) 

After struggling with years of severe depression, Mark has decided that today is the day to end his misery. There is no moral or spiritual philosophy that can bring about Mark’s salvation and convince him that suicide is not the most pragmatic choice to make. Driven by this hard, cold logic he decides to cut himself off from those around him and tries to take his life, but no matter how he tries to accomplish his task, life gets in the way. Throughout his journey, many would-be saviors attempt to convince him that life does in fact have meaning and is worth living. Can any of them get through to Mark and change his mind?
Background on All Too Human: Who am I?
I'm Travis D. Brown, a Portland-based filmmaker. After several years of writing, filming, editing and producing short films by myself and others, I have now completed the script for my first, and most personal, feature film. 


What makes life worth living? Do meaning and value actually exist and if they do, who determines their definitions? Does belief in an afterlife, a god, or a spiritual system really provide solutions to our most desperate questions? 
These are all concepts I set out to explore in All Too Human. These are important questions that nearly everyone asks at some point in their lives. The typical answers to these questions that religion offers don't suffice for those of us who don't value faith or are skeptical of the claims religion makes. So what's the alternative?
It is here that All Too Human finds its purpose: to direct the audience’s attention toward reality, to encourage a confrontation with life and to examine our perceptions of life's value without relying on faith or hope for something that may never come; to be at ease with living for ourselves, because we want to live, not because we have to.
   

The Budget: This is where you come in!
 

The above breakdown of the budget are estimates of what we'll need for the film shoots themselves and also include the cost of post-production.   Cast/Crew: One of our main goals for this project is to pay as many people as much as we can -- to create our vision while also providing jobs at the highest day rates we can manage.  Gear: Not only do we need further lighting gear, but we also need to rent a van to haul everything around in. Cameras are already covered, which saves us a huge portion of our budget. Post-Production: We'll also be saving a lot of money in post-production because I, Travis, will be doing the editing myself, but we will need hard drives. Many hard drives!
Art Department: This includes props and physical effects. We want the film to look as great as possible with minimal computer-generated graphics. 
Food/Beverage: We want to provide the most enjoyable working environment possible, which means providing food and beverage on site for the actors/crew during shoots. I will personally provide much of the finances needed for this aspect, though I could use some supplementary money from this campaign.
Permits/Insurance: This is needed to pay the city the cost of shutting down a street or two; At least one scene involves a car crash and another includes a busy street - no crosswalk necessary...! 
I have been saving my personal funds for this project -- my bank account is committed to making it happen, although it would only cover a small portion of the budget as it currently stands. 
And as we've been doing our research into crowdfunding for film, we noticed that most filmmakers create two campaigns for their projects - one for pre-production and filming and one for post-production. We wanted to attempt to consolidate campaigns and raise money for the whole project in one go. That way, you know that the film won't get caught up in post without ever being released. 

Your dime is going towards making this thing go all the way. 

Who else is on the team? 

Writer, Director, Producer and DoP                                           Travis D. BrownReel:  https://vimeo.com/127454338Travis is a camera operator and director of photography in Portland. He has been working in the film industry for five plus years making commercials, short films and working on others’ features. The main two driving forces behind Travis’ love of film are the technical side of cinematography and his interest in sharing philosophical ideas. 



Co-Director, Producer                                                               Mandy StockholmReel:  https://vimeo.com/109558982Mandy started as a stage actor and director and has taken her love of acting and directing to the screen. Mandy loves to be behind the camera as well as in front of it. She enjoys utilizing her creative imagination for each new project as an actor, writer and or director.


Assistant Director, Producer                                                         Diego Giovanni                       Diego Giovanni is a jack of all trades in the Portland, Oregon TV and Film community. Diego has worked as a Producer, Assistant Director, Technical Director, Gaffer among other positions and roles in front of and behind the camera. His list of credits include popular TV shows like “GRIMM”, “Librarians”, “Leverage” and films like “Gone”, “C.O.G.”, “Something Like Summer”, “Wild” to name a few. Currently Diego is signed on to AD and Produce on several Features in 2016 and is working to grow his resume as a jib owner/operator. On his off time Diego enjoys cooking, spending time with his fiancé and family, traveling and photography.Mark (main character)                                                                  Jeffrey Arrington                     Jeffrey’s IMDbJeffrey is a local stage and screen actor and a proud graduate of the Portland Actors Conservatory.  Since completing their two-year professional training program, he has appeared in nearly thirty local film projects, including feature-length and short films, television and web series and commercial projects.  In addition to his screen work, Jeffrey has performed on multiple stages around Portland, including the award-winning Northwest Classical Theatre Company, as well as Defunkt Theatre, where he starred in their critically-acclaimed production of Boys in the Band.
More to come! We'll let you know via Indiegogo updates as new cast and crew are announced. 

    Other Ways You Can Help 
The biggest help we can get alongside your contribution is word of mouth. Share this campaign using the Indiegogo share links to spread the word about the film itself and help our campaign reach our budget goals. 
"Like" the film on Facebook by clicking here and re-post anything that catches your eye. We'll be posting all kinds of information about our progress on the All Too Human page, including stills from our shoots, background images and info,and philosophical content related to the  film's subject material. Share Share Share!    And that's all there is to it. Thank you so much for your contribution. Let's get this thing made!

story:
Short Summary

We are Engenius Productions. A Los Angeles based production company weeks away from making a feature film. We were completely funded until some phenomenal talent came on board, as well as a location we couldn't refuse. We knew we had to elevate the production value accordingly.  So now we are seeking partners to contribute and get us that little extra we need to make this film spectacular.

What We Need & What You Get

We are seeking $25,000 to cover some additional production expenses, as well as post production.  Should you contribute, we have a lot of interesting perks available that make you part of the process and could get your name or even YOU in the film.
If we do not reach our intended goal, what we do achieve will be put straight into the film to cover production costs.

The Impact

"Hospice" Gives to Hospice. We're excited to announce that we have partnered with a local hospice, and that 10% of all donations moving forward will go to benefit the Citrus Valley Hospice in Los Angeles.  Several of the producers involved with this project have first hand experience, and recognize the importance with caring for the elderly during the last stages of their lives, when caring for themselves simply isn't possible anymore.  So, please visit Citrus Valley Hospice at www.cvhp.org to learn more about their services.

Risks & Challenges

Making a low budget independent film is very challenging. Making a low budget independent film with intense stunts and action sequences is bordering on insane. But we are able to make it happen for a few reason. 1) Each member of Engenius Productions brings resources to the project that others would have to pay tens of thousands for. 2) A cast of highly trained actors that are all capable and eager to perform their own stunts. 3) A first rate cinematographer in Steven Priovolos. 4) Director Jared Bentley's father, Gary Bentley did Special Effects in the industry for 35 years, And while he is gone now, many of his associates have come on board to make sure that the action sequences in this film will be something to remember.

Other Ways You Can Help

If contributing financially isn't possible for you, there are still ways you can be a part of this. Share this link with others that you think may be interested. Or perhaps you have access to resources that you'd rather contribute. We'd love to hear about it!

story: I am Narjes Chyad Alfuraiji, an Iraqi Phd student, who study at the university of Manchester. As a member of Iraq community who live inside Iraq such as  doctors, engineers and academic staff, or outside of Iraq, either as residents or as  postgraduate students via our postgraduate societies in the United Kingdom, the united state of America ,and Australia  with more than 70000 members we are  looking forward to help displaced people in Iraq by raising fund to help them with their requirement.       Internal -displacement monitoring centre in Iraq (IDMC )estimates that at least 4 million Iraqis were internally displaced as of 15 June 2015. Those people have had oforced displacement by terriorsts and fled from war. These people face difficult situation as they accommodated now in a basic sheleters which lack the basic requirement. Some of them as shown in the attached video, are sharing their accommodation with students as they accomdaeted temporarily.                      Our goal is to help them by providing their basic requireiments, providing high quality shelters, rent houses and provide them with cash assistance. We are going to raise fund which will be used to achieve our goal.                                                                          This campaign will change the life of these people, we want to tell them they are not alone and we are all suffering with them. We want to spread love everywhere in Iraq, we want to confront war sequences and united all  Iraqi.                                                     We understand that our goal will be impossible to achieve without your kind support and contribution. Please remember, these people are human being like us and they lost every thing in war,that's why they deserve the best in their life, so let's give them a hand. Please share if you like to support our people and share if you care. Share for love, share for support, share for humanity and share for Iraq.

story:
Short Summary 

  • This is my first short film that I wrote and will direct. Although I am a theater student aiming towards an acting career, I also want to become a filmmaker and gain more film experience to make my first project successful so I can create more films in the future.
  • I want to present what a person's mind would visually look like when they go through this kind of journey but using duality to portray the relationship they have with themselves. In order to learn how to put that onscreen, I will learn more about making short films and working with people that will help me get the job done. 
  • Even if the campaign doesn't reach the goal, all of your donations won't go to waste. 

What We Need & What You Get 

  • Donations are needed to pay for equipment, post production, etc. 
  • Any amount donated including $1 is much appreciated.

The Impact 

  • Bringing "Lonely" to life is important to me because I want to share how anybody with personal struggles can get help for whatever they are going through and to remind those people that they are not alone. The idea is based on a poem I wrote with a similar message called "Loneliness" and it conveys the same message of what it mentally and emotionally feels like to be excluded. 
  • Any amount of donations will still help us as student filmmakers make our dreams come true one step at a time. 

Risks & Challenges    

  • This is my first time directing a project as a non-experienced filmmaker but I am willing to learn more from friends who are experienced filmmakers to put everything together. 
  • Looking for help from friends that have film experience inside and outside of school to develop the project. 

Other Ways You Can Help 

  • Share this campaign on social media and tell all your friends!

story:
Short Summary

My name is Christopher Giron and I am a film student at Columbia College Hollywood working on my bachelors in cinema. I’ve always been attracted to the occult, fantasy, and Science Fiction. I’ve always enjoy wonderful fantasy films like Star Wars, Harry Potter, and the Marvel Cinematic Universe.

I’ve always enjoyed films like this but I’ve always wanted to see more female-driven stories in fantasy universes. As a man, I hate to see women being cast as the girl next door or as the girl who’s just in the scene to look pretty. I want to create a film where women are total badasses—strong, powerful, and having characters with a purpose. Through my time in college, I’ve been developing a fantasy universe ruled by witches called “Tales from the Lunar Provinces”, My main characters are strong and powerful women whose every actions have a powerful impact on the story itself. 

“Coven” is the tragic story of a princess who struggles with the choice of obtaining her crown or losing the love of her life.

What We Need & What You Get

As my project it’s a student film, we are asking for your contributions!

We are asking for $ 10,000

Your contribution will help us with:

Paying for location, permits,make up, catering, and production design.

”Our project is a 501C3 meaning the money you donate, you can claim it at the end of the year on your tax return”.

What you get when you donate :

$20

A special edition mini poster signed by the cast. 

 

$50

Signed mini poster, BTS photos.

 

$80

Signed mini poster, BTS photos, special thanks credit in the film, private link to the film, and if you’re local to Los Angeles you get a ticket to our premiere.

 

$100

Previously listed prices, executive producer credit, and customized character portrait of yourself in the “Coven” universe.

 

$150

All previous listed prices,  a video chat with the director and star of the film.

Every penny counts to make our vision come to life!

story:
I'd never seen a sunrise before. My whole life, I've been told how beautiful it is. And I remember looking at it, then looking at you, then back at it, then back at you, and realizing that you are way more beautiful than some stupid fucking sun.

       - Frank, When the Smoke Fumes (page 8)



 

STRAIGHT TO THE POINT

This is a student film. We are poor, starving, and depressed. Help us. Please.

 

I’m kidding. I’m not the one to beg. However, since this is a student-produced film, our money and resources are very limited. This is where you come in. With the help and support of backers, we, together, can create something special and worth remembering.

 

WHEN THE SMOKE FUMES

Set in early 2000s New York, Emma struggles with the sudden death of her husband Frank, an FDNY firefighter.

 

This is a different side to a story that is reminded to us at least once a year: the events of 9/11/01. Instead of showing the heroics of a firefighter in action, or the PTSD of one after-the-fact, this story shows the perspective that isn’t quite shown in film as the main plotpoint. When the Smoke Fumes tells the story of the wife of a firefighter who died during the attack of the World Trade Center.  How does a wife, a lover, a friend, a mother deal with such a sudden and tragic event? How can a normal, beautiful day quickly turn into something frightening and heartbreaking?

 

One of the main themes portrayed is that every day is a new day. All of the main events of this story take place bright and early in the morning, the beginning of the day.

 

This story is even more so a story about family and moving forward in a harsh world than it is about 9/11 and even firefighting itself. I hope that this story captures that and the little things that make life beautiful and horrifying all at the same time.



 

MY STORY

Thomas Dean Zelios - Writer/Director

 

When the Smoke Fumes is a very personal story for me. Before moving to Florida when I was eight, I lived in Staten Island, New York. In this borough, nearly everyone’s father is a firefighter or a cop, including my own. My father, Thomas A. Zelios served as a firefighter based in Brooklyn for over twenty years. I specifically remember going to his station, Engine 242, seeing all the guys eating and shooting the s**t, guys being called to action zooming down the fireman’s pole, trucks racing out the giant red garage door. I also remember being taken to Christmas parties in some random basement held by fellow firefighters. Santa was there every year; they had music, food, magicians, you name it.

 

The school I attended pre-k at sat on top of a hill, and from this hill you can see the entire landscape of downtown Manhattan. My mother used to work directly across the street from the World Trade Center, eventually being moved to a different building a few blocks away. Every day, when my father was dropping me off at school, I would point at the sky-scraping towers and say “it’s mommy’s building!” They were massive. From the viewpoint I had on top of that hill, they were annoyingly in your face.

 

One day, a very normal day, my father took me to pre-k, as usual. He parked the car on top of that hill around the corner from the school. We got out of the car, walked around, and screaming at us right in front of our faces was a site we still haven’t gotten over to this day: the World Trade Center was on fire. I don’t remember anything else from this day. Only this moment. I remember looking up at my dad’s face and seeing nothing but pure shock. I couldn’t even tell you if I went to school that day. My father was eventually called to action, not as a first responder. He didn’t reach the towers until they had already fallen. There, he was able to grab a piece of rubble and take it home with him as an artifact. A piece of the World Trade Center sits in our living room to this day.

 

The events of 9/11 have meant a lot of my family and I over the years. As a filmmaker and a storyteller, I’ve always wanted to show a side of this event that has never been shown. Shift the focus over and shine the light on unseen darkness. As a Florida resident and student, I wanted to be able to tell a 9/11 story in the most minuscule way possible without having to leave the state or even the city of Orlando. After some intense brainstorming, When the Smoke Fumes was born. A story about the wife of a fallen firefighter set entirely in the house they live in.

 

THE PLAN

Many short films tend to be scenes from an extended feature film or even just a shortened version of one. I, however, like to view short films as their own storytelling medium and method of self-expression.

 

When the Smoke Fumes will be made to hopefully spark future projects my peers and I have prepared. We hope this will be a launching pad to expand our names, talents, and passions. Short films are meant to provoke emotion and to feel something you otherwise wouldn’t feel in a full-length feature. It’s an independent artform.

 

I also set out to tell stories with unconventional plotlines and perspectives. I feel the expansion and broadness of visual storytelling as a whole needs a major reshaping and this is my first step of expressing that.

 

YOUR CONTRIBUTION

Obviously, we will need money. Making a short film is very challenging and has many trials and tribulations throughout the entire process. Through a film celebration (a festival without awards) we hold every year at Valencia College we have already raised $600 for this film. Our goal is to give this project another $2000 to pay off the rest of the following:

 

Locations - $500 - This entire film is set inside of a home. Although it is just one location, finding, funding, and securing a home can be very difficult, mainly since we will likely be filming inside of the home that someone lives in. This amount of money is around the average we would need to rent out a house for three days in/around Orlando, FL.

 

Food - $250 - We have to feed the crew. This might be the most important use of our budget. At the moment, we plan on getting food donated for us for our daily lunch breaks. The $250 we need would solely be used for snacks, drinks, and coffee for the crew throughout the day before and after break.

 

Actors - $1000 - We want to be able to pay our actors! Since the entire crew is made up of students and they are kindly volunteering their time and lives to be a part of this production, we at least have to do our talents justice by giving them a paycheck at the end of each day of principal photography.

 

Music - $150 - We have fired a film composer, a friend of the producer, to create the score for the film. He needs to eat too!

 

Production Design - $400 - This short film is very heavy on the production design as we are attempting to recreate a New York home inside of an Orlando residence. This will include art-related items/dressing such as: furniture, paint, wardrobe, props, etc.

 

Festivals - $500 - The end game is to submit and compete at festivals around the state of Florida and the country as a whole. Most festivals require a fee to submit. $500 is a solid rate solely raised for festivals, with the rest of the leftover funding (if any) being used for submissions as well.

 

Total: $2800

Indiegogo total: $2200



 

If you are reading this

 

I, Thomas, (director) and Jianthonnie (producer) couldn’t thank you enough!

 

Even if you don’t donate, your interest means the world to us.

 

-TZ & JR

I specifically remember going to his station, Engine 242, seeing all the guys eating and shooting the s**t, guys being called to action zooming down the fireman’s pole, trucks racing out the giant red garage door. I also remember being taken to Christmas parties in some random basement held by fellow firefighters. Santa was there every year; they had music, food, magicians, you name it. The school I attended pre-k at sat on top of a hill, and from this hill you can see the entire landscape of downtown Manhattan. My mother used to work directly across the street from the World Trade Center, eventually being moved to a different building a few blocks away. Every day, when my father was dropping me off at school, I would point at the sky-scraping towers and say “it’s mommy’s building!” They were massive. From the viewpoint I had on top of that hill, they were annoyingly in your face. One day, a very normal day, my father took me to pre-k, as usual. He parked the car on top of that hill around the corner from the school. We got out of the car, walked around, and screaming at us right in front of our faces was a site we still haven’t gotten over to this day: the World Trade Center was on fire. I don’t remember anything else from this day. Only this moment. I remember looking up at my dad’s face and seeing nothing but pure shock. I couldn’t even tell you if I went to school that day. My father was eventually called to action, not as a first responder. He didn’t reach the towers until they had already fallen. There, he was able to grab a piece of rubble and take it home with him as an artifact. A piece of the World Trade Center sits in our living room to this day. The events of 9/11 have meant a lot of my family and I over the years. As a filmmaker and a storyteller, I’ve always wanted to show a side of this event that has never been shown. Shift the focus over and shine the light on unseen darkness. As a Florida resident and student, I wanted to be able to tell a 9/11 story in the most minuscule way possible without having to leave the state or even the city of Orlando. After some intense brainstorming, When the Smoke Fumes was born. A story about the wife of a fallen firefighter set entirely in the house they live in. THE PLAN
Many short films tend to be scenes from an extended feature film or even just a shortened version of one. I, however, like to view short films as their own storytelling medium and method of self-expression. When the Smoke Fumes will be made to hopefully spark future projects my peers and I have prepared. We hope this will be a launching pad to expand our names, talents, and passions. Short films are meant to provoke emotion and to feel something you otherwise wouldn’t feel in a full-length feature. It’s an independent artform. I also set out to tell stories with unconventional plotlines and perspectives. I feel the expansion and broadness of visual storytelling as a whole needs a major reshaping and this is my first step of expressing that. YOUR CONTRIBUTION
Obviously, we will need money. Making a short film is very challenging and has many trials and tribulations throughout the entire process. Through a film celebration (a festival without awards) we hold every year at Valencia College we have already raised $600 for this film. Our goal is to give this project another $2000 to pay off the rest of the following: Locations - $500 - This entire film is set inside of a home. Although it is just one location, finding, funding, and securing a home can be very difficult, mainly since we will likely be filming inside of the home that someone lives in. This amount of money is around the average we would need to rent out a house for three days in/around Orlando, FL. Food - $250 - We have to feed the crew. This might be the most important use of our budget. At the moment, we plan on getting food donated for us for our daily lunch breaks. The $250 we need would solely be used for snacks, drinks, and coffee for the crew throughout the day before and after break. Actors - $1000 - We want to be able to pay our actors! Since the entire crew is made up of students and they are kindly volunteering their time and lives to be a part of this production, we at least have to do our talents justice by giving them a paycheck at the end of each day of principal photography. Music - $150 - We have fired a film composer, a friend of the producer, to create the score for the film. He needs to eat too! Production Design - $400 - This short film is very heavy on the production design as we are attempting to recreate a New York home inside of an Orlando residence. This will include art-related items/dressing such as: furniture, paint, wardrobe, props, etc. Festivals - $500 - The end game is to submit and compete at festivals around the state of Florida and the country as a whole. Most festivals require a fee to submit. $500 is a solid rate solely raised for festivals, with the rest of the leftover funding (if any) being used for submissions as well. Total: $2800
Indiegogo total: $2200
 If you are reading this I, Thomas, (director) and Jianthonnie (producer) couldn’t thank you enough! Even if you don’t donate, your interest means the world to us. -TZ & JR

story:
While studying at Stockholms Filmskola (Stockholms film school) together we, Daniel Oliva Andersson and Julia Rabe, decided to make an independent film outside film school. So we teamed up with our friend and talented screenwriter Emil Oscar. Now, six months later, we have developed an amazing story on the subject of loneliness and social isolation in an individualized world. It’s a huge problem in our society and a theme that we really care about. Therefore we really think this film can be a positive influence and make a difference.

Despite the dark theme, Moodtalk is an easy-going and tragically comical story about friendship in a individualistic future Stockholm. We believe in a feel-good film that will give the audience a sense of hopefulness. For that we really need your help to make this film come true. It’s our intention to submit the film to the major film festivals for short films in 2020.

 

THE STORY

Loneliness has become a natural state in a individualistic future Stockholm. The modernization has resulted in a society in which we no longer feel any connection with our fellow human beings. The need of emotional validation and the importance of being seen, however, is still a human necessity and has been replaced by Moodtalk; A telephone service which provides you with a telephone friend, a moodbuddy, who cheers you on and gives you the appreciation you need. Moodtalk is now the common substitute for friendship and relationships. With Moodtalk you are never alone; you are just a tap away from being able to talk to a friend.

Adelia works as moodbuddy and has through her conversations with lonely people developed a dark and cynical view of the outside world. She finds no value in investing in relationships. Everything she needs, including work, can be found in her home. Among all the lonely customers, there is one who stands out from the crowd; Clara. She is easy going and has a positive view of the world and everything around her. Her problem is her denial of her loneliness and of the fact that her colleagues might not be her friends. Clara’s naive view of her "friends" and positivity provokes Adelia and one day, an inappropriate suggestion slips out during a moodtalk with Clara. A suggestion which forces her outside her comfort zone to make things right with Clara...

 

WHAT WE NEED

It's expensive to make a short film. Since we, Daniel and Julia, are producing this film with our own money while being students, we can’t make this story justice without your help!

To make this film we really need your help to pay for:

Locations - The story takes place in a café and a restaurant where we need € 500 to pay their employees for being present while filming during usually closed hours.

Transportation - We will be filming at over 7 locations in 8 days, therefore we will need € 500 for transporting technical equipment and crew.

Food - Since we don’t have the money to pay the crew and actors, all we can offer is food on set. Food is expensive and will cost us € 600 for the filming week.

Props and clothing - To furnish and decorate all the locations and clothe the characters we need € 800.

These are the minimum sums we need raised, excluding the money and equipment we ourselves are contributing to this film. Even if we don't reach the set goal every € will help us make this film as good as possible. We want you to be a part of making the film happen, so please enjoy the perks below! Thank you for supporting our film AND our dreams.

 

WHAT YOU GET

Supporting us will not only result in a short film for you to enjoy; you can also get these amazing perks!

€ 15 - Your name in the credits!
Have YOUR name appear in the credits of the film!

€ 40 - The Moodtalk Movie Poster!
For only € 40 you will get a fine high quality print of the final Moodtalk poster to hang on your wall! And your name in the credits!

€ 60 - The exclusive Moodtalk coffee mug with your name on!
Our directors love coffee, that's no exaggeration! You can get the same exclusive Moodtalk coffee mug that they both have, but with your name on it! And your name in the credits!

€ 100 - The Credits - Poster - Coffee combo!
Do you want all above? Have your name in the credits, a fine poster AND the Moodtalk coffee mug with this get-it-all-combo-discount! And we love you very much!

€ 150 The exclusive Moodtalk T-shirt!
Get one of the ten Moodtalk T-shirts in sweet organic cotton! And your name in the credits of course.

€ 250 - THE VIP
As one out of ten VIPs you don’t just get ALL of the above, but also an exclusive invite to the premiere! Come and eat n’ meet with us and the actors before the premiere! (The food will not be included)

 

Other ways to help?

Contact us at: moodtalk.filmen@gmail.com

And please share this IndieGoGo!

 

WHO WE ARE

This is the main team behind the camera making this amazing short film come to life.

DANIEL OLIVA ANDERSSON & JULIA RABE - THE DIRECTORS
Daniel and Julia are the creators, with Emil Oscar, of Moodtalk and will direct the film together.

EMIL OSCAR - THE WRITER
Emil is the writer of this amazing script.

GEORG SCHIERBECK - THE DIRECTOR OF PHOTOGRAPHY
Georg, a talented and aspiring film photographer, will visualize this colorful and aesthetic film.

HAMPUS OLSSON & ARVID BERLIN - THE LINE PRODUCERS
Hampus and Arvid have produced several films together and will now make sure that Moodtalk makes it to the big screen.

JULIA GAHNE - THE PRODUCTION DESIGNER
Julia is the creative production designer who will design and make the characters’ world come to life.

MARIA ÖSTLING - THE FIRST ASSISTANT DIRECTOR
Maria will make sure that the eight days of filming will run as smoothly as possible.

LOVISA VÄYRYNEN - THE SOUND RECORDIST
Lovisa is the skilled sound recordist and sound designer for the film.

LENA BLOM - THE GRAPHIC DESIGNER / SOUND ASSISTANT
Lena is the designer of the futuristic graphics and media. She is also Lovisa’s sound assistant.

SIGNE AHLSTRÖM SKARSTEDT - THE PRODUCTION AND CONTINUITY ASSISTANT
Signe is both the production designer’s right hand and the continuity assistant.

FINN GROSS MAURER - THE VISUAL EFFECTS SUPERVISOR
Finn will create and supervise all of the many visual effects in this futuristic film.

ANNIKA RABE - THE COSTUME DESIGNER
Annika will create the look of the citizens of our futuristic Stockholm and define the characters.

ALICIA EICHENHOLZ - THE MAKE-UP ARTIST
Alicia is the talented make-up artist of the film!

MALIN KNUTSSON - THE EDITOR
Malin is the amazing editor of this film!

CAST

The key characters will be played by;

HENNY ÅMAN as ADELIA
The cynical Adelia, one of the two main characters, will be played by Henny Åman.
Henny has played at several theaters and have experience of screen acting 

SARA CAHLING ENGLUND as CLARA
The naive and positive Clara, the second main character, will be played by Sara Englund.
Sara recently finished Magnus Ugglas show as a musical  actor.

OSKAR LARING as MARTIN
Martin, one of the social dominant colleagues at Clara's office will be played by Oskar Laring. Oskar is playing the upcoming main character in the new season of "Vår tid är nu".

PONTUS T. PAGLER as IBRAHIM
Ibrahim, also a colleague at Claras office, and Martin's friend is played by Pontus Pagler. Pontus was last seen in "Bron"/"Broen" season 4.

story:
Short Summary

"Girl Beast" is a short drama/horror film about Aubrey, an awkward 12-year-old girl who struggles with fitting in with the cool girls at her school. After embarrassing herself playing Truth-or-Dare, Aubrey is left alone and is attacked, bitten by a wolf. Her body starts to change in unexpected ways... body hair... fangs... a strange desire to eat the class pet... But through this supernatural puberty, her journey culminates into a greater understanding that the real enemy at school isn't the other girls, but an evil man among them. 

"Girl Beast" is almost complete, but we need funds to compensate for post-production, reimburse production fees, and help us with festival entry and promotion. 

This film was made with an indie teeny tiny budget with an incredibly hardworking crew-- half of which were students or recent grads from FSU. We all worked really hard on it, we just want it to be as good as it can and have a chance at being played at festivals!

What We Need & What You Get

Funds will go toward: 

  • Post-production: The DP/editor, the VFX editor, the sound designer, and the music composer, 
  • Festivals: Entry, materials, travel fees, promotion. 
  • Production: Reimbursing costs from production and having a chance to pay some of the unpaid student crew members would be really awesome. 

Who We Are

Zoë DeLeon, the writer/director, is a graduate of Florida State University's film school with a Master's degree in Screenwriting. She likes to make stuff. Several of her other short films have been presented and awarded at festivals internationally. 

Julia Fox, the Director of Photography and Editor of Girl Beast, and Haley DeLeon, Zoë's twin sister and Producer, have collaborated on several other short films with Zoë.

Producer Michelle Calderon and Production Designer Kaleigh Spencer met Zoë at FSU's film school.

Meet the Cast! 

We were soooo lucky to have such a talented cast that gave their time, effort, patience, and artistry to our project back on set in August. 

Acadia Colan as Aubrey 

Akira Jackson as Marilee

Anastasia Mirabelle as Violet 

Christopher Bencomo as Mr. Griffiths

Toni Murdock as Tamora

Eva Coleman as Bernice

 

The Impact

"Girl Beast" is a story we want to share. We believe it's important: 

  • To tell stories from the female perspective,
  • To support independent artists in a climate of sequels and remakes, 
  • To watch things that are different, and
  • To give emerging filmmakers a chance to show their work to hopefully lead to opportunities.

Other Ways You Can Help

We totally understand if you aren't able to contribute monetarily! If you have the time, we'd appreciate it if you could help us out in other ways:  

  • Share this campaign on your social media! 
  • Like our page on Facebook!
  • Follow Zoë on Instagram! 
  • Support female filmmakers indie filmmakers in general by watching their movies!!!!!!! 
  • (And oh, use the Indiegogo share tools!).

story:
Who Are You?

My name is Anthony Canet Jr. and I am the writer/director of the short film "From Heart to Pen". I am a current Valencia College student enrolled in the Film Production Technology program and I, along with my classmates, will be graduating in July of this year.

What is the Story About?

From Heart to Pen follows Penny, a 10 year old girl who spends her days reading and writing. Her overactive imagination brings her characters to life and they provide a welcome reprieve from the worries Penny has about her parent's marriage. However, as the story goes along we see the real world problems Penny avoids begin to seep into her own writing.

As a child I loved to read and my parents divorced while I was still in High School so unsurprisingly there is a lot of "me" in the narrative. The biggest thing I wanted to get across in the film was the importance of communication between adults and children as well as the power of the written word. The only thing better than experiencing a really good tale is sharing it with someone else.

What We Need 

Films are expensive. Through school funding we have raised about 600$ for this specific short but unfortunately that will only cover the bare minimum. Luckily we have equipment and a crew but we'd like to be able to cover additional costs. For example, we might use funds for:

  • Buying catering that meets dietary restrictions.
  • Paying for locations:The film's locations include a family home and a hotel.
  • Supplying our art department with any materials they need for building and creating wonderful sets.
  • Paying talent: we'd like to compensate our actors for their time and dedication to the project.
  • Miscellaneous  expensiveness: Expendable equipment, gas, promotional materials, festival fees

​Why Should I help?

This film is a fantastic opportunity for so many besides myself. It allows Valencia students the ability to work on a production that is created, produced,  and directed by fellow students. This unique opportunity to learn and practice the craft of film making is what produces the next generations of storytellers. The same goes for our amazing cast who will be able to use the film as a way to strive for bigger and better goals. I am so excited thinking about what the film will turn out to be but I'm even happier knowing that everyone working on it truly wants to be here and will become better artists for it. The story  I want to tell is as near and dear to my heart as the people helping me bring it to life.

Other Ways You Can Help (Eg: I'm broke)

Some people just can't contribute, but that's okay!

  • Share this campaign on social media. Just sending the link to the vimeo and this page can do a lot for publicity.
  • Know anyone in the Central Florida area who could help? We are currently looking for cheap/free locations, catering, equipment and anything else that  could help.
  • Send a message of encouragement. If you enjoyed my pitch or just really want to see the final product, send a message and I'll be sure to share it with my crew for a morale boost.

If you're reading this, thank you! Whether or not we get the extra funds I hope you enjoyed seeing what we have to offer. If you have any questions, comments, or concerns please feel free to make your voice heard. Have a great day!
