•      Supporting young talent on/off screen
•      Cast & Crew from all over the UK
•      Experienced crew (BFI, NFTS)
•      Large production
•      Carefully selected cast/crew both experienced and inexperienced
•      Diverse cast and crew to support young people from all backgrounds
•      Proof of concept
•      Already raised over £250 to begin production and to film trailer
•      Fresh perspective on genre
•      Help prove low budget films can look amazing!
•      Registered Production Company                        (Hillpeak Productions Limited)
 
"[I wanted to] focus more on the human survival
rather than the zombies and action" - Writer
 
The deal:
We’re aiming to raise £5,000 from this campaign, our primary goal is to establish an audience and begin production. We have already had a grant of £300 as well as raising almost £300 to begin our project. You can find more details about the finance below.
Our company has a huge advantage in that we comprise of indie filmmakers and many young people. This allows us to budget very efficiently as we are used to working with very small budgets. For example, we will release 5 different trailers over the next few months that have all been made on a budget of £250 for everything, from equipment to props and costumes.
The majority of the £5,000 raised from this initial campaign will go towards marketing as well as the art department and catering. The whole survived project has 4 marketing campaigns each with increasing budget. This fundraiser is being launched alongside marketing 1. Most likely, around £1000-£2000 will go towards the other marketing campaigns with focus on the later stages of development.
During pre-production, our company needs financial resources to allow us to get off with to good start. Here is a short breakdown of our preproduction costs:
·        Admin costs (printing scripts, meeting places, transport) -- £200
·        Actors (Audition venue for 2 days, transport, call out adverts, printing) -- £500
·        Script management (Rewriting, editing, finalizing, research) -- £100
·        Leaflets and outreach -- £100
 
 
The Finance:
The exact production costs for Survived are as follows!
·        Props/costumes and makeup - £2000
·        Locations - £1000
·        Cast/Crew/Exec - £1000
·        Equipment - £2000
The figures above are however, for a minimum budget of £5000 we are hoping to raise further funds with future stunts, crowdfunders, investors and grants our final budget being hopefully around £10,000 to £15,000. These figures will vary and in interest of full disclosure we will keep everyone 100% up to date with figures.
 
Meet the team behind Survived on the website!

 
 
"It has really taught me a lot about
producing and filmmaking in general!"  - Producer
 
The big idea:
Hillpeak Productions Limited, based in Birmingham is a small production company with three founding members, myself William, Jackson and Jagpreet. You can check out our website. Survived will be our biggest project to date, however with such an experienced crew and an amazing script the goals for the project are easily achievable.
The story follows Arthur (our main character) in this post-apocalyptic world. After a disaster at the start of a new life, he is forced to deal with loosing everyone close to him and has to survive on his own for months. After the same routine day after day, Arthur gets picked up by the only living people he’s seen in weeks. He has to take the seemingly kind offer of a safe place to live and survive… But what are the costs?
The planned release of this series is late in 2018, and we’ve already filmed some test shots and scenes for your enjoyment and you can stay tuned to the campaign to catch our periodic trailers.
“As the director of Survived I wanted to do something different to what I know I would have done a long time ago. I remember growing up and thinking how cool it would be to make an action movie with lots of guns and special effects. While I still think, this might be something to embark on in the future, as an indie filmmaker at my age with my experience I would much rather focus on a short and sweet, uncomplicated story.
When my writer (and best friend) came to me with this idea I immediately thought… no way am I making that movie it’s going to end up under budgeted and it’ll look unprofessional and silly. But being the kind person I am I said, go away, script it and keep it simple.
When he brought it back to me I was astounded…? I knew he was on the verge of an amazing story and provided we could keep it simple and focus on the characters we could make it! Sadly, half way through pre-production it hit me (with a nudge from my producer) that we weren’t going to be able to make that series, at least not yet…
UNTIL NOW! So, I look forward to what this project holds and I really hope we can raise the budget to make an amazing film!
 
Facebook
Instagram: survived_series & hillpeak_productions
YouTube
 
"as an indie filmmaker at my
age with my experience I would much rather
focus on a short and sweet, uncomplicated story."  - Director
 
Our story:
The story… Or should I say stories! There’s so many working parts and amazing people involved in this project that it would be impossible to just tell one story. So, let’s start off with the individual stories of our writer, director and producer.
The Director – William Terry-Wright
            The first thing that really ignited my passion for filmmaking was a short summer course I took part in when I was about 11. I’d been making YouTube videos for a long time by then but this course took my filmmaking up by a notch or two! We got to use very professional equipment and it was more or less the spark that I needed, from there I started improving my video quality, I started using an SD video camera and scripting my shorts. I read lots of books on filmmaking, I read blogs, magazines, articles, youtube videos, anything I could get my hands on to learn more about filmmaking.
My best friend at the time and now Hillpeak colleague, Jackson was also making videos for Youtube so we started to partner up, scripting and storyboarding for each other. Sadly, this did not last and school commitments took over our lives. Until 2015 when we both sat down and decided we would start making videos, but this time they would be well scripted and more professional.
Admittedly our early tries were not very successful but we soon got the hang of it and started making more and more videos and started doing film reviews. The shorts we were making were not masterpieces by any means however they each had their strengths. Some were very cinematic, some had lots of action, some were stupid comedy sketches (Yes I still laugh at them to this day) and others were just silly videos we made because we were bored.
It was soon after this that Hillpeak Productions was born. We knew we had to start upping our budgets from double figures and we wanted them to look even more professional. It gave us a platform to pitch with and somewhere to put our best videos.
Then, in early 2016, Survived was born.
We decided we would both embark on our biggest project to date and we began bouncing ideas back and forth. After some debating we pitched two or three to some local filmmakers. Survived happened to be the most achievable so we began storyboarding and scripting. See the survived story for more.
The Writer – Jackson Clifford.
Me and William decided we would embark on our biggest project yet and I started to write the series. Initially it was going to be a short film, however after some consideration we decided to turn it into a 5 part series. This allowed us to pack a bit more in but also leave cliff hangers and let the audience become more invested.
After a few edits we had a great script and we pitched it to a group of young people who were into filmmaking and the rest is history! If we raise the goal then I would starrt to rewrite a bit more to extend and shorten parts to get it as good as possible and do some character building!
 
The Producer – Jagpreet Jhamat
I attended the BFI academy in Birmingham and that's where I met Jackson and Will who told me about Survived. After the academy I was asked to produce it as that is what I ultimately want to get involved in!
It's been very interesting taking part in Survived so far, I've met some amazing actors and actresses and it has really tought me a lot about producing and filmmaking in general!
I hope that we raise a full budget because I really want to see some of these young cast and crew flourish and I also think it is a great story to tell and I would love to be on the red carpet as well! Haha!
 
The Hillpeak Story
Hillpeak Productions Limited is an incorporated company (www.hillpeakproductions.co.uk) conceived by William Terry-Wright and directed by Jackson and Jagpreet. When the name Hillpeak Productions was first born, we had no idea it would grow so big.
It started off as a small youtube channel and a logo that we’d put on our videos. That’s what it was after months of debating and planning. That is until mid-2016 when Jackson and William started making some more professional films. They then met Jag and saw her excellent potential and then, early 2017 Hillpeak Productions was turned into Hillpeak Productions Limited, registered and ready to trade. After just 4 months, the company had gone from just a youtube channel to having a huge, professional website; 5 portfolio videos; 3 directors; 6 employees and a limited company. So naturally our next step is to embark on what we hope will make our company more well known in the industry.
Survived is mostly funded and commissioned by Hillpeak Productions Limited and its partner Riverside films and will hopefully be the start of an amazing business!
 
"I hope that we raise a full budget because I really want to see some of these young cast and crew flourish and I also think it is a great story to tell and I would love to be on the red carpet as well! Haha!"  - Producer
 
Your help?
We’d love to hear from you, send us an email at survived@hillpeakproductions.co.uk and let us know what we did well, what could we do better? Also, we’d love to know if you donated and why! Even if you didn’t donate or want to find out more then we’d love to help!
Either way, please check us out on social media we’re on facebook, instagram, twitter and snapchat! Also, share the campaign with your zombie loving friends and tell them how cool we are!
 
Best wishes,
The Hillpeak Team

story:
WINGS

A CSUN Senior Thesis Film

Written & Directed By Niko Ren

"An international college student travels to America in hopes of pursing his basketball dream."

Message From The Director

We all have that one dream we hold close to us since we were kids. When we grow and try to pursue it, maybe a lot of people will say you can’t do it, you're no good, or you're not even worthy. Trying won't be enough. If you really want it, you must be hungry. You have to fight for it. But above all, you must believe. Just like the main character YuBai, a person must be willing to risk anything in the pursuit of their dreams.

About Us

 

The production of the short film WINGS is founded on a collaborative group of student filmmakers culminating their last year at California State University, Northridge. This project will bring closure as these innovative and talented young filmmakers will apply all their skills in creating a highly professional short film.   

Brief Summary

This story is about a young man from Shanghai named YuBai who travels to the United States in the hopes of becoming a professional college basketball player. As he begins his journey, he encounters difficult challenges such as language barrier, culture shock, and resistance. This experience will test YuBai's limits and see how far he is willing to go to make this sacrifice count. 

Why Contribute

Taking the time to invest in WINGS will help elaborate a short yet entertaining film that will inspire individuals about the importance of sports, effort, and fighting for your dreams. In also providing donations, you will help bring closure to our collegiate level, and will help portray what the future filmmakers will be able to offer the audience. 

Distribution of Donations

Each donation received will be used for the following expenses:

LOCATIONS - We will require a variety of locations. But our primary spot will take place in a full college basketball arena. In order to attain it, we must cover insurance policies, permits, security services, and overall cost for using the space per day, which will be significantly high.

CASTING - Principal cast, two full basketball teams (total of 22 players), cheerleading squad, coaches, and referee's. Also, in portraying on screen a realistic live crowd in an arena, we will need as many extras as possible, who will receive proper payments. 

FOOD - To keep a large cast pleased, a crew with ongoing energy for a full day's work, and a mass of extras happy and patient, they will require the proper fuel; and basic meals such as pizza or hot dogs will only take us so far. 

EQUIPMENT - To capture and portray believable footage, we will require a solid camera package (effective steady cam, cinematic lenses, and full big budget professional lighting setup - all film industry standard) and sound package (high tech multitrack  recorder; multitrack dual system recorder; multiple long, short and wide angle shot gun microphones; and a professional level mixing panel/board). 

SET DESIGN - Proper basketball, cheerleading, and referee uniforms; full size posters and banners; and props that will add the final touches of an arena basketball game. 

POST PRODUCTION - After production, all footage will be polished, selected, and puzzled with additional elements such as music, coloring, and visual effects on a lab. The cost of this lab per hour can be significantly pricey depending on how much time and work our footage needs. 

Additional Help

Another way you could aid us to reach our financial goal is by gifting us your time. Social Media is a very powerful tool which can reach any digital screen in the world. Please help out by sharing our content with your friends, family, acquaintances, and loyal social media followers. Thank you for all your help and effort.

Social Media Platforms:

FACEBOOK: https://www.facebook.com/csuncinema.wings/

INSTAGRAM: https://www.instagram.com/wingsseniorthesis/

ADDITIONAL SIDE NOTE: You can have the opportunity to be in the big screen and get exposure in starring as an extra in our film. Financial compensation will be provided. 

If you have any further questions, please contact us at wingsseniorthesis@gmail.com

story:
Against All Odds - Feature Length Documentary

"Against All Odds is a ground-breaking feature-length documentary from EMMY and double Bafta award-winning director Mags Gavan, Julie Reason and Tami Canal, the founder of March Against Monsanto"

Hi,

My name is Julie Reason, the creator and one of the producers behind Against All Odds, and I would love for you to get involved with our feature-length documentary and be part of something special that needs to be heard.

There are people all around the world who, after being given a terminal diagnosis for cancer, have become cancer free or are living prosperous lives with cancer through changes in their lifestyle, adopting anti-cancer protocols and self-prescribing things such as cannabis oil. 

With cancer rates sky rocketing over the years and one in two people currently being affected by cancer, I feel that as a society we can no longer assume it will happen to somebody else.

When I was diagnosed with stage 4 breast cancer in 2014 my life was turned upside down, and having listened to the medical establishment I was handed a death sentence. Over the last three years I have used a combination of conventional medical treatments and anti-cancer protocols. If I knew then what I know now I certainly would have approached things differently in life.

Our film, Against All Odds, with a bit of injected humour and the help of leading experts from around the world will provide you with an insight why cancer is on the rise and give you an inspiring look into the lives of people who are beating cancer after they have been labelled as terminal. We aim to tell you a story that will open your eyes to some dirty truths, as well as send out a message of hope, especially to those affected by cancer.

I have a duty as a mother to fight for our children's future to ensure they are healthy long after we have gone, like we all should.

 

Our Team

We have some great talent behind the project and with your help we will make a great truly eye-opening and inspiring documentary. Let's tell the world our story!

Where is your money going?

We are ready to share this story with the world but cannot do it without your help.

The Impact

We aim to open the eyes of millions of people worldwide with what is, at heart, a communal film. It will help expose some of the dirty truths surrounding the toxins we are exposed to every day through what we eat, breathe and absorb through our skin.

The medical and science establishments refuse to accept there are people around the world who are reversing their terminal stage 4 cancer diagnoses. These people have the right to be heard and they deserve an audience to tell you their truly inspiring stories. If science cannot provide the solutions and they refuse to explore why such people exist then why do they have the right to deny hope to people with terminal cancer?

Thank you for your support and sharing Everywhere!

Your support is much needed and goes beyond the great perks you receive. Your support also includes sharing this campaign everywhere you can and with everyone you know. Please use the great Indiegogo share tools provided, as well as Facebook, Twitter and anywhere you can! 

YOU are the reason this is all happening. Thank you!

story:
SYNOPSIS

Some Girls follows Mina – a shy teenage girl coming to terms with her desires as she’s swept up in the excitement of rebellious new relationships and the pressures that come with it.

THE STORY

Some Girls is the third short film by writer & director Cait Lyn Adamson. It’s a coming of age story about the experiences of being an LGBT youth, the vulnerable age of being a teenager and trying to understand your desires and identity amongst the intoxication of friendships and the excitement of belonging.

The film follows the main protagonist, Mina, as she navigates her way through new excitements and awakenings. It’s a coming of age story with a different twist – exploring the psychological, claustrophobic and a misguided and darker view of sexual desire and disappointments.

For us the story is a narrative and point of view of female experiences that isn’t necessarily shown enough on screen – the pressures, the crisis of identity, the confusion of experiences and how this effects and hurts us are all elements that Cait Lyn is exploring through in this short film – her thesis graduation project for her MA degree at The London Film School.

It’s an important story to be told and an important narrative that we want accessible for audiences. It’s a story that is relatable to everyone and their experiences in a way – trying to understand themselves, the world around them, and the decisions they make that help or hinder the relationship you have with yourself. Loneliness, longing and an idea we have of love.

For the director, the story is a personal one, inspired by her own experiences of growing up and coming to terms with her own sexuality.

WHY WE NEED YOUR SUPPORT

Some Girls is currently in Post Production and we’re looking for your support to help us complete the last part of the process! Filmmaking is expensive, but we want to deliver to you, the audience and our collaborators the best quality possible for the end product of the film.

Your support would help us complete our editing process, a professional colour grade, sound mix, working with a composer and music rights for the final film. As well as this we are hoping to send the film to international and recognised festivals so it can be seen by even more audiences!

Here’s where your support will go:


  


 

THE CAST

Beth Marie – Mina

Beth is from Portsmouth, UK, with no previous acting experience she took on the role of Mina with complete absorption and sensitivity. As a non-actress she displays an incredible talent, empathy and commitment to the role and really bought a unique vibrancy to the protagonist’s experiences.

 

Katy Reece – Lana

Katy is a London based actress, having worked on several short films and features, plays Lana, who takes Mina under her wing unaware of the desires she has for her. Katy has a compelling and magnetic screen presence and is a talent to look out for in the future.

 

Kate Lassman Long – Georgia

Kate is a London based actress having worked on several short films and commercials. She plays Georgia, tough, intense and intimidating, and has a natural charm and comedic charisma, bringing a fierceness, edge and vulnerability to the character and relationships.

 

THE CREW

CAIT LYN ADAMSON - DIRECTOR 

Cait Lyn Adamson is a London based Producer, Director and Assistant Director currently in her final year at The London Film School MA program. With a background in Comparative Literature, Media and Cinema Studies she has always had a passion for chasing and creating compelling stories.

Cait Lyn is involved in a wide range of film projects from a spectrum of genres and cultures, working on short films that have been made in London, Serbia, Finland, Turkey and the US. She has a creative hunger for unique visions and voices and is highly involved in the collaborative process

LAURA SEWARD - PRODUCER 

Laura is an Irish filmmaker and DJI Ambassador born in the U.S, who after growing up in Nigeria, Indonesia, Australia and Pakistan is now based in London. Whilst undertaking her BA in History at the University of York, she worked as a ski instructor for four years.

After graduation, she began working in film and action sports and has worked with the likes of Red Bull, Monster Energy, Porsche, Formula One, Nitro Circus and Coca Cola. Throughout her time on the Filmmaking MA at the London Film School, Laura is always determined to collaborate and push for films and stories that support girls and women in both sports and the industry

CHLOÉ DELEPLACE - CINEMATOGRAPHER 

Chloe was born in Harvey, IL but grew up in France and Vietnam. After obtaining her BA in International Business (2014), she moved to London to attend the London Film School's MA Filmmaking program. Whilst there, she built an interest for Cinematography but also started working as a freelance Camera Assistant on short films, commercials and music videos.

ISABELLA BRUNO - PRODUCTION DESIGNER

Isabella Bruno is an italian Production and Set Designer. After graduating in Set Design at the Academy of Fine Arts of Brera, in Milan Isabella starts her career in theatre as set and costume designer.
In Italy she works on different theatre shows as set designer. her works goes from contemporary- physical theatre to classics plays.
Currently based in London, she has just got her MA degree Performance Design and Practice at Central Saint Martins. While graduating she curated the design for short films and web series in collaboration with recent graduates from MET Film and London Film School, as well as with independent professional production. Some of her works have been presented in venues as Royal Albert Hall. King’s Cross Studio Theatre, and the House of Illustration of London.

TERENCE CHIM - EDITOR 

Terence Chim was born in Hong Kong. He graduated from University of Nottingham with a BSc Agriculture degree. After his degree in Agriculture, Terence rediscovered a passion for the cinema, and decided to try filmmaking.

He did a 6 months short filmmaking course at the Met Film School before pursuing a masters at the London Film School, where he has garnered a reputation for being one of the most talented editors working there. An aspiring director in his own right, he brings a unique flair for creative story telling to the edit suite.

FREDERICO NOBRE DE CARVALHO - ASSISTANT DIRECTOR

Originally from Lisbon, Portugal, Frederico started his way in the filmmaking industry through the Editing and Grading rooms. After a year at Plural Entertainment, SA in Lisbon, Frederico ventured in Prague where he found the taste of being behind a camera. Now close to graduating from the London Film School, Frederico shares his interest between the roles of Assistant Director, Producer and Production Designer but his true passion lies at Directing.

INSPIRATION

 

Some Girls is inspired by several different genres and narratives. Shot almost entirely hand held, there was a visual intimacy and intensity that she visually wanted to achieve in the storytelling. The director’s biggest inspirations are female filmmakers who bring a unique voice to the world of cinema the likes of Andrea Arnold (Fish Tank, American Honey), Celine Sciamma (Girlhood, Water Lillies, Tomboy), Lisa Cholodenko (High Art, Laurel Canyon) and Sofia Coppola (Lost in Translation, The Virgin Suicides).

 

YOUR SUPPORT

Your support goes a long way! Every little bit helps is us being able to complete the project and bring this story to life! Even if you are unable to contribute financially to the film, please show your support by spreading the word, liking us on Facebook, sharing our campaign and page!

Loneliness, longing and an idea we have of love.For the director, the story is a personal one, inspired by her own experiences of growing up and coming to terms with her own sexuality.WHY WE NEED YOUR SUPPORTSome Girls is currently in Post Production and we’re looking for your support to help us complete the last part of the process! Filmmaking is expensive, but we want to deliver to you, the audience and our collaborators the best quality possible for the end product of the film.Your support would help us complete our editing process, a professional colour grade, sound mix, working with a composer and music rights for the final film. As well as this we are hoping to send the film to international and recognised festivals so it can be seen by even more audiences!Here’s where your support will go:

  
 THE CASTBeth Marie – MinaBeth is from Portsmouth, UK, with no previous acting experience she took on the role of Mina with complete absorption and sensitivity. As a non-actress she displays an incredible talent, empathy and commitment to the role and really bought a unique vibrancy to the protagonist’s experiences. Katy Reece – LanaKaty is a London based actress, having worked on several short films and features, plays Lana, who takes Mina under her wing unaware of the desires she has for her. Katy has a compelling and magnetic screen presence and is a talent to look out for in the future. Kate Lassman Long – GeorgiaKate is a London based actress having worked on several short films and commercials. She plays Georgia, tough, intense and intimidating, and has a natural charm and comedic charisma, bringing a fierceness, edge and vulnerability to the character and relationships. THE CREWCAIT LYN ADAMSON - DIRECTOR Cait Lyn Adamson is a London based Producer, Director and Assistant Director currently in her final year at The London Film School MA program. With a background in Comparative Literature, Media and Cinema Studies she has always had a passion for chasing and creating compelling stories.Cait Lyn is involved in a wide range of film projects from a spectrum of genres and cultures, working on short films that have been made in London, Serbia, Finland, Turkey and the US. She has a creative hunger for unique visions and voices and is highly involved in the collaborative processLAURA SEWARD - PRODUCER Laura is an Irish filmmaker and DJI Ambassador born in the U.S, who after growing up in Nigeria, Indonesia, Australia and Pakistan is now based in London. Whilst undertaking her BA in History at the University of York, she worked as a ski instructor for four years.After graduation, she began working in film and action sports and has worked with the likes of Red Bull, Monster Energy, Porsche, Formula One, Nitro Circus and Coca Cola. Throughout her time on the Filmmaking MA at the London Film School, Laura is always determined to collaborate and push for films and stories that support girls and women in both sports and the industryCHLOÉ DELEPLACE - CINEMATOGRAPHER Chloe was born in Harvey, IL but grew up in France and Vietnam. After obtaining her BA in International Business (2014), she moved to London to attend the London Film School's MA Filmmaking program. Whilst there, she built an interest for Cinematography but also started working as a freelance Camera Assistant on short films, commercials and music videos.ISABELLA BRUNO - PRODUCTION DESIGNERIsabella Bruno is an italian Production and Set Designer. After graduating in Set Design at the Academy of Fine Arts of Brera, in Milan Isabella starts her career in theatre as set and costume designer.In Italy she works on different theatre shows as set designer. her works goes from contemporary- physical theatre to classics plays.Currently based in London, she has just got her MA degree Performance Design and Practice at Central Saint Martins. While graduating she curated the design for short films and web series in collaboration with recent graduates from MET Film and London Film School, as well as with independent professional production. Some of her works have been presented in venues as Royal Albert Hall. King’s Cross Studio Theatre, and the House of Illustration of London.TERENCE CHIM - EDITOR Terence Chim was born in Hong Kong. He graduated from University of Nottingham with a BSc Agriculture degree. After his degree in Agriculture, Terence rediscovered a passion for the cinema, and decided to try filmmaking.He did a 6 months short filmmaking course at the Met Film School before pursuing a masters at the London Film School, where he has garnered a reputation for being one of the most talented editors working there. An aspiring director in his own right, he brings a unique flair for creative story telling to the edit suite.FREDERICO NOBRE DE CARVALHO - ASSISTANT DIRECTOROriginally from Lisbon, Portugal, Frederico started his way in the filmmaking industry through the Editing and Grading rooms. After a year at Plural Entertainment, SA in Lisbon, Frederico ventured in Prague where he found the taste of being behind a camera. Now close to graduating from the London Film School, Frederico shares his interest between the roles of Assistant Director, Producer and Production Designer but his true passion lies at Directing.INSPIRATION Some Girls is inspired by several different genres and narratives. Shot almost entirely hand held, there was a visual intimacy and intensity that she visually wanted to achieve in the storytelling. The director’s biggest inspirations are female filmmakers who bring a unique voice to the world of cinema the likes of Andrea Arnold (Fish Tank, American Honey), Celine Sciamma (Girlhood, Water Lillies, Tomboy), Lisa Cholodenko (High Art, Laurel Canyon) and Sofia Coppola (Lost in Translation, The Virgin Suicides). YOUR SUPPORTYour support goes a long way! Every little bit helps is us being able to complete the project and bring this story to life! Even if you are unable to contribute financially to the film, please show your support by spreading the word, liking us on Facebook, sharing our campaign and page!

story:
The story:

 

My name is Paula Cajiao and I am the creator of the short film “Señorita” a boxing short film that is set to be shot in August.  

 

The heart of the story lies on the lack of connection between a daughter and her father. Paula Andrea is an amateur boxer that wants nothing more than to be trained by her father. A former pro boxer that is unable to be in his daughters life due to his addiction.

 

My mission on this production is to hire minorities in front and behind of the camera. Casting will be lead by Ellyn Long Marshall and Maria E. Nelson from Orpheus casting. Their credits include “Girlfight” starring Michelle Rodriguez, “Real Women Have Curves” starring America Ferrera, “Maria Full of Grace” starring Catalina Moreno.  With their help we will be able to have a strong group of actors that will show how the United States is a melting pot.

 

With all your help we will be able to achieve important aspects of our production such as sound, lighting, camera equipment and craft services.

 

This story is very close to my heart and I can't wait to shine light on issues that we can all relate to and have women lead the way in film.

 

Muchas Gracias!!!

story:
The Curtain Club is one of the oldest and longest-running live music venues in the Dallas neighborhood of Deep Ellum. For more than 21 years countless bands have graced its infamous stage, and fans have crowded in, night after night, to discover new music or hear their favorite local and touring bands play. Sadly, this amazing venue closed it's doors for the last time on June 30th, 2019.


 

When The Curtain Closes is a documentary film about the vibrant history of Deep Ellum’s music scene and what the changing face of the neighborhood means for the future of Dallas’ independent artists. Centered around the closing of the Curtain Club, it tells the story of this incredible venue, and what it has meant to the musicians, bands and passionate fans who have called this place home for a generation.

 

 

More goes into making a film than many people realize. To tell the story right, it takes a lot of interviews. We need to talk with as many people as we can to tell the story of not only our beloved Curtain Club, but also the history of Deep Ellum and its amazing music scene. Plus, we’re out filming the final shows and events associated with the story, as well as what we call B-Roll (the supporting footage that gets cut into the interview to help illustrate what’s being said). Also, our team is busy researching the history, and looking through historical footage and images to be included in the film. And then there’s the score/music for the film, as well as the entire editing process! And that’s just to get the film made. That doesn’t touch upon the marketing, promotion, distribution, etc. As you can tell, this is a massive undertaking; and your support and contribution will help us make all of this happen!


 

To start, we could really use your stories! Have you had a great experience at the Curtain Club? Tell us about it! From stories of meeting your wife, to "That time that guy jumped off the balcony", or "That time my best mate and I dressed up as..." (You get the idea.) Send us your stories. They might even be included in the film!

Secondly, Do you know someone who would make a great addition to the film, who might be open to sitting down with us for an interview? Get us in touch! 

Thirdly, We need to spread the word! Please, tell all your friends and family! Share our page on Facebook! Follow us on Instagram! Tweet about us! The more people who know about our film, the better! And include our Indiegogo link! (Wink. Wink.)

story:
Strange Fruit - a short film by Anthony Rojas

When a Latino college student finds himself being the only person of color at a bonfire, he must fight for his life miles away from home.

Set in 2016, Strange Fruit is a psychological thriller that follows Samuel Rodriguez, a Latino college student, who questions his place on campus. After being ostracized for speaking his already broken-spanish, he is invited by his close white friend, Jacob “Jake” Lyes, who invites “Sam” to a bonfire. Upon arriving, Samuel quickly realizes that this is not a bonfire but some kind attack because of his ethnicity. Samuel fights for his life in an oddly-intimate, disturbing, and degrading series of events.

Strange Fruit will be Anthony's Thesis Film in order to graduate from SUNY Purchase College.

About the Director

Anthony Rojas is a Latino independent filmmaker from Washington Heights, New York City currently studying Cinema Studies, Film Production, and Screenwriting in his last year at SUNY Purchase College. 

His debut into the festival-circuit, Negatives, won "Excellence In Filmmaking" in the Student Film Category at the Inwood Film Festival, March 2019. 

Anthony is dedicated to continuously pushing himself, motivated to continuously learn and confident in his abilities to exceed expectations. He will be the director of Strange Fruit.

 

Why does this film need to be made?

I need to make this film because there is not only an absence of Latinx leads in horror/thriller film narratives— but who’s unique experiences have yet to be reflected on screen. These experiences include:

1. The pre-Trump and post-Trump alienation experienced by Latinx students on college campuses; many of which are first and second generation immigrants and DACA recipients. 

2. Any POC experience when being introduced into a new environment. Having to choose whether to deny the dominant culture and retreat into their own, assimilate into the dominant culture, or create a multi-faceted identity. 

3. Millennials & prior generations witnessing injustices of social, political and economic institutions from 2016 onward.

This film amplifies these struggles; both realistically conveying the daily-intricacies of being a new kid on campus and the extreme of being persecuted for being different. At a glance, a seemingly heightened situation that is grounded in real-life, political events at a singular moment in history: the election of Donald Trump. This film is allegorical for the rollercoaster of emotions many experienced up until the night of the election: being blissfully optimistic, becoming fearful of your surroundings, and being abused to the point of no return.

Why am I the person to make this film?

I am the person to make this film because-- not only have I experienced the struggle of attempting to fit in to one group and being unable to do so-- but have also experienced the fear of being a person of color in an America where gun violence, race crimes and social injustices happen every single day.

This film is a psychological reflection of the emotional journey we have and are currently going through in today’s political and social climate.

*FROM the unique perspective of a young Latino filmmaker presenting these ideas in a visually delicate yet dichotomously disturbing way. It is a reflection of what many people of color, specifically Latinx, have been feeling from 2016 onward.

Strange Fruit possesses extreme cultural relevance and historical association to not only 2016 as a turning-point in history, but as an encapsulation of the Latinx experience living in the United States. Whether that be a college student struggling to fit in, a person who fears stepping out of their home, or a culture being violently stripped of its richness, Strange Fruit encapsulates it all. 

How can you help make this film happen?

The total budget for Strange Fruit is $5000. The funds will be distributed as follows:

Equipment - Strange Fruit will be shot on a Sony a7iii. In addition to an 85mm, we need the necessary lenses to get the variety of shots we need. Also, the necessary lighting kit and gels are essential to bringing the neon-lit, volumetric atmosphere to life!

  • Lenses:  $1,400
  • Lighting Equipment: LED Lighting Kit, Color Gels, & Batteries $500
  • Monitor: $400
  • Fog Machine & Haze Juice: In order to increase the moody and eerie feel of Strange Fruit we need to make it as haze-y and cinematic as possible! $200

(Sound equipment will be rented from SUNY Purchase College)

Film Festival Submissions - Submitting into Film Festival is anything but cheap! It would allow Strange Fruit to make its way around the world and (hopefully) be received internationally! 

  • Estimated Film Festival Submission Costs: $1,000

Marketing - What often goes unnoticed is the necessary funds for marketing! Marketing the film allows for more eyes to find their way to it! 

  • Estimated Marketing Costs: $750

Post-Production - Shooting the film is only half of the work! Now it's time to create this story in the editing room. These funds will go to color grading software and sound design!

  • Estimated Post-Productions Costs: $500

Props/Wardrobe, Crafting & Transportation - The safety and well-being of everybody on set is of the utmost importance! We need these funds to not only buy necessary prop/wardrobe but to feed and transport our crew!

  • Props/Wardrobe, Crafting & Transportation: $250

The Squad

Director of Photography of Strange Fruit

Daniel J. Heinley is a Syracuse born and raised, experienced photographer and New Media student in his last year at SUNY Purchase College.

With his debut as Director of Photography on Anthony Rojas’ directorial debut Negatives; both their photo backgrounds allow for a visually stunning, cinematic experience.

He is an integral part to achieving the “look” of the film. In addition, applying his New Media background to present innovative approaches to his work. He will be the Director of Photography for Strange Fruit.

 

     

 Co-Writer of Strange Fruit

 Austin Schmitt is a Cinema Studies major, Film Production and Screenwriting minor from Rochester, New York in his last year at SUNY Purchase College. 

With a specialization in Screenwriting, Austin dedicates himself to creating the most dramatically interesting and personal stories through the means of a screenplay. He prides himself of his ability to seek the emotional truths of a scene and dissect the intentions behind its characters and in the story.

Austin will be the Co-writer and Script Supervisor for Strange Fruit.

 

Risks & Challenges

Filmmaking is anything but easy. Problems are bound to occur, however, filmmaking is also the art of problem-solving. 

  • Perseverance-- This story NEEDS to be told. Nothing will stop us from telling it. Using our knowledge and skills about filmmaking, we will work as a unit to overcome any possibly discrepancies and make this film happen! 
  •  

Other Ways You Can Help!

We understand that not everyone can contribute financially. But you can please help us spread the word!

  • Share on Social Media!-- Facebook, Instagram & Twitter (you can share this page on all platforms!)
  • Spread the Word!-- If you truly believe in this story-- please spread the word! If you could keep the conversation up-- whether that be posting, email, or personal notes-- it would be greatly appreciated! The more people excited about this film the better!
  • Positive Energy, Thought & Prayers!-- It would mean the world if you send your positive energy, thoughts and prayers our way! Production can often be extremely stressful-- so the extra boost would be much appreciated! 

It will mean the world if you can help Strange Fruit get made!

story:
Three's Company Two

I am an actor, producer, published author and playwright. On May 23, 2019, I was attending the Hoboken International Film Festival where one of my films, The Guilty Prince of Chinatown, was screening. There at the Gala, I met Joyce DeWitt from the very popular TV series Three's Company. I joked with her about doing a Three's Company Two. We had a good laugh about it and that was that. 

The next day I got home and started writing the script and just couldn't stop. Three weeks later I submitted my play to the NYWINTERFEST Theater Festival and it was accepted. It will be staged Off-Broadway at the Hudson Guild Theater on January 20, 22 & 25, 2020 in NYC.

I am starting this crowdfunding so that I can produce this play as a TV Pilot Sitcom.

SYNOPSIS: 

This story picks up on the life of Janet Wood in modern day NYC. Janet is now a widow who recently found out that her husband was deeply in debt due to bad business deals and she is broke. She has a daughter and grandkids that live in Colorado and want her to move in with them. But Janet doesn't want to be a burden on them. So she rents an apartment in NYC and wants to stand on her own two feet.

As it turns out, Janet rents the apartment from someone who doesn't own the apartment and has also scammed two other people.

These two other victims of the scam are: Ricardo Esteban Montenegro, a past his prime, has been, Latin actor who was once the highest paid actor in latin America but finding it hard to get work now a days and Anthony "Tony" Moretti, a real New York blue collar type, recently divorced and bitter that he has to work so hard just to pay alimony .

The three discover they have been scammed and the real landlord wants them out. But they have no money to move so they have to scheme and work together to try and stay right where they are.

story:
The Story

20 years ago Gary Saunders was at the peak of his roller disco game, until he took an embarrassing fall in a competition and vowed to never put his skates on again.

Nowadays he's stuck in an unfulfilling job and the only time he roller boogies is when he stares into the washing machine at the laundrette.

Sally, the new girl at work, is fresh to the town.

Making the best of a bad situation she has already found out about a local roller disco and she asks Gary to go with her.

Will he pluck up the courage to get back on his skates to impress Sally? Will he return to serving mediocre burgers to the unemployed and elderly?

Why do we want to make it?

Who doesn't love a hopeless protagonist on roller skates... right?

This film isn't about Gary getting the girl - its about Gary having the confidence in himself to go to on the date.

This is what Gary learns on his journey through the film, in his head its like the competition 20 years ago when really Sally just wants to go and have some fun.

The Style

In the run up to pre-production we have been watching a number of films taking inspiration from colour and movement to character and dialogue. 

Aside from classic references such as Saturday Night Fever, Roller Boogie and The Get Down we strayed away from the disco and looked at alternative dance films such as Strictly Ballroom, Silver Linings Playbook and I, Tonya.

Here are some stills that we really like:

SATURDAY NIGHT FEVER  - dir. John Badham

I, TONYA - dir. Craig Gillespie

Strictly Ballroom - dir. Baz Lurhrmann

The Crew   

Theres no 'I' in Disco Dynamite.... Right??

Why do we need the money?

You'll be helping us feed our cast and crew, buy/rent costume, hire specialist camera equipment, shoot our ambitious disco scenes, get us from place to place and generally make this film the best it can be, all contributions are massively appreciated and will make a huge difference to us.


Rewards

Although we're asking you for money we really believe that you should get something in return.

Alongside a variety of special Disco Dynamite content, including posters and scripts, our friends at BUMP roller disco have very kindly donated some roller disco tickets to their events in Bristol.

Along with these if you are kind enough to pledge £100 you will receive some brand you roller skates!! Perfect as a re-gift if you think you will never use them (First four receive these)!
story_txt:
The Story20 years ago Gary Saunders was at the peak of his roller disco game, until he took an embarrassing fall in a competition and vowed to never put his skates on again.Nowadays he's stuck in an unfulfilling job and the only time he roller boogies is when he stares into the washing machine at the laundrette.Sally, the new girl at work, is fresh to the town.Making the best of a bad situation she has already found out about a local roller disco and she asks Gary to go with her.Will he pluck up the courage to get back on his skates to impress Sally? Will he return to serving mediocre burgers to the unemployed and elderly?Why do we want to make it?Who doesn't love a hopeless protagonist on roller skates... right?This film isn't about Gary getting the girl - its about Gary having the confidence in himself to go to on the date.This is what Gary learns on his journey through the film, in his head its like the competition 20 years ago when really Sally just wants to go and have some fun.The StyleIn the run up to pre-production we have been watching a number of films taking inspiration from colour and movement to character and dialogue. Aside from classic references such as Saturday Night Fever, Roller Boogie and The Get Down we strayed away from the disco and looked at alternative dance films such as Strictly Ballroom, Silver Linings Playbook and I, Tonya.Here are some stills that we really like:SATURDAY NIGHT FEVER  - dir. John BadhamI, TONYA - dir. Craig GillespieStrictly Ballroom - dir. Baz LurhrmannThe Crew   Theres no 'I' in Disco Dynamite.... Right??Why do we need the money?You'll be helping us feed our cast and crew, buy/rent costume, hire specialist camera equipment, shoot our ambitious disco scenes, get us from place to place and generally make this film the best it can be, all contributions are massively appreciated and will make a huge difference to us.
Rewards
Although we're asking you for money we really believe that you should get something in return.Alongside a variety of special Disco Dynamite content, including posters and scripts, our friends at BUMP roller disco have very kindly donated some roller disco tickets to their events in Bristol.Along with these if you are kind enough to pledge £100 you will receive some brand you roller skates!! Perfect as a re-gift if you think you will never use them (First four receive these)!

story:
It is career day at Lakeside Elementary School and among vets, firefighters, and dancers one child sticks out: Madeline the Exorcist. When a class photo reveals that Toby the guinea pig has red eyes, Madeline must convince the other kids to join her in curing his demonic possession. As the kids go on their adventure, we find the reasoning behind Madeline’s strange goals; she hopes that with enough practice she will someday be able to exorcise her emotionally abusive father. 

While the representation of women in film is improving as a whole, we find that a demographic that is overlooked is that of prepubescent girls. Childhood is one of the most impactful and psychologically complicated times in a person's life, and while films like "We Need To Talk About Kevin" and "Lord of The Flies" effectively explore the compelling topic of the inherent darkness in children, they do this exclusively through male protagonists. In contrast, young girls in film are often one-dimensional and almost always representative of an epitomal naivité or innocence to be corrupted. 

This contrast in representation implies that the struggle with morality is solely one that men go through, something that is both untrue and problematic for young women that cannot adhere to the monochrome portrayal of the female psyche. 

Our protagonist, Madeline George, is a young girl that has been hurt as an innocent and is now struggling with the desire to hurt anther innocent herself. We believe that creating this film is important as it is character study of a dynamic female lead that finds the strength to stop the cycle of abuse she is close to furthering.

Kamila Daurenova is a senior in Tisch studying Film and Television. Dropping out of the Presidential pre-med program of Kazakhstan, Kamila has since written and directed several films mostly in the dark-comedy genre. She is also an avid editor, having previously worked as a Technical Assistant at MTV and currently interning in the post-production department of Saturday Night Live. Her most recent film "LOOP" recently won a Niklas Kalborg Production Fund at the New Visions and Voices Festival which is going towards this project. As a bi-racial immigrant from Kazakhstan she is very passionate about telling the stories of underdog and underrepresented protagonists. 

With an ensemble child cast, three locations, and several car, water and fire scenes we have an amazing team of producers to help with the challenges of the shoot:

Olivia Krueger is an NYC based producer originally from Nashville, TN. She has experience within the camera, sound, G&E, and art departments of production but finds producing is her passion. Angie Urrea is a Junior from Florida that has produced several intermediate narrative films and is currently working on three advanced films while minoring in Environmental Science and trying to minimise the waste and energy used on film sets.  Bethany Huang is a sophomore in Film & TV who has most frequently worked as a Production Designer. Aside from her studies at NYU, she also works at a training center for children. Spencer Collantes is a Sophomore at Tisch that has been a producer for the feature-length documentary Grounded: The Roots of Revolution, which has been shot throughout North America and China. 

Idil Eryürekli is a Turkish director of photography and a 1st AC based in New York City. In the past two years, she’s 1st AC’d more than 15 thesis films and a feature length film, DP'd numerous intermediates, the Advanced TV pilot Something Bigger, and is preparing to shoot 3 Advanced films.

Hyeseung Kim is a junior concentrating in animation & VFX that loves to use her interest in fine arts and illustration for production design. She is also interested in music and games design. Born to Argentinian parents, Camila Grimaldi comes from a rich multicultural background that influences her projects. Aside from film, Camila loves theatre and traveling, and hopes that her career will allow her to merge all three of her passions. 

What your money goes to:

With an ensemble cast of 7-year old actors, our shooting hours are shortened by half and we have to film for more days which spikes up our transportation, location, and equipment rental costs, as well as meaning that we have to provide food not only for the children, but also for their parents. Our story weaves together all the aspects of Madeline's life, so we need to rent three locations: her school, her house, and her family's car, which all request maintenance fees and a hefty rate to accommodate our cast and crew of 30 people. With live animals, a scene with water, and lots of children it is an incredibly complicated film to pull off, but your contribution will help make this film a reality.

While half of the film is light-hearted and comedic, it is grounded in heavy subject matter that we take very seriously. Child mental health and abuse is a difficult subject to tackle in a short film, however we have faith that we can do so, and are working tirelessly to make sure everything runs smoothly.

We believe that this is a very important story to tell, and with your help we will be able to do that! Even if you can't donate, we are incredibly grateful if you can share this campaign!

story:
Our Plan

I am Travis Thornsberry a film student from Western Carolina University and producer of this short film "Champ". We shoot from March 8-10 and plan to have it go around in festivals. For our film we are renting a wrestling ring from George South, former NWA/WWF, so special thanks to him for allowing us to use one of his wrestling rings. We are also hiring an Asheville actor, Miles Rice, who has performed in multiple theater performances along with some films. We are also thankful for our other main actor Jason Ledford who was a featured character in the award-winning 3 billboards as well a filmmaker that has worked on numerous award-winning films. Every dollar you donate helps us get closer reach out goal of creating the film we've dreamed of creating.

What We Need & What You Get

  • For our perks we only offer the four listed on the sides. A special thanks in the end credits, a digital link to view the final product, a signed poster (signed by at least the director, producer, director of photography, and main actors), and finally a signed script (signed by at least the director, producer, director of photography, and writer)
  • Our funding will mostly go to renting out a wrestling ring and our main actors from Asheville. Anything left over is for the art department and post production costs

Director's Statement

This is the most exciting time to be a wrestling fan! The fan base for professional wrestling is at an all time high and there is a high in demand for not just the "big leagues" but for independent promotions all across the world. When I was asked to direct "Champ", I knew I had to make this special because I have a passion for what professional wrestling is on screen and behind-the-scenes. My team and I all share a common interest in the story and we want to share this story with the world. I really hope you enjoy watching "Champ" once it is released. - Noah Ballard

story:
Short Summary

Hi, my name is Matthew Olienechak. and I am a senior in Digital Media Production.  I am looking for some monetary help with my senior project, which will be a culmination of my time spent at the university. I'm looking to make a visually interesting art film, to show that film can be a true art form, and unfortunately, that requires some sizable funding.

That's why I'm reaching out, in the hopes that I can reach my goal through crowdfunding.

What We Need & What You Get

A good film requires props, costumes, and set dressing. That is where most of the funding will go towards, with your excellent art department taking your donations and making the best possible use of them. The rest will go towards feeding the crew and covering admission fees to film festivals.

That's not to say that we'll be the only ones to benefit from your generosity! We have many "thank you" rewards planned, such as:

  • Your name in the credits and on IMDb.
  • Props and signed scripts.
  • Digital downloads of the finished film. 
  • And much more!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you don't have any money you can throw our way, sharing this page with your friends and family will help just as much!

story:
Thank You Indiegogo Donors!

Lukas Kendall here. It's DONE!

I am NOT ASKING for more money to finish SKY FIGHTER!!!

The film is IN THE CAN! FINISHED! COMPLETED!

Naturally, it cost far more than we originally planned or raised to finish the film. But I couldn't bear to come back to donors with an incomplete film. 

So I finished it with my MasterCard. INSANE!

And yeah, the credit card interest is kicking my ass so I would love it if people found the finished film so entertaining they gave more money. It's up to you!

This campaign is the solution to two problems:

1) There is one perk left from the 2018 Indiegogo that I have yet to fulfill: the Ron Jones soundtrack CD. Unfortunately this is impossible to fill...because Ron didn't score the film! So the CD will never exist. (See below for more information.)

So I owe the 2018 donors something that won't exist...and the only thing I can think of to give them is something with MORE VALUE than originally promised: not only the finished score (by a terrific young composer I was fortunate to meet, Bobby Villarreal) but a Blu-ray of the film itself, packaged as double-disc set—as the 251st FILM SCORE MONTHLY soundtrack release.

2) I can't wait to show off the film—but I can't distribute it on the Internet because it will void our eligibility to all-important film festivals. However, I think—I hope—I can give out a private link solely to donors, without running afoul of festival rules.

How to Use This Campaign

If you contributed to the 2018 campaign and are waiting for a soundtrack CD...

You don't have to do anything! The Blu-ray/soundtrack CD combo will be sent to you automatically later this year (after the film finishes its festival run)!

Also, I will email you the private viewing link—as I will be sending that to ALL our 2018 donors so they can view the film.

However, if you want to help MORE:

1) You can UPGRADE to the autographed copy of the Blu-Ray/soundtrack CD for $15.

2) OR, you can buy the new, 2019 discount code package (good at Screen Archives for FSM CDs, Buy Soundtrax and La-La Land Records) for $49.

3) OR, you can buy the new, 2019 discount code package (good at Screen Archives for FSM CDs, Buy Soundtrax and La-La Land Records) AND get the autograph UPGRADE for $59.

If you are a NEW DONOR:

1) Just ignore the choices at the $15 and $59 levels—those involve upgrading a perk from last year that doesn't apply to you.

Who Did You Make the Short With?

Lots of people and they were soooo amazing! See the credits at IMDB.

Our cast are Tom Maden (Scream: TV Series), Jess Gabor (Shameless), Erik Palladino (ER), Declan Churchill Carter (as the younger version of Tom's character) and Richard Epcar (a voice from Robotech and numerous other anime and video game projects).  

Crew include Producers Levi Smock, Daniel Marks, Christine Sheaks, Executive Producer Daniel Brandt and Associate Producer Craig Rogers (from our first Indiegogo—thanks Craig!). 

The spectacular cinematography is by Daniel Marks, the production design by Benjamin Ralston, the VFX by Tobias Richter and The Light Works, costume design by Megan Lian, editing by Robert Meyer Burnett and music by Bobby Villarreal. Many thanks to FSM art director Joe Sikoryak for the titles! And, of course, to the many more people who comprised the crew and helped the production in so many ways—including our 2018 Indiegogo supporters!

Our 2018 Indiegogo contributors, with perk to get credit on the film itself:

Why No Ron Jones Score?

Ron and I just couldn't get on the same page creatively because I wanted a retro synth score, and while he actually did many of the 1980s synth scores that influenced what I wanted, that wasn't where he is at as an artist right now. Also, he lives north of Seattle (he has a beautiful facility called SkyMuse Studios) while I am in Los Angeles, and I can't easily travel with small kids at home. So logistically we had a hard time communicating. 

I'm truly sorry for the folks expecting a new Ron Jones score—I was too. These things happen!

I am so happy with Bobby Villarreal's score and look forward to saying more about him and his music once everybody has a chance to watch the film!

Are You Making a Feature Version?

I sure hope so! I have written a feature script of SKY FIGHTER (not a continuation of the short, but a longer story based on the same characters and premise) and my producing partners and I are actively trying to get it made. 

Truly, thank you to all our Indiegogo supporters for giving me the opportunity to direct the short and prove myself as a filmmaker!

FSM CDs—The Discounts

Film Score Monthly was a magazine and record label that I created while in high school (1990) and still exists today as a website and subscription pay site. Between 1996 and 2012 we released 250 albums of classic film and television scores. Today, roughly half the catalog is sold out, with the other half largely out of print and the remaining inventory sold off by our distributor, Screen Archives Entertainment. 

Whether you are a longtime collector looking to fill holes in your collection, or a neophyte interested in getting a few key collectibles (there are some great sci-fi titles in here, like Logan's Run, Outland and The Thing From Another World), this is a great opportunity to pick up titles at huge discounts! Donate to this Indiegogo campaign and you'll get a discount code for SAE that lets you get up to 75% off most of the remaining catalog.

Here's a jingle by Lalo Schifrin (from THX 1138) to get you in the shopping mood!

Following are the titles being discounted:

75% OFF these titles ($5 each for single-disc albums):

36 Hours (Dimitri Tiomkin)
Above and Beyond (Hugo Friedhofer)—one of my favorites!
All Fall Down/The Outrage (Alex North)
The Americanization of Emily/The Sandpiper/Drums of Africa (Johnny Mandel) 3CD set
The Belle of New York (musical)
Bell, Book and Candle/1001 Arabian Knights (George Duning)
Between Heaven and Hell/Soldier of Fortune (Hugo Friedhofer)
The Big Bus (David Shire)—great 1970s disaster comedy score!
Big Wednesday (Basil Poledouris)—stirring symphonic score to John Milius surfing movie
Broken Lance (Leigh Harline)
Cain’s Hundred (Jerry Goldsmith) early TV crime series
The Cobweb/Edge of the City (Leonard Rosenman)
The Comedians/Hotel Paradiso (Laurence Rosenthal) 2CD set
Crossed Swords (Maurice Jarre) great adventure score!
David Raksin at M-G-M (5CD set of rare scores)
Deadfall (John Barry)
Dead Ringer (Andre Previn)—great macabre suspense score!
The Devil at 4 O’Clock/The Victors (George Duning/Sol Kaplan)
Diamond Head/Gone With the Wave (John Williams/Lalo Schifrin)
Diane (Miklós Rózsa) 2CD set
Dragon Seed (Herbert Stothart)
Eye of the Devil (Gary McFarland)—great melodic horror score!
The 5,000 Fingers of Dr. T (classic Dr. Seuss musical, Frederick Hollander) 3CD set
The Great Santini (Elmer Bernstein)
Green Fire/Bhowani Junction (Miklós Rózsa)
The Gypsy Moths (Elmer Bernstein)—beautiful!
Home From the Hill (Bronislau Kaper)
The Homecoming: A Christmas Story/Rascals and Robbers (Jerry Goldsmith/James Horner)—rare TV scores
Hunters Are for Killing (Jerry Fielding) rare TV movie score
The Ice Pirates (Bruce Broughton)—1980s sci-fi/action comedy score
I Spy, Vol. 2—The LPs (Earle Hagen)
John Goldfarb, Please Come Home! (John Williams)—zany comedy score
Joy in the Morning (Bernard Herrmann)
Julius Caesar (Miklós Rózsa)
Kenner/More Than a Miracle (Piero Piccioni) 3CD set
Khartoum/Mosquito Squadron (Frank Cordell)
Knights of the Round Table/The King’s Thief (Miklós Rózsa) 2CD set
Lassie Come Home: The Canine Cinema Collection (5CD set)
The Last Run/Crosscurrent/The Scorpio Letters (Jerry Goldsmith/Dave Grusin)
The Long, Long Trailer/Forever, Darling (Adolph Deutsch/Bronislau Kaper)
A Man Called Adam (Benny Carter)
A Man Called Horse (Leonard Rosenman)—gorgeous!
Maurice Jarre: Concert Works
Navajo Joe (Ennio Morricone)—fantastic spaghetti western score!
Never So Few/7 Women (Hugo Friedhofer/Elmer Bernstein)
Nightwatch/Killer by Night (John Williams/Quincy Jones)—rare TV scores
None But the Brave (John Williams)—early WWII score
North Dallas Forty (John Scott) classic Nick Nolte football drama
Northwest Passage: Classic Western Scores From M-G-M, Vol. 2 (Stothart, various) 3CD set
Not With My Wife, You Don’t!/Any Wednesday (John Williams/George Duning)
Not With My Wife, You Don’t!, Vol 2 (OST) (John Williams)—early comedy score
Our Mother’s House/The 25th Hour (Georges Delerue)
Penelope/Bachelor in Paradise (Johnny Williams/Henry Mancini) 2CD set, swinging sixties!
Plymouth Adventure (Miklós Rózsa)
Pretty Maids All in a Row (Lalo Schifrin)—bizarre ’70s score, love this!
The Prisoner of Zenda (Alfred Newman) 1952 remake
The Prize (Jerry Goldsmith)—early spy score, great!
The Prodigal (Bronislau Kaper)
Prophecy (Leonard Rosenman)—over-the-top monster bear horror score
Quentin Durward (Bronislau Kaper)
The Return of Dracula/I Bury the Living/The Cabinet of Caligari/Mark of the Vampire (Gerald Fried) 2CD set
Ride Vaquero!/The Outriders (Bronislau Kaper/Andre Previn)
Room 222/Ace Eli and Rodger of the Skies (Jerry Goldsmith)
Saddle the Wind (Elmer Bernstein, plus rejected score by Jeff Alexander)
The Satan Bug: Archival Edition (Jerry Goldsmith)
Scaramouche (Victor Young)
The 7th Sin (Miklós Rózsa)
Sex and the Single Girl/The Chapman Report (Neal Hefti/Leonard Rosenman)
​The Silver Chalice (Franz Waxman) 2CD set—biblical epic with great score!
Some Came Running (Elmer Bernstein)—Sinatra classic
The Space Children/The Colossus of New York (Van Cleave)—two 1950s sci-fi scores
The Spy With My Face: The Man From U.N.C.L.E. Movies (Morton Stevens, Gerald Fried, various)
The Subterraneans (Andre Previn)—magnificent jazz score to stupid beatnik movie
The Swan (Bronislau Kaper)
The Taking of Pelham One Two Three (David Shire) 1974 original
Testament (James Horner)
The Thief Who Came to Dinner (Henry Mancini)—great ’70s crime score!
Tootsie (Dave Grusin)
Toys in the Attic (George Duning)
The Traveling Executioner (Jerry Goldsmith)—great!
Tribute to a Bad Man (Miklós Rózsa)
TV Omnibus: Volume One (Williams, Grusin, many others) 5CD set of rare TV music—amazing line up of great composers, check out the description!
Untamed (Franz Waxman)
Valley of the Kings/Men of the Fighting Lady (Miklós Rózsa)
White Dog (Ennio Morricone)
Whose Life Is It Anyway? (Arthur B. Rubinstein)
The World of Henry Orient (Elmer Bernstein)
The World, the Flesh and the Devil (Miklós Rózsa)
The Wreck of the Mary Deare/Twilight of Honor (George Duning/Johnny Green)
The Wrong Man (Bernard Herrmann)—classic Hitchcock/Herrmann soundtrack

50% OFF! ($10 each for single-disc albums):

Alice's Adventures in Wonderland/Petulia (John Barry)—so good!
Cleopatra Jones/Cleopatra Jones and the Casino of Gold (J.J. Johnson/Dominic Frontiere) funky blaxploitation classics!
Hawkins on Murder/Winter Kill/Babe (Jerry Goldsmith)—rare 1970s TV scores
The Heart Is a Lonely Hunter (Dave Grusin)—so good!
Islands in the Stream (Jerry Goldsmith)—masterpiece!
Logan's Run (Jerry Goldsmith) 1976 sci-fi film—RENEW!!!!
Marathon Man/The Parallax View (Michael Small)
Outland (Jerry Goldsmith) 2CD set
Robinson Crusoe on Mars (Van Cleave) sci-fi classic
The Thing From Another World/Take the High Ground! (Dimitri Tiomkin) sci-fi classic
Where Eagles Dare/Operation: Crossbow (Ron Goodwin) 2CD set—great WWII action scores

25% OFF! ($15 for single-disc albums):

Body Heat (John Barry) 2CD set—neo-noir masterpiece!
CHiPs Vol 3: Season Four (1980-81) (Alan Silvestri) disco motorcycle cop music!
It's Alive (Bernard Herrmann)
King Kong: Deluxe Edition (John Barry) 1976 version, 2CD set
The Man From U.N.C.L.E. Vol 1 (1964-68) (Goldsmith et al.)
Poltergeist (Jerry Goldsmith) 1982 original, 2CD set
Shaft Anthology: His Big Score and More! (Isaac Hayes, Gordon Parks, Johnny Pate) 3CD set
THX 1138 (Lalo Schifrin) sci-fi classic
Twilight Zone: The Movie (Jerry Goldsmith) 1983 anthology film
Under Fire (Jerry Goldsmith) 
The Wild Bunch (Jerry Fielding) Sam Peckinpah western classic, 3CD set
story_txt: Thank You Indiegogo Donors!Lukas Kendall here. It's DONE!I am NOT ASKING for more money to finish SKY FIGHTER!!!The film is IN THE CAN! FINISHED! COMPLETED!Naturally, it cost far more than we originally planned or raised to finish the film. But I couldn't bear to come back to donors with an incomplete film. So I finished it with my MasterCard. INSANE!And yeah, the credit card interest is kicking my ass so I would love it if people found the finished film so entertaining they gave more money. It's up to you!This campaign is the solution to two problems:1) There is one perk left from the 2018 Indiegogo that I have yet to fulfill: the Ron Jones soundtrack CD. Unfortunately this is impossible to fill...because Ron didn't score the film! So the CD will never exist. (See below for more information.)So I owe the 2018 donors something that won't exist...and the only thing I can think of to give them is something with MORE VALUE than originally promised: not only the finished score (by a terrific young composer I was fortunate to meet, Bobby Villarreal) but a Blu-ray of the film itself, packaged as double-disc set—as the 251st FILM SCORE MONTHLY soundtrack release.2) I can't wait to show off the film—but I can't distribute it on the Internet because it will void our eligibility to all-important film festivals. However, I think—I hope—I can give out a private link solely to donors, without running afoul of festival rules.How to Use This CampaignIf you contributed to the 2018 campaign and are waiting for a soundtrack CD...You don't have to do anything! The Blu-ray/soundtrack CD combo will be sent to you automatically later this year (after the film finishes its festival run)!Also, I will email you the private viewing link—as I will be sending that to ALL our 2018 donors so they can view the film.However, if you want to help MORE:1) You can UPGRADE to the autographed copy of the Blu-Ray/soundtrack CD for $15.2) OR, you can buy the new, 2019 discount code package (good at Screen Archives for FSM CDs, Buy Soundtrax and La-La Land Records) for $49.3) OR, you can buy the new, 2019 discount code package (good at Screen Archives for FSM CDs, Buy Soundtrax and La-La Land Records) AND get the autograph UPGRADE for $59.If you are a NEW DONOR:1) Just ignore the choices at the $15 and $59 levels—those involve upgrading a perk from last year that doesn't apply to you.Who Did You Make the Short With?Lots of people and they were soooo amazing! See the credits at IMDB.Our cast are Tom Maden (Scream: TV Series), Jess Gabor (Shameless), Erik Palladino (ER), Declan Churchill Carter (as the younger version of Tom's character) and Richard Epcar (a voice from Robotech and numerous other anime and video game projects).  Crew include Producers Levi Smock, Daniel Marks, Christine Sheaks, Executive Producer Daniel Brandt and Associate Producer Craig Rogers (from our first Indiegogo—thanks Craig!). The spectacular cinematography is by Daniel Marks, the production design by Benjamin Ralston, the VFX by Tobias Richter and The Light Works, costume design by Megan Lian, editing by Robert Meyer Burnett and music by Bobby Villarreal. Many thanks to FSM art director Joe Sikoryak for the titles! And, of course, to the many more people who comprised the crew and helped the production in so many ways—including our 2018 Indiegogo supporters!Our 2018 Indiegogo contributors, with perk to get credit on the film itself:Why No Ron Jones Score?Ron and I just couldn't get on the same page creatively because I wanted a retro synth score, and while he actually did many of the 1980s synth scores that influenced what I wanted, that wasn't where he is at as an artist right now. Also, he lives north of Seattle (he has a beautiful facility called SkyMuse Studios) while I am in Los Angeles, and I can't easily travel with small kids at home. So logistically we had a hard time communicating. I'm truly sorry for the folks expecting a new Ron Jones score—I was too. These things happen!I am so happy with Bobby Villarreal's score and look forward to saying more about him and his music once everybody has a chance to watch the film!Are You Making a Feature Version?I sure hope so! I have written a feature script of SKY FIGHTER (not a continuation of the short, but a longer story based on the same characters and premise) and my producing partners and I are actively trying to get it made. Truly, thank you to all our Indiegogo supporters for giving me the opportunity to direct the short and prove myself as a filmmaker!FSM CDs—The DiscountsFilm Score Monthly was a magazine and record label that I created while in high school (1990) and still exists today as a website and subscription pay site. Between 1996 and 2012 we released 250 albums of classic film and television scores. Today, roughly half the catalog is sold out, with the other half largely out of print and the remaining inventory sold off by our distributor, Screen Archives Entertainment. Whether you are a longtime collector looking to fill holes in your collection, or a neophyte interested in getting a few key collectibles (there are some great sci-fi titles in here, like Logan's Run, Outland and The Thing From Another World), this is a great opportunity to pick up titles at huge discounts! Donate to this Indiegogo campaign and you'll get a discount code for SAE that lets you get up to 75% off most of the remaining catalog.Here's a jingle by Lalo Schifrin (from THX 1138) to get you in the shopping mood!Following are the titles being discounted:75% OFF these titles ($5 each for single-disc albums):36 Hours (Dimitri Tiomkin)Above and Beyond (Hugo Friedhofer)—one of my favorites!All Fall Down/The Outrage (Alex North)The Americanization of Emily/The Sandpiper/Drums of Africa (Johnny Mandel) 3CD setThe Belle of New York (musical)Bell, Book and Candle/1001 Arabian Knights (George Duning)Between Heaven and Hell/Soldier of Fortune (Hugo Friedhofer)The Big Bus (David Shire)—great 1970s disaster comedy score!Big Wednesday (Basil Poledouris)—stirring symphonic score to John Milius surfing movieBroken Lance (Leigh Harline)Cain’s Hundred (Jerry Goldsmith) early TV crime seriesThe Cobweb/Edge of the City (Leonard Rosenman)The Comedians/Hotel Paradiso (Laurence Rosenthal) 2CD setCrossed Swords (Maurice Jarre) great adventure score!David Raksin at M-G-M (5CD set of rare scores)Deadfall (John Barry)Dead Ringer (Andre Previn)—great macabre suspense score!The Devil at 4 O’Clock/The Victors (George Duning/Sol Kaplan)Diamond Head/Gone With the Wave (John Williams/Lalo Schifrin)Diane (Miklós Rózsa) 2CD setDragon Seed (Herbert Stothart)Eye of the Devil (Gary McFarland)—great melodic horror score!The 5,000 Fingers of Dr. T (classic Dr. Seuss musical, Frederick Hollander) 3CD setThe Great Santini (Elmer Bernstein)Green Fire/Bhowani Junction (Miklós Rózsa)The Gypsy Moths (Elmer Bernstein)—beautiful!Home From the Hill (Bronislau Kaper)The Homecoming: A Christmas Story/Rascals and Robbers (Jerry Goldsmith/James Horner)—rare TV scoresHunters Are for Killing (Jerry Fielding) rare TV movie scoreThe Ice Pirates (Bruce Broughton)—1980s sci-fi/action comedy scoreI Spy, Vol. 2—The LPs (Earle Hagen)John Goldfarb, Please Come Home!
